loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita, 51, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, her business partner. She has three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Margarita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is a place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Margarita dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work from her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

She has been in this business for fourteen years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Clorinda Noemy

texts.es:
Clorinda   es una mujer que tiene 21  años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin hijos,  vive  en casa propia con sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Clorinda vive en  el caserío 9 de Octubre  del distrito de Morropón del  departamento de Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, posta médica, colegio, iglesia;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Clorinda es a la cosmetología (corte de cabello, tintes, manicure, entre otros) esto lo realiza en su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Clorinda cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio;  Así mismo sus padres también le apoyan con este negocio 
Actualmente  Clorinda se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en la compra de espejos, tintes y compra de sillas especiales para corte de cabello para niños, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1, 008 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de su negocio establecido; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 21, is a single woman with no children living in her own house with her parents.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also work in agriculture.

Clorinda lives in the 9 de Octubre settlement in Mórrope District, Piura Department.  It has electricity, a medical post, school and church.  All the families living there do so under the same conditions.

Clorinda’s commercial activity is cosmetology (haircuts, hair coloring, manicure, among others) that she provides at home.  It’s worth mentioning that Clorinda has two years’ experience which has allowed her to retain her business’ regular clientele.  Her parents help with the business.

Currently Clorinda has proposed to increase her inventory with the purchase of mirrors, hair coloring and with special chairs for children’s haircuts because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1008 new soles to invest in her established business which in time will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, hair color and chairs for her salon.

loans.name: Valdivia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VALDIVIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Vilma. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pan de laja, producción de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de cordero, taller de cerrajería.

La señora Vilma,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora y sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de cordero, que inicio hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejorar su negocio (compra de carrito de venta), que compraran de la ciudad de El Alto y posterior lo utilizará para trasladar su mercadería. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Valdivia” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Vilma.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have: “pan de laja” [traditional bread baked in stone ovens] sales, food sales, blanket sales, neighborhood store, lamb sales and locksmith shop.

Vilma indicates that this is the first cycle she’s worked in Pro Mujer having joined invited by one of the advisors and by her fellow members.  She currently has a business selling lamb that she started years ago having learned it from her sister.

The loan she’ll take out now is to improve her business.  She’ll buy a sales cart in the city of El Alto which she’ll then use to transport her merchandise.  

This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in any way possible.

loans.use: to buy a sales cart.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is 52 years old.  He is a married man who has 10 children, two of whom are enrolled in school.  He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor running water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, he has been buying livestock, fattening them and selling them to his customers at the market.  The major challenge Bakari faces is seasonality as there is not enough grass to graze the livestock during dry seasons.  He dreams to be able to hire employees to look after his livestock.

With the loan of 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase additional cows to sell.  He decided to join Yehu in order to gain access to loans to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase cows for his livestock business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and other equipment for her fishing business.

Lorna has been in this business for 14 years. Lorna earns more income from a general store.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emmanuel   es un hombre que tiene 23  años de edad, de estado civil casado, con un hijo a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Emanuel vive en  el caserío San Isidro   del distrito 	de Mòrrope y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Emanuel es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Emanuel cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a  la venta de chicha de jora donde   le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente Emanuel se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1, 500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y arreglo de corrales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Emmanuel, 23, is a married man with a son in his care living in his own house with his spouse.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also work in agriculture.  

Emmanuel lives in the San Isidro settlement in Mórrope District, Lambayeque Department.  He has electricity and water comes from an artisanal well; all families living there do so under the same conditions.

Emmanuel’s commercial activity is raising pigs, sheep and barnyard fowl in corrals outside his house.  It’s worth mentioning that Emmanuel has two years’ experience which has allowed him to retain his business’ regular clientele.  He sells his animals to local wholesalers and his wife also works making “chicha de jora” [beverage made from fermented corn] which generates additional income.

Emmanuel has proposed at present to increase his inventory with respect to the animal sales because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone which is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1500 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to repair the corrals which in time will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and to repair corrals.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more drinking water to sell to her customers.

Jennifer has been in this business for six years. Jennifer earns more income from a local eatery (carinderia).

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 62 years old and widowed with 3 children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like detergent, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

Letecia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from dressmaking.

Letecia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like detergent, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en: Srey Neang, 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs a business purchasing junk materials for resale. He earns about $7 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $6 per day. In order to provide better living conditions for her family, Srey Neang is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase timber to rebuild her present house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timber to rebuild her present house.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. Ma. Fe is widowed and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines.

Ma. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 4 years now and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 60-year-old widow with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

Nenita has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 29 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 29 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent au même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Christiane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans. Christiane est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Christiane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Christiane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Christiane vend depuis cinq ans du bois de chauffage et de façon secondaire de vernis à son domicile. Christiane s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Christiane sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 29. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO 29 is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings group. The group’s representative is Christiane, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Christiane, age 35, is married to a man named Didier. She never went to school. The couple have three dependent children, some of whom go to school. Christiane lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together. To that end, Christiane started selling firewood from her home five years ago. She also sells varnish. She buys her merchandise in a region of Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction and bolster her activity, Christiane is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group GBENONKPO 29. This credit will help them to meet customer demand and boost their profits.

loans.use: to buy firewood and varnish for resale.

loans.name: Elena Rosibel

texts.es:
La Señora Elena Rosibel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 55 años. Ella se dedica a la realización de recorridos escolares en los colegios aledaños, este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño microbús actualmente tiene tres microbuses y realiza los recorridos en 7 colegios. 
El crédito lo invertirá en combustible y reparaciones a los microbuses.
texts.en: Elena Rosibel is a 55-year-old, hardworking, enterprising woman. She runs a bus service for the neighborhood schools. She started the business with one micro bus and now has three that serve 7 schools. She will use the loan to purchase fuel and do repairs on the micro buses.

loans.use: to buy fuel and do repairs.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo emprendedor tiene por nombre “La Esperanza 2”, todas las miembros vieron una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias por medio del programa de la fundación paraguaya.  Es así que ya están en el quinto ciclo, trabajando todas ellas en un ambiente de cooperación.
Nilda es la presidenta del grupo,  y por medio de su ayuda a las compañeras han podido ir adelante, es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de ser mejor y también de ayudar a sus compañeras. Ella vende todo tipo de ropas, y gracias a su negocio puede también ayudar a su familia, y darles todo lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su sueño es poder tener un salón donde vender sus prendas. Acudió a nosotros para solicitar un crédito, el que quiere invertir en la compra de ropas de invierno, ya que se viene  el frio y ya quiere tener buena variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This enterprising group is called “La Esperanza 2” [The Hope 2].  All of the members saw a great opportunity for themselves and their families through the Fundación Paraguaya program.  This is why they are already in their fifth loan cycle, all of them working in a cooperative environment. 

Nilda is the president of the group and with her help, her fellow group members have been able to get ahead.  She is a very enthusiastic person and seeks to better herself and also to help her fellow group members.  She sells all types of clothes and thanks to her business she can also help her family and give them everything they need in their daily lives. 

Her dream is to be able to have a store to sell her clothes.  She came to us to request a loan to purchase winter clothes because it will be cold soon and she wants to have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rudalie

texts.en:
Rudalie, 29, works hard to provide for her family. She is married and has one child. For the past two years Rudalie has run a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling personal products.

Rudalie has received and paid back four loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Rudalie’s ambition is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with 2 children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending and vegetables vending.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
This is Zita, 56, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Felipe, her business partner, and a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zita operates a handicrafts business. What she basically does is buy raw materials used in handicrafts-making from suppliers, manufactures them into different products, and sells them per-piece for a profit. Products range from lanterns, lampshades, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zita dreams to expand her business and help her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and married with 2 children.

Tessie is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Tessie has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 43 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Estrellita works very hard to provide for them.

Estrellita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Estrellita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Erika Hilda

texts.es: Erika tiene 30 años vive en Playas pero nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 2 hijas, solo una estudia en la escuela. Hace 9 años vive con ellas en su casa propia, es de caña pero nos cuenta que al menos se libra de pagar un alquiler. Hace 4 años empezó vendiendo sabanas, toallas y edredones recorriendo el barrio. Como es bachiller en administración dice que le a servido lo aprendido ya que ahora vende en varios sectores de la cuidad. Labora desde las 9 am hasta las 5 pm de lunes a viernes. Dificultades no tiene por el momento pero si le gustaría tener una forma de movilizarse para no caminar tanto. El crédito lo va a emplear comprando la mercadería que vende. Su meta futura es mejorar su vivienda con un local asi mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Erika is 30 and lives in Playas, though she was born in Guayaquil. She has two daughters, one of whom is in school. For 9 years, she has lived with them in her own home, which is thatched but at least she doesn't have to pay rent. 

She has been selling sheets, comforters, and towels door-to-door in her neighborhood for 4 years. Since she has a bachelor's degree in business she says that what she learned has served her well, as she is now selling in other parts of the city. She works from 9 am until 5 pm Monday through Friday. She doesn't face any challenges at the moment, but she would like to have another means of transport so that she would not have to walk so much. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to sell. Her goal is to make improvements to her house as she increases her income.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, and towels.

loans.name: Shirley Vanessa

texts.es: Shirley nació en Huaquillas hace 27 años. En la actualidad vive en el Fortín, barrio suburbano de Guayaquil. Es bachiller, tiene 2 niños de 5 y 10 años que asisten a la escuela. Tiene 7 años viviendo en la Coop. Balerio Estacio donde tiene su casa propia hecha de caña. El negocio lo aprendió cuando vivía con su esposo ya que juntos habían abierto una farmacia. Al separarse termino sus estudios y abrió en su casa el negocio para poder cuidar a sus hijos. Como es mujer le preocupa la delincuencia que existe en el barrio aunque gracias a Dios no le  pasado nada. Con el préstamo va a comprar mercadería como medicina, pañales, leches etc., desea aumentar sus ingresos y empezar a construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en: Shirley was born in Huaquillas 27 years ago.  Now she lives in Fortín, a suburb of Guayaquil.  She's single and has two children ages 5 and 10 who are in school.  She has been living for 7 years in the Coop in Balerio Estacio, where she has her own house made ​​of cane. She learned how to operate a business while living with her ​​husband and together they opened a pharmacy.  Upon separating, she concluded her studies and opened a business in her home so that she would be able to care for her children.  As a woman, she is concerned about crime in the neighborhood although thankfully nothing has happened to her so far.  With the loan she will buy merchandise such as medicine, diapers, milk, etc.  She wants to increase her income so that she can start building a house made of cement.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and diapers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Chon, 32, is a hardworking wife and mother of two school-age children. For many years she has fabricated pestles and grinders from mortar. She also works with her husband on their rice farm. The couple helps each other out in order to provide their children with an education. They want to support them until they become university graduates.

Chon is requesting a 2,500,000 KHR loan from HKL to buy more mortar so she can increase her production and profits. She wants to save money for family emergencies and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more mortar.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny, 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and breeding pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are garment workers who earn about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Vanny is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase more pigs to breed and re-sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to breed and re-sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Esterlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Esterlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Jaide

texts.en:
Jaide is 29 years old and married. Jaide works very hard to provide for them.

Jaide runs a "sari-sari" or variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Jaide has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Jaide would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 44 years old, married and has one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lagrimas has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

Lagrimas has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a machine shop.  Narcisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
Garnet is 45 years old and married with 2 children.

Garnet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Garnet has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Garnet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 57 years old and married with 4 children.

Anaclita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Anaclita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa (woven palm mats) retail business for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Anaclita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She catches and sells fish, as well as earning money from her body massage work.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

Salvacion hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma.jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma.Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Ma.Jocelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Ma.Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. Leah is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leah is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit Cookstove needs less fuel to cook food.

Leah is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 39 years old and married with 2 children.

Vevencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Vevencia has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a furniture shop.

Vevencia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and married with 5 children. With 4 children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as cream, sugar, snack foods, eggs, etc.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Someng

texts.en: Someng, 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $4 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. In order to improve her family’s finances, Someng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new concrete house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (in the photo) is 46 years old and her husband, Sokun, is 47 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. One is an English teacher and the others are in school. 

Ny is a garment worker, while her husband is a soldier.  Ny is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to teach because the old one breaks often.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to teach.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 34 years old, married and has two children. For the past six years he has sold French beans, peas and vegetables to earn a living.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown due to his training in good customer relations. He is now requesting a 90,000 KES loan to buy more French beans and peas to sell. His ambition is to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more French beans and peas to sell.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky, 55, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a commune consultant who earns about $2 per day. One of her children is a tailor who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Ky is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase beds, tables and other furniture to re-sell. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. She would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase beds, tables, and other furniture to re-sell.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny, 41, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than six years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $6 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Ny is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 56 years old and dairy farmer. She is a widowed with four children. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 12 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Esther will use the loan to buy animal feed. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Muthengi

texts.en:
Muthengi is 27 years old and single. He runs a hardware business to earn a living. He uses his bicycle to supply orders to his clients. He has been operating the business for four years. Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, he has improved his business.
Muthengi hopes to fully establish his business in the future. He needs 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy paint and nails.

loans.use: to buy paint and nails.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 48, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. Sok wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years old, married and has two children. He has been offering services such as printing, photocopy and typesetting to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He has improved his business through the skills he has gained from Faulu Kenya on business management skills.

David hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en: Chamroeun, 33, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a mobile phone company. He earns about $8 per day. Her children are still in her care and are in school. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Chamroeun is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en compañía de Carlos, su esposo, desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos; Joshel, Billy, Jesenia y Lizbeth; a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de San Pedro de Saño.

La actividad económica de Rosa es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, los cuales enseba para luego venderlos a mayor precio. Además comparte su tiempo con el tejido de prendas a base de lana de alpaca; como chompas, chalinas, gorros y demás prendas de vestir. Le gusta mucho su labor y tiene clientes fijos, los cuales compran las hermosas prendas que elabora. Su deseo es realizar tejidos con diseños nuevos, pues quiere abrir una tienda donde los pueda exhibir. Sabe que lo logrará, ya que además su esposo trabaja como albañil y sus ganancias pueden solventar las necesidades de la familia.

Ella pertenece al grupo “San Pedro” y éste es el undécimo crédito con MFP, donde espera continuar con sus objetivos. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Rosa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madejas de lana, y otra parte la usará para mejorar el baño de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman who has been living with her husband Carlos for 17 years. They have 4 children--Joshel, Billy, Jesenia, and Lizbeth--whom they care for in their own home on the outskirts of San Pedro de Saño.

Rosa raises and fattens small livestock such as guinea pigs and hens so that they can be sold at higher prices. She also weaves alpaca wool garments: sweaters, scarves, hats, and other apparel. She loves her work and has repeat customers that buy the beautiful garments she makes. Her dream is to create cloths with unique designs and would like to have a shop where she could show them.  She believes she will achieve this because her husband also works as a mason and their income covers their household expenses.

She belongs to the “San Pedro” group, and this is their 11 loan cycle with MFP, where they hope to keep meeting their objectives. She once again promises to make her payments on time and is grateful to be part of this communal bank because all the members are responsible and caring. Rosa will use a portion of the loan to buy skeins of wool and the other part to make improvements to the bathroom in her house.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 44, is a widow with two children, a son and daughter, who are garment factory workers. The family lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She earns an income by selling traditional Khmer desserts in front of a garment factory.

Because he does not have his own transportation, Sophal’s son needs to share a motorbike with his neighbors to get to the factory. For this reason she is asking for her first loan of 1,500 USD from MAXIMA to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es:
El grupo el aguacate lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Silvia del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y comida desde hace 4 años e invertirá el crédito en mercadería en ropa (camisas, panatalones, jeans, blusas) y granos básicos, carne…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Eloisa y Blanca las cuales se dedica desde hace varios años al comercio de ropa variada.
texts.en:
The group "el Aguacate" [The Avocado] comprises three hardworking, enterprising members. One of them is Silvia del Carmen, who has been selling clothing and foodstuffs for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy merchandise (shirts, pants, jeans, and blouses) and basic grains, meats, etc.

The other members are Eloisa and Blanca, who have also been selling a variety of apparel items for several years.

loans.use: to buy apparel (shirts, pants, jeans, and blouses) and basic grains, meats, etc.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 43 years old, married and has six children. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop and managed to employ one person. She is also a farmer.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mwikali has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She is now requesting 20,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es:
Pedro   es un hombre que tiene  32años de edad, de estado civil  soltero, además  cuenta con 01 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Pedro vive en  el  distrito de Morropón del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 800 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Pedro  es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su  domicilio , donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo también su cònyuge  esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  Pedro   cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio.  
Actualmente Pedro se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,508 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes);  lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 32 years old, and is in a civil union. He has one son, who depends on him. He lives in a rural, subsistence community, where the majority of the residents are independent workers who work in various trades, raising animals, and working in agriculture. Pedro lives in the Morropón District in the Department of Piura, which has access to electricity, water and drainage. Their community consists of 800 families.

Pedro makes a living selling basic staple goods, such as: rice, sugar, beans, eggs, milk, oil, pasta, detergent, candies, drinks, etc. He runs his business out of his home, and he attends clients there. His partner works raising barnyard birds in corrals outside their home. Pedro has three years of experience in his business, which has allowed him to build and maintain his customer base. 

Presently, Pedro wants to increase his inventory for his business, as well as expand their operation raising animals, since it is a very profitable activity in the area. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,508 nuevos soles, which he will invest in purchasing merchandise for their businesses. In time, he hopes this investment will allow him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Munkhtuul

texts.en:
Munkhtuul is a 35-year-old married woman with three daughters.  She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  The ger district Munkhtuul and her family live in is outside of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia and lacks basic infrastructure.  

Her three daughters all attend school, one is in college, one is in high school and one is in kindergarten. Munkhtuul works 3-4 days at a local bus company; she would like to operate her own taxi service business the other three day of the week.  She is requesting a loan for 3.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase a car to operate a taxi service in order to increase her family's income. She says she would like to build a savings fund to build a new house for her lovely daughters.  Munkhtuul emotionally states that if her daughters are happy and safe, she will became the happiest mother in the world.

loans.use: to buy a car to operate a taxi service in order to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha is 49 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than six years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed, one in a garment factory and the other in Malaysia, they earn about $15 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pha is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation. The borrowed money will enable Pha to gain the needed security to start a new business and earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children receive a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Torn is 44 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a palm juice vendor who earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are garment workers who earn about 6 per day. Due to lack of funds, Torn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a computer for her son to use in his university studies. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her son to use in his university studies.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las hormiguitas las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque dicen ser muy trabajadoras y perseverantes para alcanzar lo que  se proponen, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora amada ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 30 años de edad y está casada con el señor Andrés con quien tiene 4 hijos, quienes cursan primero, cuarto y sexto año de primaria y el menor esta en segundo año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida manteles hace 10 años.

Doña amada se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darle una muy buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mas insumos como son: jitomates, chiles, cebollas, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, maíz, carnes, etc.

El sueño que ella tiene es el de construir un local para poner un pequeño restaurante, y así continuar con sus ventas, tenerla mucho mas surtida y con más variedad de platillos, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios ya que así tendrán una buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho, su vida y la de su familia también cambiara.

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: celiflora inocencia-abarrotes, Yolanda-tienda de ropa, lisbeth-tienda de ropa, divina-venta de frutas y verduras y amada-venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Hormiguitas" (The Little Ants). The members of the group decided upon this name because they are hardworking and persevering whenever they set out to accomplish something. They decided this name would match up with the qualities of their group.

The story being presented is that of Sra. Amada, one of the members of this group. She is 30 years old and married to Sr. Andrés. They have four children, three of whom are in the first, fourth, and sixth grades. The youngest one is in the second year of preschool. Amada has been preparing and selling food for 10 years. Doña Amada decided to go into this business because she was looking for a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She also wanted to provide a very good education for her young children. Amada will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, salt, rice, beans, corn, meat, and other ingredients.

She dreams of building a shop where she can open a small restaurant and continue her sales. Amada wants to have more inventory so that she can prepare a wider variety of dishes. This will help her generate more income so that she can continue supporting her children with their studies and help them to achieve a professional career. Amada is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for their support by providing this loan. As a result, her business will begin to experience great improvement. Her life and that of her family will also change.

The members of the group and their businesses are listed below: • Celifora Inocencia sell groceries. • Yolanda manages a clothing store. • Lisbeth manages a clothing store. • Divina sells fruits and vegetables. • Amada sells food.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, salt, rice, beans, corn, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a 52-year-old married man with eight children, six of whom are in school. He operates a grocery where he sells his goods at the market. He has been in this business for the last ten years, and he aspires to open a kiosk in future. Anderson owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.  He faces a major challenge during the dry season as vegetables and fruits become scarce. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

With the loan of KES 20000, he will be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Sebastiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapas, juegos electrónicos, confección de polleras, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

La señora Sebastiana, indica que  hace año y medio que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promotores de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de plástico que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumentar su capital (compra de materiales de plástico)  mismo que comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en las comunidades de la las comunidades del departamento de La Paz. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene ocho hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el área de salud y los pagos pacientes.
texts.en:
The Community Association “ESTRELLITAS” (Little Stars), is in its second program cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Villa Adela Center. This group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Sebastiana is president. The members all work in various businesses, including: sales of salchipapas (a hot dog and fried potatoes dish), electronic games, shawl making, food sales, fruit sales, etc.

Sebastiana became a member of the Pro Mujer association about a year and a half ago. She was invited to join by the institution’s promoters. She presently makes a living selling plastic materials, a business that she has had for some time. 

She plans to utilize the support from this loan to purchase additional materials for her business, which she will buy in the markets in La Paz, and then resell in the communities in her area. This work helps her to support her family. She is single and has eight children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sebastiana commented that she likes the savings, as well as their work in health and patient payments.

loans.use: to purchase plastic materials.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is 59 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about 2 USD per day. Her children are employed. They earn about 9 USD per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Chan is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future she would like to run a tailoring shop for her daughter and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Tessito Gadamayo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en janvier 1998 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de braves femmes qui sont issues du même quartier, ce groupe est caractérisé par sa solidarité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Assise  à gauche de la photo et la main levée  madame  est l’emprunteur vedette  responsable du groupe. Elle  âgée de 48 ans, est  mariée et mère de cinq enfants qu’elle prend en charge. 
Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés communément appelés « THIOUB » qu’elle achète dans la sous région et d’encens plus connu sous l’appellation de « THIOURAYE ». Elle vend ses produits par placement qui n’excède pas de mois. Très rompue à la tâche, elle jouit d’une très bonne connaissance de cette activité pour l’avoir  pratiqué depuis plus de 10 ans.  
Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en tissus et encens pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et constituer une épargne considérable pour d’éventuels investissements
texts.en:
The group was formed in January 1998 at the inauguration of their banc villageois.  It is made up of women from the same neighborhood and is characterized by solidarity.  The women's primary business is small-scale sales.

The client seated at left in the photo, with her hand raised, is the group leader.  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children in her care.  She sells dyed fabric called "thioub", which she buys in the area, and incense known as "thiouraye".  She sells her products in an investment cycle no longer than two months.  Very experienced in this area, she knows her business well after having run it for more than ten years.  This new loan will allow her to buy a sufficient amount of fabric and incense to re-sell.

With the profit from her business, she plans to support her husband in paying for their children's education, and to put away a considerable sum for future investments.

loans.use: to buy fabric and incense to sell.

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidad lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ella es Rosa Argentina quien se dedica a la venta de chiverías y frutas desde hace 5 años en un colegio.  El crédito lo invertirá en gaseosas, meneítos, mango, jocote…etc. para surtir su pequeño kiosko.
Rosa está casada con Ronaldo quien es transportista y con quien tiene cuatro hijos por los cuales ambos trabajan arduamente.
Las otras integrantes son Cecilia quien tiene una pulpería e invertirá en granos básicos y Marina quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
Unidad Group ("unity") is composed of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Rosa Argentina who has been selling snacks and fruit at a school for five years. She will invest her loan in soft drinks, cheese puffs, mangoes, cashew nuts, etc. to stock up her small stand. Rosa is married to Ronaldo, a road haulier, with whom she has four children. Both parents work arduously to provide for them.

The other group members are Celia, who owns a grocery and will invest her loan share in staple grains, and Marina, who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for six years.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cheese puffs, mangoes, cashew nuts, etc. to stock up her small stand.

loans.name: Kambeng Doumassou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration du. Il est composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Une bonne entente anime la vie de groupe.

Madame Aminata assise au milieu dans la photo et en médaillon en bas à droite  est l’emprunteur vedette. Elle est âgée de 65 ans, est  mariée et mère de dix enfants dont trois garçons et de sept filles. Très déterminée, elle achète des articles vestimentaires en gros pour la revente dans son quartier et les quartiers environnants. Elle est très expérimentée dans l’activité commerciale.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour l’écouler dans le marché local.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte appuyer ses enfants dans leur différente activité.
texts.en:
The Kambeng Doumassou Banc Villageois group was created on November 15, 2006, at the inauguration of the banc villageois.  It is made up of women who are very active in business, particularly small-scale sales.  The members have a good group relationship.

Aminata, seated in the center and also pictured in the corner inset of the photo, is the featured borrower.  She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of ten children, three boys and seven girls.  Very determined, she buys clothing wholesale to re-sell in her neighborhood and nearby neighborhoods.  She is very experienced in this business.

Her new loan will allow her to buy enough inventory to sell on the local market.  With the profits, she plans to support her children in their various activities.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell on the local market.

loans.name: Johanna Del Rocio

texts.es:
Johanna  , tiene 30 años  es soltera  y actualmente vive en Guayaquil con sus padres,
Su negocio lo inicio hace 9 años , comenzó en la bahía donde compro ropa y la vendió en los mercados cercanos a su barrio y a personas conocidas le ofreció sus ropas variadas, su trabajo lo desempeña los fines de semanas en horas de la mañana  hasta el medio día , ya que de lunes a viernes tiene un trabajo fijo en unas cabinas telefónicas con eso se ayuda en su economía.
No tiene dificultades en su trabajo, solo enfermarse ya que esto conllevaría  a que no pueda salir a negociar su mercadería , con el préstamo va a mejorar su inventario para poder ofrecer mejor calidad de ropa y mayor  variedad .
Su sueño es poder tener un negocio propio en cual pueda vender y ropa y utilizarlo como cabinas telefónicas ya que sabe el manejo.
texts.en:
Johanna is 30 years old, and is single and lives in Guayaquil with her parents. She started her own business nine years ago, and started in the main markets where she buys clothing and then resells it in the neighborhoods around her home to people she knows. She works on her clothing business on the weekends, since she has another job during the week at a store that owns and operates public telephone booths. These jobs help her generate income to help with expenses and her finances.  

She does not have difficulties with her jobs, but she has had some health challenges, and those challenges mean that she cannot get out as much to negotiate for good clothing merchandise. This loan will help her to improve her inventory so that she can offer a better variety and higher quality product to her clients. 

Her dream is to have her own business and to a physical space of her own for the business. She hopes that space will work for both her clothing sales and to offer telephone booth services, since she knows how to operate and manage them.

loans.use: to buy her own space for her business.

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es: Gabriela  es cliente  distinguida  de la institución,  a lo largo  de sus créditos se  ha  caracterizado  por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de  pagos, ella  en este  momento   se  acerco a la  institución  ya que  requiere  realizar   mejoras  en su  cocina quiere   colocar azulejo en las  paredes   , además  de  construir  una  barra   de   concreto, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de su  proyecto  ya  que    tendrá  mayor  comodidad   al  cocinar.
texts.en: Gabriela is a distinguished loan recipient, as she has consistently shown a record of making on time payments. She is presently requesting a loan to help with improvements to her kitchen, as she wants to install ceiling tiles, and construct a concrete bar for additional work space. She is grateful for the support she has received for her project, and looks forward to enjoying a more comfortable working space in her kitchen.

loans.use: to hang ceiling tiles, and construct a concrete bar in her kitchen.

loans.name: Orlando David

texts.es: Orlando es de Quevedo y tiene 24 años. Su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos en el tiempo libre ya que cuida a su hijo. Orlando nos cuenta que en los próximos meses volverá a recibir la visita de la cigüeña ya que su esposa está embarazada. Inicio su negocio hace 2 años cuando su cuñado le enseño la venta de ropa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. También sabe de soldadura con ello elabora puertas metálicas junto a su tío. Como su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio no presenta mayor inconvenientes. El crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de ropa y una maquina de soldar para aumentar la venta de puertas y ventanas. En un futuro Orlando planea abrir su propio taller y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is from Quevedo and is 24 years of age. His wife sells cosmetics in her free time and also takes care of their son. Within the the next few months, Orlando says the stork will be paying him a visit since his wife is pregnant. He started his business two years ago when his brother-in-law introduced him to the clothing retail trade, and now his venture has grown. Orlando also knows how to weld, so he produces metal doors along with his uncle. Since he manages his business from home, Orlando does not face any major problems.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy clothing and a welding machine so that he can increase his sales of doors and windows. In the future, Orlando plans to open his own workshop so that he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and a welding machine for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes  es un hombre que tiene 42  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 3 hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Hermes vive en  el caserío José Olaya del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Hermes es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Hermes cuenta con 12 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta dedicado a la agricultura donde tiene instalado 1.0 ha. De cultivo de limón donde   le permite tener otro ingresos
Actualmente Hermes se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de fertilizantes y pago de jornales de su cultivo instalado; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hermes is 42 years old, is in a civil union, and has three children who depend on him. Their family lives in their own home.  Their community is a rural, subsistence community, and the majority of people are independent workers who make a living raising animals and working in agriculture. 

Hermes lives in the José Olava community in the district of Tambogrande, Department of Piura. Their community has access to basic services like electricity and water from a well. All the families in the area live in the same conditions. 

Hermes makes a living raising pigs, goats and birds in corrals outside his home, and has been raising animals for twelve years. He has built and maintained his client base for his business, and he sells animals to wholesalers in the area. He also is a farmer, and has planted one hectare of lemon trees to generate additional income.

Presently, Hermes wants to increase his inventory in his animal business, as it is a very profitable trade in the region. He is requesting a loan from Edpyma Alternativa in the amount of  1,000 nuevos soles, which he will invest in purchasing fertilizers and maintaining his crops. In time, he hopes this support will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maintain his crops and animal sales business.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed, 30 years old and a married man, still has no children.

Majed has built a small kiosk over a cart in an active main road in Al Mafraq to sell hot drinks. He has applied for this youth loan to bring in more types of hot drinks like hot chocolate, and different herb teas. In the future Majed wants to have his cafe be one that would serve hot and cold drinks.

loans.use: to bring in more types of hot drinks

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 37 years old and a married woman. Her husband became a pick-up driver after he retired from his first job, to be able to support their big family as they have four sons and four daughters.

Amneh also wanted to participate in helping  her husband support the family, so she started a small retail business buying and selling shoes and footwear, and recently she added birds sales to what she does, too.

Now Amneh has applied for this loan in order to buy more birds and cages to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more birds and cages

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a Khmer traditional medicine vendor who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phorn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more traditional medicine to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new timber house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more traditional medicine to resell

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 19 Group

texts.en:
Nuraeni has been selling 'Gado-gado' (Indonesian mixed vegetables with peanut sauce) in front of her house for five years. She has already faced the challenge that her business goes up and down depending on the weather. She likes to run this business because she can help her husband who works as a laborer in a port to create more income for her family. 

Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more ingredients to make 'gado-gado' and 'soto' to sell. Other group members are selling fried snacks, chicken noodles, daily basic needs and opening an internet cafe.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make 'gado-gado' (Indonesian mixed vegetables with peanut sauce) and 'soto' (chicken soup) to sell

loans.name: Jessica Milagro

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura y venden fruta en el mercado de su ciudad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y en especial se cultiva el algodón, el plátano, maíz, entre otros; Jessica es una joven a la cual le gusta trabajar, sobre todo porque sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña lo que significaba el ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente; hace ya tres años Jessica se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca, al inicio le fue un poco difícil manejar su negocio pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y mas aun que con esfuerzo ahora tiene 5 vacas, a las cuales cuida mucho como si fueran hijas suyas; en una ocasión una de sus vacas la empujo y cayó muy duro al suelo, ello cuando recién aprendió a ordeñar las vacas; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo que cuida mucho a sus vacas y por ello siempre le dan buena leche.

Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá una vaca, con esta mejora podrá aumentar su producción de leche y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su ms grande sueño:” Ser el orgullo de sus padres y tener un establo de vacas y seguir creciendo en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young, 25-year-old woman who lives with her parents, who both work in agriculture and sell fruit in the city market. Their home is located in the city of Imperial, and is known for its hot climate and the cultivation of cotton, plantains, corn and other staples. Jessica is a hardworking person, and her parents taught her from a young age what it meant to work hard to make a living and to work for your daily bread. 

Three years ago, Jessica started selling cow’s milk. At the beginning, it was difficult to manage the business, but little by little she learned how to grow her operation, and she now has five cows that she takes care of as if they were her own children. One time, one of her cows knocked her over and she had a hard fall. She recently learned how to milk the cows, and she believes that her business is going so well because she is very kind to her clients and takes good care of her cows so that they give good milk. 

Jessica is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which has allowed her to buy a cow and increase her milk production and income. She works hard every day in hopes of one day accomplishing her dream of making her parents proud, having a stable for her cows and a growing business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 38 años, vive con Luis, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años. Ella y su familia habitan en su casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Hasta los 24 años Miriam se dedicaba a la agricultura, al lado de sus padres. Cuando inició una nueva vida con Luis, y su primer hijo, sus necesidades económicas aumentaron. De esta manera decidió dedicarse al tejido como negocio. Adquirió telares artesanales y eléctricos y empezó a vender lo que elaboraba. También, gracias a sus estudios en la escuela de Bellas Artes aprendió a pintar. Ahora ya cuenta con un taller de tejidos y pintura, donde trabaja todo el día, y cuando los pedidos son mayores tiene que trasnochar, “lo importante es que no falta trabajo”, menciona.
Con esta actividad puede otorgarle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor, y espera que siga siendo así cuando sus hijos sean mayores y sus exigencias en la educación aumenten.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por esa razón menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro”, porque sus socias son constantes y emprendedoras.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar sus tejidos y sus pinturas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old, and lives with Luis and their two children, ages 13 and 14. She and her family live in their own house in the district of San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Until she was 24 years old, Miriam made a living working in agriculture with her parents. When she began a new life with Luis and their first son, their financial needs increased. She therefore decided to begin a weaving business. She acquired artisan and electric looms and began to sell her handiwork. Also, thanks to her studies at an arts school, she learned to paint. She now has a painting and weaving workshop where she works every day, and even some nights, when she has many customer orders. She believes that, “it is important never to be short of work.”

With this business she can help provide for her family and give them a better quality of life. She hopes things will continue work out even when her children are grown and have educational expenses.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she has always been punctual in making monthly payments. She is an active member in the community bank, “Mujeres al Futuro: (Women for the Future), and she enjoys the companionship of other kind, entrepreneurial women. With the support from this loan, she plans to buy the necessary materials to make her weavings and paintings.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving and painting.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, Rolando, y su hijo de 23 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos artesanales, los cuales vende en un puesto ubicado en el centro de su distrito. A la vez, comercia manualidades, tapices, cerámicas, adornos para el hogar, etc. De esta manera su clientela se siente atraída por las novedades.
“Casi 10 años me dedico al tejido y me gusta porque puedo crear nuevos modelos”, asegura.
Las ventas dependen de la constancia que ella tenga al ofrecer sus productos, por eso la mayor parte del día se encuentra en su puesto de ventas.
Su esposo llega del trabajo de la mina cada 20 días, y cuando esto sucede se dedican al cuidado de sus cultivos, ya que también siembran papas.
Nora es muy empeñosa, gracias a esta virtud, piensa ampliar su puesto de ventas y ofrecer más artículos.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad para continuar con sus metas. Dentro de su grupo colabora con puntualidad en sus pagos y reuniones.
Nora invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de lana de oveja y de alpaca para realizar sus próximos tejidos.
texts.en:
Nora, age 46, lives with her husband, Roland, and her 23 year old son.  They live in their own house in the San Pedro de Cajas district in Tarma.

She makes hand-woven items that she sells at a stand in the center of her district.
