loans.use: to buy trees for firewood cutting

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en: Ulziisaihan is a 33-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His older daughter studies at the secondary school. He started running a public transportation business in 2009 based on his driving experience as a bus driver for the state company. He owns a mini bus. His wife helps with the business activities. Now, the business activities are stable and the business has been profitable to feed the family. But due to a state law prohibiting mini bus services, he is planning to replace the mini bus with a bigger one. Ulziisaihan is an honest man who says "I have a bigger plan to improve my family livelihood level and to expand my business activities by replacing the mini bus". He is requesting a total amount of 1,500,000 MNT to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 45 years old and a single mother of two. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She employs two people. She also farms to supplement her income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills.

Dorcas needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 31 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his family; his wife, Sophio, a 3-year-old daughter and his parents. Shalva and his father lead the agricultural business of the family. They grow greens on a family owned plot of land and in a small greenhouse. Shalva sells harvested products in the Kutaisi (nearby town) open market. The family also owns a tractor, which is out of order and doesn’t work. Shalva’s mother has chronic health problems and receives a relevant pension from the government. Total average monthly income of the family is 250 lari. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Shalva requested credit for repairing the tractor. After it is fixed, Shalva will perform various agricultural services, including tilling the plots. He will get orders from neighborhood farms and will be paid for providing services. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. The tractor will become a new source of  income for the family. They will earn on average 200 lari per month. It will mean an 80% increase in the family’s monthly income. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and in addition to the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor repairing service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is engaged in a trading business of souvenirs, household goods, cosmetics, toys and soft toys, sunglasses, etc. in Sevan. She has been running her business about 4 years. Lilit rents a stall at a market and she buys merchandise from suppliers. As Lilit’s stall has a varied choice of goods, she always has many customers. Lilit says that her business goes well especially during holidays when demand for gifts (souvenirs, perfumes, toys) is very high.  

Lilit is 26 years old and she lives in Sevan with her little son and mother-in-law. Lilit’s husband temporarily lives and works in Russia. Lilit’s business allows her to provide the major part of her family’s needs.

Lilit is asking for a 1,050,000 Armenian dram loan to enlarge the toy, soft toy and perfume assortment of her shop.

loans.use: to enlarge the toy, soft toy and perfume assortment of her shop

loans.name: Sanobarkhon

texts.ru: Санобархон  –участница группы «Ак-жолтой», ей 42 года, мать 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Санобархон занимается животноводством и полеводством.  На сегодняшний день Санобархон имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели и 0,24 га земли, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санобархон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и удобрений. Доходы Санобархон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Sanobarkhon is a member of the Ak-Joltoy group. She is 42 and a mother of 2 children. To provide a source of income for her family, Sanobarkhon raises livestock and grows crops. Presently, her farm has 2 dairy cows and 2 heifers, as well as 0.24 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn. In order to continue developing her business, Sanobarkhon has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle and some fertilizer. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fertilizers

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится зарубежом. Сама Рано занимается шитьем. Она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Rano lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is presently abroad. Rano is a seamstress. She has been doing work to order in her home for the past 10 years. She is taking this loan to purchase fabrics and sewing thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Ayatkan

texts.ru:
Аяткан 56 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Аяткан на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом . Благодаря упорному труду Аяткан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  5 коров с телятами, 30 овец и 4 кобылы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аяткан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Аяткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ayatkan is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children. For the past 30 years, Ayatkan has been raising livestock, having started her business with a sum of 15,000 som. Thanks to her had work, Ayatkan's farm currently has 5 cows with calves, 30 sheep, and 4 mares. In order to continue developing her business, Ayatkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase more dairy cows, which will allow her to increase milk production. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old married woman with six children between 6 and 14 years old, all of whom attend school. She operates a grocery stall in Nakawa market, a busy fruits and vegetables market just outside Kampala city. She works every day of the week from Monday to Sunday and makes a net average income of Uganda Shillings 300,000 per month.

Her major clients are mainly schools, hotels, restaurants and vendors from other markets. She started the business in 2004 so that she could earn a living to support her family.
 
Christine is taking this loan to stock up on plantain and ripe bananas for her stall. Being a favorite food in Uganda, she is guaranteed to sell it all. However, sometimes business is slow because she lacks enough money to buy the plantain in bulk and match her customers' demand. She also spends a lot on transportation from the bigger source markets to her stall.

Her dream is to venture into the hardware business if she can save up enough money to do so. She is a very hard working and honest lady.

loans.use: To buy ripe bananas and plantain to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 29, is single. She has been selling fresh fruit for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 11,000 which she uses to support herself and her parents. 

Jane is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy assorted fruit in bulk. 

The anticipated profit from the business will help support her parents. In the future, she hopes to grow her business through wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Aissetou

texts.fr:
Aissetou est une femme âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 04 enfants, dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 14 ans.  
Aissetou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales, d’ignames et divers depuis 1996. Elle exerce seule son activité au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est le non engagement des clients.
Aissetou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des ignames et divers. Elle veut voir son activité évoluer, avoir sa propre maison et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Aissetou is a 44-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has four children, three of whom attend school. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 14.

Aissetou has been working as a retailer of cereals, yams and various other goods since 1996. She runs her business alone at the market and gets her supplies in Lomé. Her difficulty is the lack of commitment from her customers.

Aissetou has requested her first WAGES loan in order to purchase cereals, yams and various other goods. She wants to see her business grow, to have her own house and to provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, yams and various other goods.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает в алюминиевом заводе. Сама Мохира занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Mohira lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works at an aluminum factory, while Mohira raises cattle at home. She has been engaged in this for the past two years. Mohira is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Dossy

texts.en:
Dossy, 47, is married and has three children. She sells cereals to earn a living and has been in the business for three years. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has employed one person in her business.
Dossy hopes to expand her business in five years. She needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 41-year-old married woman with four children who all attend school. She also looks after two dependants and pays school fees for one of them. Agnes has been taking loans to pay school fees for her children since they joined secondary school. One of them is now in senior six.

She has two rental houses and raises chickens as her main source of income. She also uses this income to repay the loans she has been acquiring. She started the poultry farm to be able to supplement her income to meet the growing needs of her children, whose school fees and school needs had increased. Her major customers are boys that roast chicken along the roadside in the evenings. 

Her dream is to venture into layers since they are multipurpose and she can sell eggs as well as the chicken. She has challenges when there is an outbreak of infection, which claims all the birds at times.

Agnes is very hard working and honest in repaying loans and in her business dealings. She is grateful to Ugafode because it has always been there whenever she needs school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гульзаде 22 года, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гульзада занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2010 году с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзада обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гульзад планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulzada is 22 years old and married. To provide a source of income for her family, Gulzada keeps livestock. Her business, launched in 2010 with 5,000 som (KGS) currently brings around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. Presently, Gulzada has 4 dairy cows. In order to continue developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle. Gulzada plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old and single. He has been selling fresh fruit within Thika town, Central Province, for the past three years. His monthly income is KES 10,500, which he uses to support his parents. 

James is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase fresh fruit in bulk to sell. 

James plans to reinvest the anticipated profit back into the business. He hopes in the future to be a fruit vendor.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruit in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 36 years old and single. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has employed one person in the business. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management. This has helped her to invest in her business.
Naumi hopes to grow her business in the future. She needs 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is a 60-year-old widow who has four children, three of whom attend school. She also lives with two dependants who are orphans.

She buys and sells firewood and also has a small retail shop operated by her daughter who is divorced. She started the business in 2006 so that she could be able to get income to take care of her family's needs. Her major clients are mainly the local community since the business is on a small scale. She will use the loan to buy firewood to sell and to buy stock for the retail shop. 

Her dream is to develop her plot so that she can stop renting. Her major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy in bulk where she could have made more profits. Zoe is hard working and honest. She emphasized that eating into the business capital affects its growth.

loans.use: To buy firewood and more stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Турсун занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 30 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет рис. В этой области он более двадцати лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Tursun lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 60 years old, married, and has three children. Tursun has been raising livestock for the past 30 years. He also grows crops - on a small plot of land near his home, he cultivates vegetables and rice. He has been doing this for 20 years. Tursun is taking this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ruzikhon

texts.ru: Рузихон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Ее муж находится заграницей. Сама Рузихон разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа овец и коз.
texts.en: Ruzikhon lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is currently abroad. Ruzikhon has been raising cattle for sale for the past ten years. She is taking this loan to buy sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Marylyne

texts.en: Marylyne is taking out another loan of KES 20000 to pay school fees for her child. The previous loan greatly increased her monthly income by over thirty percent. Marylyne is thanking Yehu and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz, 40, lives with his wife and 22-year-old son in a small village. Parviz runs an agricultural business; he has 18 calves and owns 0.1 hectare of land where he grows various vegetables, including cucumbers, tomatoes, and haricots (green beans). The family sells harvested products on the local open market. The family's average monthly income is 1100 Lari.

Parviz has requested a loan to purchase feed for his cattle. He wants to raise and sell calves locally after several months. Grown calves will be sold with a price mark-up. The family will get additional income which will enable Parviz to expand his agricultural business and improve living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for cattle.

loans.name: Evicks

texts.en: Evicks is married with three children, all enrolled in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the last five years, she has been selling food items from her home, mostly to her neighbors. She was previously a tailor. Another source of income is earnings from her husband. Evicks dreams of opening a hotel in the future. She describes credit defaulters as posing a major challenge to her. With the loan of KES 20000, she will be able to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 31 years old and lives with his parents in a small village where he runs a farm with five milking cows. 

He has three hectares of land, growing onions on one third, tomatoes on another third and grass on the last portion for feeding his livestock. David sells cheese, milk and curds on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Georgian Lari.

David has a lot of work to do so he has hired workers to help him in his business. He has requested a loan to help him pay his workers' salaries. He thinks that with their help his business will increase and the income of the family will be improved. With increased income he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his workers' salaries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to stock her café.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, 33, is an enterprising businessman and is married to Mary, who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been supplying grocery vegetables and fruits for the past three years. His monthly income of KES 10,000 supports his family.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by an existing KADET customer. Fredrick will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fresh fruit to supply to his customers. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes someday to supply fresh produce to the nearby hospitals and schools, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fresh fruit to supply to his customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 48-year-old mixed-crop farmer. She is married to Peter, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been planting tree seedlings in a nursery bed for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 18,000, which she uses to support her family. 
She is applying for her second loan from KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Rose will use the loan to purchase seedlings. 
With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land where she can plant her own trees.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in her own house without electricity or piped water. 

She has been working selling food in a shop for the last three years. She sells her goods mostly to the local residents. 

Jane describes the high cost of transport to be her major challenge. 

Food is Jane's greatest monthly expense and she plans to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children aged one and three years old. She describes herself as patient.

Previously, Everlyne was involved in the business of clothes selling. But for the last two years she has decided to involve herself in providing transportation services and employs one member of staff. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are children and students. 

Everlyne describes her biggest business challenge to be escalating fuel prices. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to pay for the servicing of her vehicle. 

Her dream and business goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for servicing her motor vehicle.

loans.name: Imbere Ii Group

texts.fr:
Agathe fait partie du groupe Imbere II et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 50 ans et est mariée à Selemani, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants, âgés de  8 à 28 ans, dont  4 étudient.
Elle prend soin de 2 petits fils dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de bois de chauffage depuis  5ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bois de chauffage à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et y construire une maison grâce aux bénéfices  de son commerce.
texts.en:
Agathe is a member of the Imbere II group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 50 years old and is married to Selemani, a bricklayer.They have 7 children aged from 8 to 28 years, of which 4 are students.
She takes care of 2 grandsons, one of which goes to school.

She has been running a firewood business for 5 years.

This is her first loan from Turame.With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of firewood for resale, to earn more.

Over the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land on which to build a house thanks to the profits from her business.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of firewood for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Abimbere Group

texts.fr:
Elcie fait partie du groupe Abimbere et habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a  49 ans et est mariée à Aimé, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 10 enfants, âgés de 7 à 28 ans, dont 6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 28 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années,  elle voudrait faire la culture du riz.
texts.en:
Elcie is a member of the Abimbere group and lives in Bujumbura.She is 49 years old and married to Aimé, a farmer. They have 10 children aged between 7 and 28, of which 6 are students.

She has been selling clothing for 28 years.

This is her seventh credit from Turame.With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of clothes for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years she would like to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

loans.name: El Almendro De La Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el almendro de la Guadalupe los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama su comunidad y también porque en casa de la representante tiene 3 árboles de almendro, esta  historia es acerca del señora aurora, ya que es la representante de este grupo cuenta con 64 años de edad y está casada con el señor Luis quien es campesino, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales Daniel estudia cursa el primer año de secundaria, ya que los otros 3 están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de trastes de barro desde hace mas de 10 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa e hijo con sus estudios, y así mismo gozar de una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, aparte de que dice desde pequeña su mama le enseño a elaborar estos utensilios, es por eso que decidió empezar con esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir, en la compra de mas material como son: leña, barro y comprar más trastes, para continuar con sus ventas.
	

Doña aurora dice que su meta es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un pequeño local puesto que lo que más desea es poner su tienda de artículos de barro y así dar a conocer un poco de lo que hacen en su comunidad, también para de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido, con más variedad de productos, y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo del almendro de la Guadalupe son las siguientes: Adelina, hernestina, María, Guadalupe, aurora, Rocío, quienes se dedican a la alfarería, panadería  y venta de refresco.
texts.en:
This group is called "El Almendro de la Guadalupe" (The Almond Tree of Guadalupe). The members of the group decided upon this name because it includes the name of their community. In addition, the group representative has three almond trees at home.

The story being presented is that of Sra. Aurora, the group representative. She is 64 years old and married to Sr. Luis, who is a field laborer. They have four children, but only her son Daniel is a student since he is in his first year of high school. The other three children are already married. She has been producing and selling utensils made of clay for more than 10 years.

Aurora says that she decided to start this business because she was looking for a way to help her husband with the household expenses and pay for their son's studies. At the same time, she wanted to have an improved financial situation and an excellent quality of life. With respect to her business, Aurora says that when she was a little girl, her mother taught her how to make utensils. For this reason, she decided to start this venture. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of more materials such as firewood and clay, as well as additional utensils so that she can continue her sales.

Doña Aurora says that her goal as an entrepreneur is to make her business grow. She wants to build a small shop since her greatest wish is to open a store where she can sell earthenware and make people in her community aware of what she does. The loan will also help her to be well-stocked with a greater variety of products so that she can earn more income. She would like to thank FRAC and the Kiva lenders for giving her this opportunity and trusting her. Most of all, she is grateful that people believe in her. With this assistance, she will be able to invest in her business and have a better quality of life and a better future along with her family.

The members who make up the group "El Almendro de la Guadalupe" are Adelina, Hernestina, María, Guadalupe, Aurora, and Rocío. They engage in businesses such as pottery making, making baked goods, and selling soft drinks.

loans.use: to acquire clay and firewood for making earthenware and to purchase utensils to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 44-year-old widow with three children aged 20, 18 and 16 years. She is a mixed-crop farmer and has been doing this as her primary business, with dairy farming as a secondary business, for 10 years. She has a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to purchase seedlings, fertiliser and animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertiliser and animal feed.

loans.name: Abdou Karim

texts.fr:
Abdou Karim exerce dans la friperie depuis bientôt sept ans. Il achète en gros dans la capitale et revend en détail au marché central de sa ville.Il propose à ses clients des tee- shirts, des pantalons et des chemises  et des maillots  de sport.Il parvient à tirer de son commerce des bénéfices substantiels qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille notamment sa femme et ses trois enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter trois "balles" de friperie.
Il envisage de s'engager dans le commerce de pret à porter.
texts.en:
Abdou Karim has been selling used clothing for almost seven years.  He buys wholesale in the capital city and sells retail at the central market of his town.  He sells T-shirts, pants, shirts, and sportswear to his customers.  His activity brings him good profits which allow him to cover his family's expenses and to take care of his wife and three children.  

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for the purchase of three "bales" of used clothing in order to strengthen his business.  Abdou Karim is thinking about transitioning to the field of ready-to-wear retail business.

loans.use: to buy 3 bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Violence

texts.en:
Violence is 53 years old and married to John, who is also a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling juice for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family members.  

Violence is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Violence will use the loan to buy fruits to make juice for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to start a hotel business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to make juice for sale.

loans.name: Maîminatou

texts.fr:
Maïminatou est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un sérigraphe. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.  
Maïminatou travaille comme infirmiére et revendeuse de produits génériques depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits génériques pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec 06 personnes.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Maïminatou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Maïminatou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maïminatou is a 34-year-old woman.  She is married to a serigrapher and has no children.

Maïminatou has been working as a nurse and reseller of generic products since 2001.  She sells generic products to all customers, from her home.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works with six other people.  At the moment, her major challenge is that she is out of stock.

Maïminatou has requested her third loan from WAGES for the purchase of generic products.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.  In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy generic products.

loans.name: Dora Aracelì

texts.es:
Dora  es una mujer que tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo y a que es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con sus hijos  y sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. Dora vive en el caserío Carrasquillo del distrito de Morropón del  departamento de Piura; así mismo solo  cuenta con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y agua; también se menciona que en este caserío viven casi todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Dora es la  venta de bebidas (cerveza, gaseosas, chicha de jora, otros), este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; así mismo también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  y cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Sus padres lo apoyan arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente  Dora se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2010 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de bebidas (cerveza, gaseosas, chicha de jora),  y compra de calaminas para su vivienda; así mismo su meta es comprar un puesto en el mercado a corto plazo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is 43 and the single mother of two children.  She lives in her own house with her children and her parents.  She says her community's standard of living is one of mere subsistence.  Most of the inhabitants are independent laborers who practice farming, ranching, and raising small animals; some of them are also traders.  Dora lives in the Carrasquillo village in the district of Morropón, Piura department.  She only has basic electricity and water services, and she says that almost all the families in her area live under the same conditions.

Dora sells drinks (beer, soda, chicha--a corn-based drink--etc.).  Her small business is located within her home, where she serves her clients and loyal patrons.  At her house, she also raises poultry, which she has been doing for four years and which allows her to keep the clientele she has built for both businesses.  Her parents wholeheartedly help her in her activities; they are a close family.

At the moment, Dora wants to increase the inventory for her commercial establishment (her drinks business), which is a good earner in this area.  For this reason, she is seeking a new loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a sum of S/. 2010 new soles ($775).  She will invest this money in buying drinks (beer, soda, chicha) and in buying corrugated iron for her home.  Her goal is to buy a stall in the local market soon so that over time she can keep improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy drinks and fix up her home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and a business lady.  She is married to Joseph who is a business man. They are blessed with four children aged 22, 20, 14 and 6. She has been running a retail shop for the past nine years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,500, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Grace will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Grace will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Owino

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 30 year old married man. He has 2 children, an 8 month old and a 5 year old. He describes himself to be a honest and and open-minded man. Fredrick was initially in the business of selling second hand clothes. Being a businessman, he decided to run another activity, of selling shoes which he has been successfully doing for 7 years. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents.

Fredrick describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for sale. His business goal is to open a boutique . He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable .

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 23 year old married man. He had earlier requested for a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings, which he used to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike which he uses for transport business. He has experienced growth in his business since he serviced the loan. He also used part of the loan to add stock in his retail shop. This helped him to improve his standard of living.

Samson has requested for another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of maize flour, sugar, salt and cooking fat at his retail store.

loans.use: To add stock of maize flour, sugar, salt and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 49 year old a business lady and is married to Bernard a business man. They are blessed with three children 23, 18 and 15 years old. She has been running a medical clinic for the past 14 years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her 1st loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Jane will use the loan to purchase medicines and hospital assets.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will improve her business. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land, and build her own medical clinic.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and hospital assets

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith  is a small trader.   She sells rice, eggs and frozen chicken at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. Edith is married and has one child. Her husband is an account clerk. She uses her income to assist the husband in maintaining their family.  Edith will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, eggs and frozen chicken to sell.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, eggs and frozen chicken to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells Waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macroni, meat and fish stew. Margaret has been selling Waakye for 10  years.  She is married and her husband is a surveyor.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay her utility bills.  Margaret needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her Waakye for sale.  With the new profit, Margaret will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredient for the preparation of her Waakye for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 64 years old a business lady, married to John and they have one adult child. She runs a green grocer shop in her home town with an average monthly income of KES. 50,000. She is taking her fourth loan cycle from KADET LTD,  after repaying previous loans successfully. 

Juliana will use the loan to buy more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions for sale. She intends to use the profit to educate her children comfortably and expand her business. 

Her future dreams is to have a better living standard for her family, stable business and become a vegetable supplier in her home town.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has operated a grocery shop at Ankyernyin near Takoradi for 10 years.  She is married with 4 children.  The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffes, powdered milk etc.  Joyce uses her income to assist the husband with paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase variety of groceries to sell at her shop. With the new profit, Joyce  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 25 year old single woman. She has 2 children with ages 8 months and 2 years.  Nancy works really hard to support her children by engaging in a retail shop, where she sells various household goods such as flour, sugar, salt, bread, water, sodas, snacks, gilette etc.  She has been  in this business for 4 years.  Her business is located within a busy town  and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.  She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household goods.  Her business goal is to venture into a hardware business within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent .

loans.use: to buy more household goods.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Racheal is married and has 2 children. They live at Ankyernyin near Takoradi.  Rachael used to sell cooked beans and gari but now, for 2 years, she has been selling clothing like jeans and men & ladies underwear.   She uses her income to support hre husband to feed and cloth their children.  Rachael will use her loan to purchase more jeans, ladies and men underware to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Rachael wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more jeans, ladies and men's underwear to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives together with her husband, who is a driver, and their three children at Ankyerenyin near Takoradi. 

Rose is a petty trader. She sells food items such us tinned tomatoes, salt, powdered pepper, macaroni and other things.  This she has done for four years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Rose will use her loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes is a food vendor.  She sells maize porridge and fried doughnuts in addition to bread to her customers. Agenes  has been in this business for 13 years now.  Agnes is married and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her doughnuts, bread, and porridge to sell. With the new profit, Agenes  will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her doughnuts, bread, and  porridge to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells palm kernel oil at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 years. Eunice is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children's school fees. Eunice will use her loan to purchase gallons of palm kernel oil to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm kernel oil to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 55-year-old widowed woman with five children who finished school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills. 

Mwanasha has operated a general store for the past five years, selling to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high prices of commodities. She aspires to start a wholesale business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase additional stock of sugar, beans, flour, and peas for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sugar, maize flour, and beans for her shop.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida sells cloth and dresses at Akyerenyin near Takoradi. She has been in this business for three years. She is married and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Vida will use her loan to purchase cloth and dresses to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en: Elizerbeth is a hairdresser at Anyerenyin near Takoradi.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a welder. Elizerbeth has been a hairdresser for five years.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her work. She hopes to use the new profits to open a beauty salon to make her work easy.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her work.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia operates a grocery shop at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10  years. The items in her grocery shop are tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She is married with four children. Cecilia uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man with two children, who both attend school. He operates a 14-seater passenger vehicle and has been operating this vehicle for the last three years. Theft of some parts of his vehicle is a major challenge to him, and he dreams of buying a bus in future. Kennedy has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. He says food and rent are his greatest monthly expenses. He plans to service his vehicle using the KES 50,000 loan.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Fatuma has operated a motorcycle business for the past three years. She has employed a driver to operate the motorcycle, which carries her neighbors around at a fee as they run their errands. She faces a major challenge of competition. She aspires to start a kiosk in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase fuel (diesel) to sell to motorcyclists in the neighborhood. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase some stock of fuel (diesel) to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah operates a grocery shop at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 years. The items in her grocery shop are tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  She is married and has four children. Hannah uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Hannah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 32 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child. 

To earn a living, he does tailoring. He has employed one person to assist him in his tasks. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.

Gabriel hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs 100,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with three children, all enrolled in school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Food and school fees are his greatest monthly expenses.

He operates a passenger vehicle. He says the high cost of fuel is his major challenge, and he dreams of buying a lorry in the future. 

Swalehe joined Yehu to get financial support for his business. With the KES 50,000, he intends to service the vehicle.

loans.use: to service the vehicle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, he has been a carpenter making furniture that he sells to his customers from home. He faces a major challenge of high competition as there are several carpenters in the area. He dreams of starting a wood workshop where he can sell timber in bulk.

With the KES 30,000, he wants to purchase timber and nails. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails for his furniture business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
As a former soldier in the Canadian Army, Robert, 45, wanted to use his training and experience to serve others in the community and opened Specialized Security Group three years ago. The private security company caters to individuals or groups who need security. 

What separates his security company from others within the San Antonio and Selma areas is that Robert only hires military veterans and pays better than 99 percent of other security companies. “We offer better services at a better rate,” Robert said.

Regularly, Robert employs 10 other security officers per job, but he said he has about 50 on stand-by. If he lands the next two contracts, Robert said he will be able to hire more officers.

One of Robert’s partners informed him about ACCION Texas Inc., which influenced him to obtain a loan from ACCION rather than a traditional bank.

The loan helped tremendously, Robert said. It paid for insurance, licensing and uniforms. 

Robert is a father of two children who financially depend on him. “I appreciate ACCION,” he said. “Without it a lot of people would be suffering.”

To find out more about his business, visit his website at: www.specializedsecuritygroup.com.

loans.use: The loan paid for licencing, uniforms and insurance.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is a retailer who runs a general store where he sells household groceries such as flour, soap, salt, etc. The business has been in operation for the last five years. Hamisi is also a fisherman. He obtained the capital for the current business from the savings made from the fishing he did previously.

Hamisi joined Milango to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to purchase retail stock such as flour, cooking fat, soaps and cereals for sale.
 
He looks forward to being able to cater to his family's needs from the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as flour, cooking fat, soaps and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Barrio Nuevo Huictepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama barrio nuevo huixtepec las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama su comunidad, ya que todos pertenecen a la misma, la historia es acerca de la señora aurea quien cuenta con 61 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace más de 20 años.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio porque su mama se dedicaba a esta actividad y fue ella quien le enseño, también porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más material como son: huevos, manteca, azúcar, harina, levadura, canela, etc. Y así continuar elaborando su rico pan.

Doña aurea está muy contenta porque dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes e ingresos, tanto que hasta está ahorrando para asegurar su futuro económico.

La meta que tiene para su negocio es la de continuar invirtiéndole ya que quiere hacer crecer mucho mas, está pensando en construir otro horno para agilizar y contar con una ágil producción y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Ofelia, victoriana, aurea, Cecilia y eulogia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: abarrotes, venta de comida, bordados, y panadería.
texts.en:
This group is named Barrio Nuevo Huixtepec.   The members decided to give it this name because it is the name of their community, of which all of them are members.

The story is about Aurea, age 61.  She is a single mother of six children, who are now all married.  She has devoted herself to making and selling bread for over 20 years.  She decided to start with this business because her mother devoted herself to this business activity.  Her mother was the one who taught her.

Also, she wanted to look for a way to get her children ahead and improve her family’s quality of life.  She will use the loan she received to buy more ingredients like eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, and cinnamon, etc.  This way she will continue making her delicious bread.

Aurea says she is very happy because her business is going very well for her.  Her sales have increased quite a lot as well as her customers and income.  They have increased so much that she is even saving in order to assure her financial future.

The goal that she has for her business is to continue investing because she wants to make it grow more.  She is thinking of building another oven in order to accelerate her production and to make it easier.  This way she will improve and increase her income.

She is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for the whole-hearted support they are giving her.  Thanks to this help she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

These are the names of the people and the business activities of the members of the group.  Ofelia, Victoriana, Aurea, Cecilia, and Eulogia devote themselves to different business activities like groceries, selling food, embroidery, and a bakery.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, and cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati has three children and all of his children are enrolled in school. Bahati lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

He operates a graphics shop where he does printing and typing. He has been in this business for the last 14 years. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce.  

He aspires to open a photo studio in the future. He joined Yehu to access some funds to boost his business. With the KES 50,000, he plans to purchase a printer and a typewriter.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and a typewriter.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 53-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 17 years. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he sells tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are residents. 

He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for building a bigger greenhouse for the tomatoes. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy chemicals, fertilizers and seeds. 

His business goal is to own many greenhouses growing different types of crops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits  generated to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with four children, one of whom attends school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, he has operated a grocery business where he sells most of the vegetables at the market. He faces a major challenge of high competition. He dreams of starting a kiosk.

With the KES 30,000 he wants to purchase cabbages, tomatoes and kale for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, kale and cabbages for his grocery business.

loans.name: Adiviadji

texts.fr:
Adiviadji est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un étudiant et à 02 enfant de 04 et 02ans.
Adiviadji travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Elle vend dans une boutique  et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt l'aidera à acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. 
 Adiviadji veut réinvestir dans l’activité, la développer et assurer la santé de ses enfants par l'achat des médicaments en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
Adiviadji is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a student and has two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. She has been working as a grocer since 2006. She sells out of a store and gets her supplies in Lomé. She is on her second loan with WAGES. This loan will help her to buy grocery items. 

Adiviadji wants to reinvest in her business, develop it, and ensure that her children's health care needs are met by purchasing medicine.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 42-year-old conservative woman, so she asked one of her sons to take her place in the photo.

After taking out her first loan, Fatmeh has decided to concentrate on selling milk and cheese, leaving the farming work to her husband. Recently Fatmeh has started animal sales business beside making dairy products. 

Now Fatmeh has applied foir this loan in order to buy more sheep to increase their revenue.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to increase their revenue

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is married with two children. He lives in Likoni, Kenya. For the past three years, Mark has run a grocery shop where he sells fruits, vegetables, cereals, and other items. He got the capital to start his business from selling brooms and coconuts. Mark learned of Milango from his friends and he joined to access credit.

Mark is requesting a 41,900 KES loan to purchase crates of tomatoes, potatoes, and other greens. The extra income from his loan will help Mark pay for his children’s school fees. His ambition is to purchase the greens directly from the farmers and sell to his customers. He also hopes to increase the number of outlets.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other greens

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal, 51 years old and widowed, still has five sons and a daughter who are not married and living with her.

Nawal used to make embroidery items for her house, and after her husband passed away, she decided to use her hobby to make money, so she started to make more embroidered pillow covers, hangings, etc., all by hand, and participated in a few traditional festivals and exhibitions to sell her work.

Now Nawal has applied for this loan to buy a sewing machine that will help her accelerate the business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam, 32 years old and a married woman, has one daughter and one son. Her husband works in the plumbing business.

To help her husband improve their living conditions, Ibtisam also started to work at home in a retail business selling blankets and bed covers. She has applied for this loan to bring in more types of bed covers and sheets.

loans.use: to bring in more types of bed covers and sheets.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and the mother of two children. She is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. For the past three years, Jackline has run a grocery stall. She learned of Milango from a company employee and joined to access credit for her business.

Jackline is requesting a 15,900 KES loan to purchase additional stock of groceries and vegetables such as potatoes, fruits, vegetables, and other items. Despite the challenges of high taxes and a seasonal business climate, Jackline believes she will be able to educate her children using the extra income from her loan. Her future ambition is to open another grocery stall.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, fruits, vegetables, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a welder living in Malindi, Kenya. He is a married father of three children and has been in this business for 5 years. He got the capital from relatives to start the business. 

He is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to purchase a welding machine. Samson is focused on marketing his business to be known in the area. He believes the additional income from this business will enable him educate his children. The challenge facing the business is some clients not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is a fish monger living in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has been operating the business for 2 years. Samini started from a limited stock of fish and has seen her capital grow with time. Fish is among the staple foods of the residents of Malindi.

Samini joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of fish. Her ambition is to own a fish farm; an idea she got from the government initiative to educate and promote fish farming within the coast province. The extra income will also form part of her future savings. The challenge currently is the high cost of transport since the client has to go to the beach and the main suppliers to obtain fish.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Jira

texts.en: Jira is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is married and runs a transport business; owning a motorcycle on which he ferries people and goods within Malindi town. Jira is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase spare parts for the repair of his motorcycle. The additional income will form part of his savings. The main challenge in the business is high cost of fuel.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the repair of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is single and lives in Likoni, Kenya. For the past year, he has been running a charcoal business. Chacha started his business with less than three bags of charcoal. He sold smaller, one kilogram units of charcoal to his clients and his business has continued to grow and with growing demand. Chacha joined Milango to access credit. His main business challenge is the seasonal business climate and high cost of transportation.

Chacha is requesting a 83,450 KES loan to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income will help Chacha pay for his children’s school fees. His ambition is to purchase a truck to transport the charcoal directly from the sellers to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb, 57 years old and a married man, is supporting a family of seven members. After his retirement, he opened a small food market in front of his house to continue having an income, and recently he added selling items other than food products. 

Now Ghaleb has applied to this loan to add more products to have variety in the store. He hopes that he can add selling fruits and vegetables in the future.

loans.use: to add more products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 37 years old and a married man, has one child. His wife is a teacher, when he works in a fruit and vegetables store.

Mohammad has started a small retail business after his work, selling clothes. Now he wants to work on expanding his own business, and for that reason he has applied for a loan to buy more clothes from a free zone area and from a wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from a free zone area

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She has two school-going children, ages 3 and 8 years old. Getrude runs a secondhand clothes business which has been running for 7 years.  This business is the only source of livelihood to her family.

The need for capital to expand her business operations led her to join Milango. She has applied for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes. Getrude believes that this will help improve the standard of living of her family and also provide good education. She aspires to open up a salon in the future, despite the challenges of high cost of transport and seasonal business climate.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a resident of Malindi, Kenya and is a clothes shop owner. The shop has been running for 4 years. She is a married mother of 2 children. She started the business from her husband’s salary.

On learning about Milango from her friends, Getrude joined the group members to access loans. She is therefore applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers. She believes the additional income from this loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her ambition is to be an established boutique owner in the region, despite the challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence runs a butchery in Malindi, Kenya, where she lives. She has been running her business for four years and sells poultry and cattle meat. She is a single mother and has one school-going child. Her business provides the only source of livelihood for her family. Florence learned about Milango from her friends and joined to access credit for her business needs.

She is applying for a loan of 21,100 to buy a freezer in which to store the meat she offers for sale. The challenges currently facing the business are the high cost of transportation and price fluctuations.

Her ambition is to own a large business in the area in future. Through the profits from this business, Florence believes she will be able to offer her child a good education and provide for her other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in which to store the meat she offers for sale

loans.name: Indomables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INDOMABLES” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Tatiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza, venta de tienda de barrio, venta de calzados, venta de productos Herbalife, venta de condimentos, venta de verduras.

La señora Tatiana, indica que  es el primer ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar de mercadería de su negocio (compra de víveres), mismo que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyarse ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de grupo.
texts.en: The group known as the "Indomables", or the indomitable ones, will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer.  This group has 6 members and is led by a committee.  Tatiana is the president.  The members each have different businesses, including beauty products, a general store, shoe sales, herbal supplements and vegetables.  Tatiana has a shop she has run in the neighborhood for many years, a business she learned from her friend.  Tatiana's daughter invited her to join the communal bank.    Her portion of the loan will be used to purchase inventory to stock her small store.   She shops at the large markets in the city of El Alto, and later sells the inventory at her small neighborhood store.   This business helps her to support her family.   When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Tatiana said that she likes the group meetings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Juana Norma

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica, es maestra  de primaria y está ubicada  en el colegio de una  comarca de la localidad, tiene 19 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta de 3 personas que son sus hijos, los cuales están casados, esta señora solicito su tercer financiamiento atraves del convenio con el mismo colegio, los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que este ultimo lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, Arena, Ayudante  y mano de obra. para repellar  su casa y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y poder realizar la obra que tanto necesita, para seguir mejorando y desarrollando su familia.
texts.en: Juana Norma is originally from Telica.  She has been a teaching first graders at nearby school for 19 years.  Juana Norma has 3 children, all married now.  She is requesting her third loan through a program at the school.  These loans have helped Juana to improve her quality of life, and with this loan she will be able to purchase materials necessary to repair her home, as well as pay for some of the labor.   She is working with Ceprodel to secure this credit so that she can do the needed work and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her home, such as cement, sand, as well as help with the labor.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Saye est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins et d'appuyer son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille, elle exerce depuis un an, un commerce d'encens". Elle achète les intrants et prépare elle -même le produit avant de le vendre en détail aux femmes.Son encens est très prisé par les femmes ; ce qui lui vaut une bonne clientèle et des revenus assez importants.Elle parvient ainsi à se prendre en charge et à soutenir également son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des intrants qui entrent dans la composition de l'encens.
texts.en: Saye is a married woman. She is the mother of four children, of whom three go to school. To be able to support herself and help her husband in caring for the family, she has been running an incense business for a year. Saye purchases the ingredients and make the product herself. She then sells them retail to women. Her incenses are highly prized by women, thus earning her a good customer base and fairly significant revenues. And so she manages to support herself and also her husband in covering family expenses. Saye is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy the ingredients for making incense.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is marred and the mother of three children. She lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. For the past two years, she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal. Benter started her business with her own capital, selling five bags of charcoal in front of a space next to someone's shop. She currently has her own shop and now can sell up to 100 bags at certain times. Benter's ambition is to expand her business and she joined Milango to access extra credit. Her business challenges are the high cost of transportation and inflation.

Benter is requesting a 21,050 KES loan to purchase 100 bags of charcoal. The additional income from her loan will go towards her children’s education and to provide family savings for any emergency. Benter aspires to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal to other retailers in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married with four children, one of whom is in school. He is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. For over the past ten years, Wilson has been selling fruits and vegetables. He has also invested in the transportation industry and owns a motorcycle which transports people and goods within Malindi town. Wilson was introduced to Milango by his friends. His main business challenges are inflation and price fluctuations.

Wilson is requesting a 62,700 KES loan to purchase additional stock of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, avocadoes, and other items to sell at his market. He currently rents a market stall and his ambition is to build a permanent business premise. Wilson believes the income from his loan will help improve his family's living standard. He will also be able to purchase another motorcycle and believes that in future he can buy a three-wheeler, commonly referred to as a “tuk tuk.”

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and avocadoes

loans.name: Pacificah

texts.en:
Pacificah runs a retail shop in Malindi, Kenya. She is the married mother of three school-going children. Her shop has been in operation for the last 10 years. Pacificah was introduced to Milango by an employee of the organization and joined to access credit. 

She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings in order to add stock to her store, such as milk, flour, sugar, and cereals. The main challenges facing her business are price fluctuations and high transportation costs incurred while bringing the stock to her shop. Nevertheless, Pacificah believes that the additional income from this loan will help her provide for the education of her children as well as to supply for her family’s other basic needs. 

She aspires to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to add stock to her store, such as milk, flour, sugar, and cereals

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual es su adoración y por el cual lucha cada día para darle una buena calidad de vida, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por los riquísimos camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz chaufa.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ruben trabaja día a día en su negocio como maestro constructor, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes de manera diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene buenos acabados.

Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera para su negocio y realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia; así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una buena calidad a su familia”.
texts.en: Ruben is a very hard worker.  He lives with his wife and their 8 year old son.  Ruben adores his son and it is for him that he works so hard every day to improve their quality of life.  Their home is located in the city of Camana, a place known for its beautiful beaches and delicious shrimp, as well as for the cultivation of rice.    When Ruben has free time, he likes to play football with his friends and neighbors in the neighborhood.  They also like to get together and share a delicious plate of Arroz chaufa, a rice and seafood dish.   Ruben works with great enthusiasm every day as a talented builder.  Working 10 hours a day, he can attend to as many as 5 customers a day.   He believes the reason that his business is going well is because he's very responsible and has many successful projects completed.   Ruben is very grateful to the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the support, he can purchase wood for his business as well as some to repair his own home.   This will enable him to increase his income, as well as improve the quality of life for his family.   Ruben wants to continue fighting hard to realize his big dream, which is to provide a good education for his son and a good quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and repair his home.

loans.name: Housron

texts.fr:
Housron est un homme âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à 5 enfants dont 4 vont à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Housron travaille comme restaurateur depuis 1999. Il vend de la nourriture pour tous clients à la maison. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour la réfection de son restaurant et renforcer son stock.
Housron a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments pour la restauration et effectuer la réfection de son restaurant. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Housron voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille et l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Housron is a 45-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has five children, of whom four go to school. The first child is 22, and the last is 2. Housron has been working as a restauranteur since 1999. He sells food to any customer at his house. He purchases goods in Lomé and works by himself. At the moment, his main difficulty is a lack of money for renovating his restaurant and bolstering his inventory. 

Housron has requested his first loan from WAGES for buying condiments for his restaurant and to carry out the renovation of it. He wants to reinvest in his business. 

In the next few years, Housron would like to expand his business. With the profits, he says he plans to ensure his family's well-being and his children's education.

loans.use: to buy condiments for food service and to do refurbishing

loans.name: Ndèye Diakhou
