texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux enfants.Depuis un an, elle vend des cartes de recharge de crédit de téléphone.Elle s'approvisionne auprès des demi - grossistes et revend au détail à ses clients.Elle vend des cartes des trois opérateurs de téléphonie mobile de son pays; ce qui fait qu'elle parvient  à générer des bénéfices assez substantiels.Elle prend ainsi en charge ses propres besoins et certaines dépenses d'entretien des enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des cartes de recharge de crédit téléphone.
texts.en: Ndèye is a married woman and the mother of two children. For a year, she has been selling phone minutes recharge cards. She gets her supplies from middlemen and sells them retail to her customers. She sells cards from three mobile phone operators in her country. This means she manages to generate fairly substantial profits. And so she supports herself and covers certain childcare expenses.  To bolster her business capital, Ndèye is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy phone cards.

loans.use: to buy phone minutes

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer living in Malindi, Kenya. She has been farming for over eight years. Her business started off as a small family venture for subsistence needs. The needs of her family increased and she thought of an additional way of getting income. She then began the rearing of poultry, dairy, and beef animals in her home. Her main challenge is some clients not paying on time and seasonal weather. She is also employed as a public health officer. Emily and her husband have three school-going children.

The venture into poultry and animal rearing has proved a worthwhile one, and Emily is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase more poultry stock to bring into her farm. She looks forward to owning a large farm someday that will provide eggs and milk to the neighborhood and also eventually to diversify to fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry stock to bring into her farm

loans.name: Tuamaalo

texts.en:
Tuamaalo, age 49, owns and operates a small store where she sells such everyday items as soap, sugar, and flour. She has operated her business for two years. She and her husband have six children. 

Tuamaalo became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise to offer for sale in her store. She plans to use her profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona, age 61, has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have four children.

Ramona has requested a loan in order to buy new farming tools and farming chemicals. She will also spend part of her loan to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SBPD for three years. 

With her profits, Ramona hopes to start up another small business.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and chemicals for growing taro and bananas

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age 33, owns and operates a small store, where she sells such everyday items as sugar, salt, and soap. She has been doing this for three years. She and her husband have seven children.

Joyce became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more items to offer for sale. She hopes to use her profits to help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guadalupe victoria esta integrado  por 5 mujeres que con su trabajo dan a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona cañera y la principal actividad economica es la siembra y el cultivo de la caña de azucar,sus integantes son: Imelda venta de antojitos, Georgina Venta de abarrotes , Selene venta de calzado, Blanca venta de lenceria y Abelina venta de calzado.

Doña Georgina es uno de los miembros de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 55 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con don Roque cone el cual tiene dos hijas, ella platica que siempre a tenido que trabajar para ayudar al gasto del hogar pero ella siempre habia querido tener su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes ya hace un poco mas de dos años con el apoyo de su esposo logro abrir su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su hogar ella acondiciono la parte de enfrente de su casa para ahí poner su tienda, La tienda de doña Georgina es una de las mas surtidas de la colonia lo cual le a ayudado a ganar muchos clientes ya que siempre van a encontrar lo que el cliente necesite. Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que aparte del beneficio economico esta enseñando a sus hijas a trabajar ya que ellas la ayudad a atender a los clientes.

ella inevertira este credito en la compra de  aceite, comida enlatada, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, dulces, sabritas, pan dulce, galletas, sal , azucar , mayonesa, jabon y cloro pra resurtir su negocio.

ella quiere que esta inversion ayude a que su negocio continue pre¿ogresando y sus ganancias aumenten ya que le gustaria que sus hijas estudiaran la universidad.

Este grupo agradece a la fundacion el apoyo que se les ha brindado atravez de este prestamo.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Victoria group is comprised of five women, who with their work give their families a better quality of life.  This group is in a located in a sugar cane area, and the main financial activity is planting and cultivating sugar cane.

The members of the group are:
Imelda:  Sells Mexi can snacks
Georgina:  Sells groceries
Selene:  Sells shoes
Blanca:  Sells lingere
Abelina:  Sells shoes

Georgina is one of the members of this group.  She is 55 years old, has a high school education,  and is married to Roque, with whom she has two daughters.  She says that she has always had to work to help with the household expenses.  

However, she had always wanted to have her own business selling groceries.  A little over two years ago, with her husband’s help, she managed to open her business.  The business is in her home.   It is in the front part of her house where she prepared a place to set up her store.

Georgina’s store is one of the best stocked stores in the neighborhood.   This has helped her to win over a lot of customers because they always find what they need.  She is very happy with her business.  Aside from the financial benefit, it is teaching her daughters to work because they help her tend to the customers.

She will use this loan to buy oil, canned foods, beans, rice, soft drinks, candy, Sabritas (a brand of snacks), sweet bread, cookies, salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap, and bleach in order to restock her business.

She wants this investment to help her business continue making progress.  She also wants her income to increase because she would like her daughters to attend the university.

This group is grateful to the Fundación for the support it has provided through this loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, canned foods, beans, rice, soft drinks, candy, Sabritas (a brand of snacks), sweet bread, cookies, salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap, and bleach.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, tiene 43 años pero el espíritu de una joven de 20, es madre de 2 hijos, ambos tienen 20 años y son la adoración de Flor y por los cuales Flor da la vida por darles una vida feliz y con una buena calidad de vida; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica , Perú; El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros; asimismo se le conoce por la amabilidad de su gente. Cuando Flor tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión en especial las series de comedia; asimismo aprovecha la oportunidad en algunas ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Día a día flor trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y servicio de fotocopiado; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 50 clientes, ella cre que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Flor está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la reparación de su máquina fotocopiadora, con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y podrá mejor atención a sus clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en: Flor is a hard working and enthusiastic woman of 43 years, but she has the spirit of a young woman of 20.  Flor has two children whom she adores, both 20 years old now, and she dedicates her life to making them happy and providing a good quality of life.   Flor lives in the district of Santiago, Ica, in Peru.  This area is characterized by its warm and comfortable climate, as well agriculture, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus and paprika, to name just a few.  It's also known for its friendly people.   When Flor has free time, she enjoys watching television, especially comedy series.   She also enjoys one of her favorite dishes, rice and chicken.   Every day Flor works hard running her small general store, where she sells staple items as well as provides photocopying services.    During her 10 hour days, she has about 50 customers come through the store.   Flor believes her business is successful because she is very charismatic with her customers and always offers quality products at fair prices.   Flor is very grateful for the Kiva loans. With this support, she will be able to repair her photocopy machine, which helps her increase her income and provide better service to her customers.   Flor continues to work hard to realize her dream,  to have her own home.

loans.use: to repair her photocopier

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa, age 28, has a small plantation where she grows bananas to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for two years. 

Palepa has requested a loan to buy farming tools and to help pay for her children's education. She and her husband have three children.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Palepa hopes to  improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing bananas

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna  est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce le métier de tailleur depuis bientôt dix ans.Il a ouvert dans sa ville un atelier de couture dans lequel il reçoit un grand nombre de clients.Saisissant les opportunités que lui offre le marché, avec la présence de nombreux tailleur dans les alentours, il a aménagé une partie de son atelier pour y vendre des articles de mercerie.Face à une demande devenue assez forte il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des articles de mercerie divers.
texts.en: Sokhna is a married man, father of three children.He has worked as a tailor for nearly ten years.In his town he opened a sewing shop in which he receives a large number of clients.Seizing the opportunities offered to him by the circumstances of the market, in view of the presence of numerous tailors in the neighbourhood, he has fitted out part of his workshop to sell haberdashery goods.To meet the demand that has become quite strong he requests a loan of 200000f  to purchase various articles of haberdashery.

loans.use: to buy various articles of haberdashery.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete, age 46, is a widow with five children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Pelenatete has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She needs a loan to buy tools, spices, and ingredients for preparing pork buns to offer for sale. She plans to use her profits to help fund her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tools, spices, and ingredients for her pork bun business

loans.name: Ikigazi Group

texts.fr:
Christine  fait partie du groupe Ikigazi  et habite à Rumonge commune sous la direction de la branche de Bujumbura. Elle a 52 ans et est mariée à Nasoro commerçant de manioc. Ensemble ils ont  5enfants, âgés de 15  à 35ans, dont 2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de manioc depuis 3 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de manioc  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains du commerce lui permettront d’améliorer la ration alimentaire, supporter les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is part of the group Ikigazi and lives in Rumonge Commune, under the direction of the Bujumbura branch. She is 52 years old and married to Nasoro, a cassava merchant. Together they have five children, from 15 to 35 years old. Two of the children are students. Christine has charge of two orphans, who are students. 

Christine has been selling cassava for three years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of cassava to sell in order to earn more. 

The profit from her business will enable her to improve her food rations and to help with her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy a lot of cassava to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Sesa

texts.en:
Sesa, age 54, owns and operates a business printing elei, a type of Samoan cloth. She has been in this line of business for a year. She and her husband have seven children. 

Sesa joined SPBD in 2011. She has requested a loan because she needs a loan to buy printing tools. She intends to use her profits to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes and other printing tools

loans.name: Puaaelo

texts.en: Puaaelo is a 49-year-old woman, who is married with seven children. She plans to start a small business, providing taxi services to customers.  Puaaelo needs a loan to purchase new tires for her taxi. She will use her profits to save and look for a good location to provide the service. Puaaelo joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for her taxi

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Arame est une femme mariée, mère de cinq enfants. Elle vend au marché de sa localité des vêtements et des articles pour femmes notamment des perles, de l'encens, des nuisettes...Elle achète sa marchandise en gros dans la capitale et la revend en détail à une clientèle qui lui est très fidèle. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter des perles, des pagnes et des articles divers.Elle ambitionne de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Arame is a married woman and the mother of five children. At the market in her town, she sells clothing and women's items, particularly beads, incense, and lingerie….  She purchases her goods wholesale in the capital city and sells them retail to a customer base that is very loyal to her. The revenues derived from her business enable her to support herself and to help cover the costs of caring for her family. 

To bolster her stock of merchandise, she is  requesting a loan of 250,000 francs from the microfinance institution U-IMCEC to buy beads, pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and a variety of items. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant

loans.use: to buy beads, "pagne" cloth, and various items

loans.name: Los Blanquillos Del Charco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los blanquillos del charco los integrantes eligieron este nombre porque la comunidad donde viven se llama el charco y varios de ellos se dedican a la venta de pescados y blanquillos, esta historia es acerca del señor francisco ya que es el representante de este grupo, tiene 40 años de edad y está casado con la señora Rosalba, tiene 3 hijos  quienes cursan segundo año de prepa, uno más segundo año de secundaria y Adolfo cuarto año de primaria, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 15 años.

Dice que decidió empezar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor educación y calidad de vida y gozar de una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de vacas, becerros y maíz.

La meta que se ha puesto don francisco es la de hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, estar invistiendo constantemente para ir haciendo crecer el número de animales y tener mejores ventas y producción, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ingresos, para ofrecer un nivel de vida mejor a su familia.

Don chico (como mejor lo conocen en su comunidad) le da las gracias a FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio y así cambiar su vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de don francisco son: Delfino, francisca y Leticia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta de pescados y comercialización de ganado (compra y venta de vacas, becerros, etc.)
texts.en:
This group is named Los Blanquillos del Charco.  The members selected this name because the community where they live is called El Charco. Several of the members sell fish and eggs.

This story is about Francisco because he is the group representative.  He is 40 years old, married to Rosalba, and has three children.  One is in the second year of high school, one is in the second year of middle school, and Adolfo is in fourth grade.  

Francisco has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years.  He decided to start this business activity because he wanted to look for the way to get his children ahead.  He also wanted to give them a better education, to give them a better quality of life, and to enjoy good financial solvency.  He will use the loan he was given to buy cows, calves, and corn.

The goals that Francisco has set are to make his business grow a lot more, to constantly invest in order to increase the number of animals he has, and to have better sales and production.  This will improve and increase his income so that he can give his family a better standard of living.

Chico (as he is better known in his community) thanks FRAC and Kiva because it is thanks to them that he has been able to make his business grow little by little.  This changes his life and that of his family.

His colleagues are Delfino, Francisca, and Leticia.  They devote themselves to different activities like selling fish and marketing livestock (buying and selling cows and calves, etc.).

loans.use: to buy cows, calves, and corn.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Corazon is married and has two children. To make a living, she raises pigs to sell. Corazon has been in her business for 12 years and earns PHP 8,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Corazon joined GDMPC. Corazon is requesting a new loan of PHP 13,000, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Fipe

texts.en: Fipe is 22 years old and married. She owns and operates a business venture printing "elei" (Samoan printed cloth) for making clothes. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Fipe needs a loan to purchase more tools for painting. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy paintbrushes and other printing tools

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Marième est une femme mariée. Elle est mère de trois enfants. Deux de ses enfants fréquentent l'école primaire.Depuis son mariage, elle reste chez elle pour s'occuper, à longueur de journée de ses enfants et des tâches ménagères.Son mari n'ayant plus de les moyens de subvenir seul aux besoins d'entretien de la famille, Marième a commencé un élevage de poulets pour le soutenir. Elle est ainsi parvenu, après un an, à prendre en charge ses propres besoins, à compléter les frais de scolarité des enfants et à améliorer les conditions d'alimentation.Aujourd'hui,elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter 300 poussins, des aliments et des produits vétérinaires.  Son ambition est de passer plus tard à l'élevage de moutons.
texts.en:
Marième is a married woman and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend primary school. Since she was married, she has remained at home taking care of herself and her children all day and doing household chores. Since her husband no longer had the means to support the family by himself, Marième started raising hens to support him. Thus, she has managed to support herself after a year, to cover her children's schooling costs, and to improve the food situation. 

Today, Marième is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy 300 chicks, some feed, and veterinary products. Her ambition is to go on to raising sheep.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks, some feed, and veterinary products

loans.name: Mi Group

texts.es:
El grupo MI lo conforma tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Petrona del Socorro quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo que generalmente vende los viernes, sábados y domingos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años e invertirá el crédito en cerdo, arroz, vegetales, maíz, hoja…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Marina Isabel quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años y María quien elabora y vende nacatamales desde hace 30 años.
texts.en:
The MI group is composed of three hard-working and resourceful people. Petrona del Socorro is one of them, and she engages in preparing “nactamales”, a typical dish made of maize and pork that she generally sells on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She has been engaged in this activity for 10 years, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of pork, rice, vegetables, maize and bay leaves.
The other members of the group are Marina Isabel, who has been running a corner shop for 6 years, and María, who has been preparing and selling nactamales for 30 years.

loans.use: To buy pork, rice, vegetables, maize and bay leaves.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 60-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She provides for her children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she makes monthly from her pig business of three years, as an aid to the income her husband makes. This year she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise. Eugenia wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise

loans.name: Lolomi

texts.en: Lolomi is 36 years old and a single mother with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc. She has two years of experience with this business. Lolomi needs a loan to buy more items. She hopes to use her profits to help send her children to school. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her consumers' needs and wants

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is aged 70, a humble farmer and a single parent living in a thatched house located in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are married and have independent lives. Mey has been involved in the farming business for ages to raise her family, and it's the main source of her family's income. She grows and harvests her rice crops for sustenance and sale annually. On average, she is able to earn approximately USD 3 per day.

To continually sustain her business, Mey would like to obtain a loan to purchase farming materials like seeds and fertilizers and pay for operating expenses. This precious loan will contribute to develop her living status and enable her to go on working toward her goal.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials like seeds and fertilizers and pay for operating expenses.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 46-year-old widow who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For 21 years she has managed her coconut farm business. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Rosemarie became a GDMPC member. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Rosemarie plans to use any profits to expand her business. She is planning to repair her house to create a more conducive place in which to work and live.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Félix Arnulfo

texts.es:
Félix Arnulfo tiene su propio negocio, el cual consiste en una pequeña talabartería, donde elabora albarda y sus accesorio su negocio está ubicado en el municipio de el sauce, actualmente es un joven con espíritu de superación en la vida cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, el cual tuvo la oportunidad de presentarse nuevamente a Ceprodel con el fin de crecer en su propia actividad, ya que es de su conocimiento que Ceprodel siempre lo ha apoyado en su actividad. 
Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Baquetón, tiras de suelo, estribos, tejuelo, Acido, Nelina, Mecates y tules, esto será de gran importancia ya que podrá  elaborar más albardas que le será útil  para el crecimiento de su negocio  le permitirá permanecer estable y con buenos ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Félix Arnulfo has his own business, a small saddlery where he makes packsaddles and accessories.  His business is located in the town of El Sauce.  Currently he is a young man with the spirit of improving his life.  He has two children in his care.  He had the opportunity to come again to CEPRODEL with the goal of growing in his own business.  He knows that CEPRODEL always has helped him in his work.

This is why he came to request a loan to buy tanned cowhide, stirrups, acid, rope, tule fiber, and other leather working supplies.  This will be of great importance because he will be able to make more packsaddles, which will be useful to him for the growth of his business.  It will allow him to stay stable and have a good income in his household.

loans.use: to buy tanned cowhide, stirrups, acid, rope, tule fiber, and other leather working supplies.

loans.name: Alsane

texts.fr: Alsane est un jeune qui tient depuis trois ans une alimentation dans son quartier , en face d'un des guichets de l'UIMCEC.Il vend des denrées et produits alimentaires ainsi que des cartes de recharge de crédit téléphone.Sa boutique est en face de la route nationale qui traverse la ville. Cette position très visible lui assure une grande clientèle et des revenus assez consistants.Il participe  aux  dépenses d'entretien de  sa famille et prend entièrement en charge les frais de location de sa boutique ainsi que les factures d'eau et d'électricité.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du riz, du sucre, de l'huile et d'autres produits alimentaires. Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Alsane is a young man who has had a grocery store for three years in his district. It is located opposite one of the UIMCEC branch offices. He sells provisions, as well as phone minutes recharge cards. His store is facing the Route Nationale, which crosses the city. This location is very visible ensuring him a large customer base and fairly sizable revenues. He helps with the costs of caring for his family and is entirely responsible for covering the rental costs of his store, as well as the water and electricity bills. 

To bolster his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items. His ambition is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items

loans.name: Youba

texts.fr: Youba est un chef de famille qui a en charge son épouse et ses enfants.C'est un boulanger qui exerce ce métier depuis bientôt 10 ans.Avec ses économies, il a commencé la construction de sa maison qui est en phase de finition .Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter du ciment, des carreaux et des portes. Son ambition est de s'engager dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Youba is the head of household who supports his wife and children. He is a baker who has been in this business for nearly ten years. With his savings, he has started building his house and is now in the last phases. He is requesting a  loan of 250,000 francs to buy some cement, paving stones, and doors and gates. His ambition is to become involved in the fattening of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cement, paving stones, and gates and doors.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” en la ciudad del Cusco, este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de abarrotes, venta de golosinas y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo de mantenimiento de carros y transportes. 

(La socia Marilú en la fotografía esta levantando la mano). La socia Marilú nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera. Marilú desde los 17 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un centro comercial muy concurrido por los pobladores de la ciudad del Cusco, ella empezó prestándose dinero de sus hermanos mayores y de sus padres y así empezó el negocio de la venta de ropa y le va muy bien, ella viaja a la ciudad de lima a comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, ella compra ropa dependiendo a la temporada por ejemplo compra ropa para la campaña escolar, compra ropa para la campaña por el día de la madre, compra ropa para las  fiestas de navidad y otras festividades. En esta oportunidad Marilú requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como blusas, chompas, faldas para estas fiestas por el día de la madre. Marilu tambien nos cuenta que estudia la carrera profesional de contabilidad en una universidad privada y que le está yendo muy bien. El sueño de Marilú es tener una galería propia y comprar una flota de buses  interprovinciales.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" in the city of Cusco.  This bank is made up of people who are always seeking new opportunities to get ahead.  They work hard each day to provide a better future for their children.  They have a variety of businesses, including: food sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, grocery sales and candy sales.  Other members provide services such as car maintenance and transportation.  

The member named Marilú is raising her hand in the picture.  Marilú was born in Cusco province, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 19 years old and is single. Ever since she was 17, she's been selling clothing in a shopping center that is very popular with the residents of the city of Cusco.  She started out by borrowing money from her older siblings and from her parents, and in this way launched her business selling clothing.  Her business is going very well.  She travels to the city of Lima to buy merchandise such as, for example, clothing for men, women and children.  She buys clothing according to the season, for example, clothing for the start of the school season, clothing for Mother's Day, clothing for the Christmas holidays, and other holidays.  At this time, Marilú needs a loan to buy merchandise such as: blouses, sweaters, and skirts for Mother's Day.  Marilú tells us that she is studying for a degree in accounting at a private university, and it is going very well.  Marilú's dream is to have her own shopping center and to buy a fleet of long-distance buses.

The members of this group appreciate the opportunity that they are being provided, and they pledge to make their payments according to their various payment schedules.  (The members that appear in the photo at the bottom arrived late to the meeting.)  

Cusco is located in the district, province and department of Cusco, in the heart of the ancient city of the Inkas.  This city is known for its tourism, its archeological centers, its historic center, its countrysides, its history, and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is known for being an area with a lot of commerce and tourism, for its traditional "Inti Raymi" festival, and because it is the gateway to one of the 7 wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, sweaters and skirts for Mother's Day

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, age 43, an industrious farmer who has been residing together with her husband and four children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She owns and manages a farming business to generate her income, while her husband goes fishing and sells fish to share his responsibility for this family. Also, Seng has built a wooden pigpen for raising a few piglets for extra income. Despite their hardships of living, they aim to provide a good education to each of their children, so they might have well-paid jobs rather than involving in agricultural businesses, which provides just a decent income for living.

Due to inadequate capital, Seng is asking for a loan of KHR 2,800,000 to purchase maize seed and fertilizers for farming purpose. She hopes to obtain a good harvest through this investment. She thanks in advance for your support and help.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed and fertilizers for farming purpose.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a 27 woman who is married with 3 children. She plans to start a small business, lawn mowing.  Sera needs a loan to purchase new lawn mowing machine. She will use her profits to helps her kids education. Sera joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase new Lawn Mowing Machine

loans.name: Wencerica

texts.en: Wencerica is married, 41 years of age, and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her 5 kids. Wencerica is operating a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and she earns 5,000 every month. She is requesting a loan of 8,650 to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Wencerica's business is very firm in her community. She joined GDMPC last 2011. In the future, Wencerica will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Monsieur Michel habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 49 ans et s’active dan le secteur de l’aviculture. Il pratique l’activité d’élevage de poulets de chairs. Il capitalise une expérience d’un an six mois dans son activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins  personnels et faire face aux charges de sa famille.
Monsieur Michel est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2004.Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’aliments pour nourrir ses sujets. Son principal objectif est d’améliorer ses revenus et les conditions d’existence  de  vie  au sein de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Michel lives in Sénégal. He is 49 years old and active in the sector of poultry farming. He has a business raising chickens for their meat. He capitalizes on a year and six months of experience in this business, which he chose by necessity with the goal of supporting himself and to cope with family expenses. 

Mr. Michel has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since October 2004. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying some feed for his livestock. His main goal is to improve his revenues and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Taupouga

texts.en: Taupouga is 58 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has 4 years of experience in this line of business. Taupouga needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to helps her grandchildren's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Crop farming has been the primary source of income for Kan’s family. She has been doing this type of business for almost 17 years with a great support from her spouse. She is 36 years old and married with six children, all whom are under her income and need daily allowances. The shortage of finance in the family encourages Kan to work harder and become flexible in her business to generate a suitable income that can ensure the sustainability of her living.

With the loan she has requested, she would like to pay for the laborers plowing and preparing the land, and buy bean seeds to start growing. She believes that she is able to obtain a fruitful harvest in the coming season through her effort. For her business plan, she intends to rent a few plots of land to expand her production next year.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers plowing and preparing the land, and buy bean seeds to start growing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married having 3 children. Marilyn is 24 years old, residing at Carangan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Marilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. In 2011, Marilyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Marilyn wants to build house and to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Regina is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Regina and her husband harvest & sell ocean-caught fish in the local community. Regina has been in her business for 8 years and earns 5,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC. Regina is requesting a loan of 14,650 which will be used to repair fishing materials used. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair fishing materials

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov is a resident who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married to Yim. They have five children, four of whom are already married and live separately and independently around the province. Khov is a local farmer who has been managing farming business for over 30 years. She plants and sells various kinds of crops such as rice, beans, potatoes, maize and vegetables according to each season. 

Khov would like to improve her farm so as to earn more from it. She would like to ensure that she has healthier crops but has inadequate funds now to do so. Therefore she is asking for a loan through HKL to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops. Some day, with consistent effort, determination and patience, Khov will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops.

loans.name: Valavalaaualii

texts.en:
Valavalaualii is 30 years old and married with 4 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows banana and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Valavalaualii needs a loan to purchase more equipment. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Valavalaualii will use the profits from her sales to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and tools for farming.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, 38, married and has 7 children. He lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Philippines. Jessie manages their retail business. They sell a variety of products and food products to local community member for living. He runs this for 7 years and every month he earns 3,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of 4,750 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2008, Jessie joined GDMPC. Jessie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Merlina is married and has four children. To make a living, Merlina plants & harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She work for this for 12 years and earns 3,500 a month for these activities. In 2010, Merlina joined GDMPC. Merlina is requesting a loan of 5,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior est une femme mariée.Elle a une fille qui est mariée et qui lui a donné une jolie petite fille.Elle vit aussi avec sa petite soeur et une bonne partie de la famille. Dior exerce depuis plusieurs années, un commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques; en même temps, elle élève des moutons qu'elle revend de bons prix dés qu'ils arrivent à maturation.Ces  activités lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus et trois moutons.
texts.en:
Dior is a married woman. She has a daughter who is married and who has given her a granddaughter. She also lives with her younger sister and a good part of her family. Dior has been doing commerce in fabrics and cosmetic products for several years; at the same time, she raises sheep, which she resells at good prices as soon as they reach maturity. These businesses enable her to support herself and also to cover the costs of caring for her family. 

To bolster her business, Dior is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy some cloth and three head of sheep.

loans.use: to buy some cloth and three head of sheep

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 43 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. One of her children is a chef who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Pov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Bliss Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Lilia is a widow and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Lilia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Lilia has been in her business for 20 years and earns 8,981 a month for these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2006, Lilia joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nelie manages a plot of corn and coconut farm land for their living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of 6,100 to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings. Nelie is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Nelie plans to save her returns in order to buy another farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en: Bienvinida, a 42-year-old mother of 7 children, is married and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Bienvinida used her last loan to purchase fertilizers. Her dream of expanding is merely coming, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping . In the future she hopes to be able to raise her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Jennifer is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce, in the local community. Jennifer has been in her business for 17 years and earns 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2004, Jennifer joined GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a loan of 15,900 to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola is a 36 year old married woman with 6 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows veggies to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Sikola has requested a loan to to expand her vegetable garden. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Sikola hopes to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers, seeds, cabbages

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has owned and operated a banana plantation to make a living for 10 years now. This business gives Virgilia a monthly income of 5,000.
Having joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services, she has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Virgilia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie is 48 years old, married and has 1 child. He is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his coconut wine retail business is located. He runs this business for 6 years and at the end of the month, Freddie gets 7,000. Freddie joined GDMPC in 2006. He has borrowed 41,500 to buy more coconut wine to sell. He hopes to expand and improve his business one day.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 41 years old, married and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City with her 8 children. She manages a mango and coconut production, type of business 13 years ago that gives her a monthly income of 2,000. With the desire to improve it, she would like to borrow the amount of 3,850 from GDMPC in order to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Gemma has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In God’s time, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is married who has 6 children. Ella is 50 years old, and resides at Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ella plants & harvests vegetables and cassava for sale to earn a living and she's been 21 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. In 2009, Ella joined GDMPC. In the future, Ellawants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is married with 3 children. Rosanna is 42 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rosanna manage her own sari-sari store to earn a living and had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She had requested a loan of 3000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
Rosanna has been a new member of PMPC . In the future, Rosanna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she raises vegetables and roots crops for sale. She has been in her work for 5 years and earns 3,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Liza joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 which will be usedto purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 47 years old, married with three children, residing at Sebasi Clarin, Philippines. Jerry used his last loan to purchase more swine. His business is successful, and his taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen buys and sells fish for a living. She is married and has seven children living with her at Cabd-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Helen is 54 years old. She's been in the fish selling business for 26 years and gets a revenue of PHP 3,000 per month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Helen has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Helen wants to build a house and to put her children through school.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean is 31 years old and blessed with two grown-up children, all of whom are attending school with her income. She is a determined mother and works hard to be financially stable. She spends most of her time working outdoors at the rice field. She manages her rice farming business wisely, because she attended a course related to the agricultural sector and has had many years of experience in this type of business. Presently, she lives with her family in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province.

Yean is experiencing difficulties due to the lack of having a personal use vehicle. She told us that she spends a lot of money on transportation services each month. In this matter, Yean would like to take out a loan to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs. It will enable her to get more benefit from her time, her business, and reduce her daily expenses. Yean aspires to expand her farmland to increase her household income in the following years.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 40 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Merlie has a general store that sells consumable goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Merlie has been a member of PMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: La Estrella Celeste Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Estrella Celeste lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es  Rosa Esmeralda de 35 años de edad quien tiene una pulpería desde hace dos años la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías, gaseosas, refrescos…etc. además comercializa cosméticos. Ella invertirá el crédito en sus dos negocios pero priorizara los cosméticos para el día de las madres.
Las otras integrantes son Skarleth quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años y Mercedes quien vende leña y frijoles desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The group "La Estrella Celeste" [The Heavenly Star] is made up of hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Rosa Esmeralda, 35, who has had a grocery store for two years which she started up with the sale of dairy products, soft drinks, refreshments etc. In addition she sells cosmetics. She will invest the loan in her two businesses, but will give priority to the cosmetics for Mother's Day. 

The other members are Skarleth who devotes herself to selling used clothing, which she has done for three years, and Mercedes who sells firewood and beans which she has done for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase grocery staples and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 51 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Gaudiosa has a business selling a variety of snacks and viands. She earns about PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. Gaudiosa has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and viand business.

Gaudiosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and viand business

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rafaela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rafaela lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es Ana Sofia de 21 años la cual se dedica la venta de calzado desde hace dos años con ayuda de su madre. Esta joven trabaja arduamente para lograr pagarse sus estudios superiores en Derecho y su meta es terminar su carrera.
Los otros integrantes son Melania de 60 años quien vende pollo desde hace 2 años y Lesther de 28 años quien vende leña desde hace 4 meses.
texts.en:
The group "Rafaela" is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial people. The coordinator is Ana Sofia, 21, who dedicates herself to selling footwear which she has done for two years with the help of her mother. This young woman works devotedly in order to be able to pay for her advanced studies in Law and her goal is to complete her studies in the field. 

The other members of the group are Melania, 60, who sells chickens which she has done for two years, and Lesther, 28, who sells firewood which he has done for four months.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, sandals, flip flops, etc.

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Thioro est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l'un fréquente l'université et l'autre tient un commerce.Elle exerce un commerce de chaussures, d'encens et d'autres produits divers. Elle s'approvisionne en gros dans la capitale oû les prix sont plus bas et revend au détail et à crédit à ses clients à travers sa localité.Depuis des années, ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge le frais de scolarité de son fils qui est en phase de terminer aujourd'hui' hui ses études.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des chaussures et de l'encens.Son ambition est d'aider son fils commerçant à voyager à l'extérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Thioro is a married woman and the mother of four children, of whom one is a university student, and another has a business. Thioro has a business selling shoes, incense, and a variety of other products. She gets her supplies wholesale in the capital city, where prices are lower. Accepting credit, she sells retail to her customers throughout her town. 

For years, this business has enabled Thioro to cover the cost of schooling for her son now finishing his studies. 

To bolster her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy shoes and incense. Her ambition is to help her son with the business to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for doors and general maintenance costs for her vehicle.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es una mujer trabajadoras y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de artesanía y cosméticos desde hace 9 años. Este negocio lo inicio cuando fue a visitar a su hermana en Costa Rica y vio que había un buen comercio ahí desde entonces inicio a llevar productos de Nicaragua a Costa Rica. 
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 12 años depende de ella. Su meta es comprar otra casa  ya que la que tenia se la dio a su penultima hija de 20 años.
texts.en:
Ms. Marisol is a hardworking and entrepreneural woman who devotes herself to selling handcrafted items and cosmetics which she has done for nine years. This business got its start when she went to visit her sister in Costa Rica and saw there was good trade there. From that time on she began bringing Nicaraguan products to Costa Rica. 

She has four children of whom only the youngest, who is 12, depends on her. Her goal is to buy another house since she gave the one she used to have  to her next-to-youngest child, her 20-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to purchase handcrafted merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guiancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo   es un hombre que tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Gaincarlo vive en  el caserío Peña Viva del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Giancarlo es la crianza/venta de ganado ovinos, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Giancarlo cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona.
Actualmente Giancarlo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados  y arreglo de corrales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is a 20 year old man who is single and does not have children. He lives in his own house with his parents. He lives in a substance-level community where the majority of residents are independent workers who work in commerce or raising small animals and some also work in agriculture. Giancarlo lives in the village of Peña Viva in the district of Tambogrande and the department of Piura. Here he has only basic electrical supply and they get their water from an artesian well. All the families from here live under these conditions. 
Giancarlo works raising and selling sheep, goats, and poultry. He raises his animals in corrals outside his house. It is noteworthy that Giancarlo has 2 years of experience in this work and, as a result, he has loyal customers. He sells his animals to the wholesalers in the area.
Currently, Giancarlo is proposing to grow his inventory, or, in other words, to raise and sell more animals. This is because it is a very profitable activity in this area. It is for these reasons that he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of $325, which will be used to buy balanced animal feed and fix the corrals. In time, this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and fix the corrals.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.fr:
Madame Fatema, âgée de 45 ans fait du commerce depuis 6 ans. Elle fait de la vente de tissus, d’ensembles prêt à porter, d’encens. Elle est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC.  Elle vend aussi du savon et des produits cosmétiques. Elle demande un renouvellement de 300000Fcfa pour pouvoir  acheter  du parfum, des crèmes, du savon. Elle a un système de vente qui  consiste à donner la marchandise à crédit et à récupérer journalière ment l’argent. Elle réussi à rembourser normalement son crédit  et à diversifier ses produits et services.
Fatema est mariée et appui son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. 
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait agrandir son activité en  variant ses ventes.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatema, aged 45, has been working in commerce since the age of 6. She sells fabrics, ready-to-wear outfits, and incense. She also sells soap and cosmetics. She is asking for a renewal of 300,000 francs CFA to be able to buy perfume, lotions, and soap. 

Fatema has system for selling that consists of offering merchandise on credit and collecting the money daily. She has succeeded in paying back her loan normally and in diversifying her products and services. 

Fatema is married and supports her husband in managing day-to-day expenses.  

In the future, she would like to expand her business by varying her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, cosmetic products, and ready-to-wear outfits to resell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio   es un hombre que tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, con un hijo a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rogelio vive en  el caserío Cólera del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad  a la que se dedica Rogelio es la agricultura pues tiene 2.0 ha. De terreno agrícola , en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón  que presenta buen desarrollo vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 7 años que le ha permitido tener  de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, venta de pollo fresco en casa y le apoya en las actividades que realiza, es decir existe una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Rogelio se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechado ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de fertilizantes, bioestimulantes, y compra de alimentos para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 54 year old man who is not married and has a son in his care. He lives in his own house with his partner. He lives in a subsistence-level community. The majority of residents are independent workers who work in commerce or raising small animals and some also work in agriculture. Rogelio lives in the village of Cólera in the district of Tambogrande and the department of Piura. Here he has only basic electrical service and water from an artesian well. All the families from here live under the same conditions.
Rogelio is a farmer and he has 2 hectares of agricultural land in which he grows lemons, which grow well. He harvests weekly and later sells the goods in the local market. He has been doing this for 7 years, which has given him plenty of experience and enabled him to maintain loyal customers for his business. His partner works raising small animals and selling fresh chickens from home and he helps her with her work. That is to say, they have a good family relationship. 
Currently, Rogelio is proposing to grow his inventory, that is, increasing the harvested fruit that he sells. This is because this is a very profitable product in the area. For these reasons he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for $575 which he will use to buy fertilizers and food for his animals. In time, this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy food for his animals.

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.es:
El grupo mano amiga lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es Mariela quien tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con algunos productos principalmente chiverías y refrescos. En el negocio vende aproximadamente 43,600 mensual. Ella está casada con Marvin quien trabaja en Costa Rica y con el que tiene tres hijos.
El crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos y refrescos entre otros productos.
Las otras integrantes son Amparo del Socorro quien vende ropa desde hace 30 años en San Rafael y Anielka vende ropa en Diría.
texts.en:
The Mano Amiga Group is composed of three entrepreneurial, hard-working women and Mariela is the coordinator of the group.  She has a small grocery store which began by selling just a few products, mainly snacks and soft drinks.  The business sells approximately 43,600 monthly.  Mariela is married to Marvin, he works in Costa Rica, and they have three children.

The loan will be invested in bulk grains, soft drinks, and other products.

The other members of the group include Amparo who has sold clothing for 30 years in San Rafael, and Anielka who sells clothing in Diria.

loans.use: to buy grains, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Palestina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Palestina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María Luisa quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita (tacos, tajadas con queso, enchiladas, maduro frito…etc.) el crédito lo invertirá en aceite, carne, tortilla, leña…etc. 
Ella está casada con Marlon quien es chofer y con quien tiene dos hijos.
Las otras integrantes son  Perla quien  tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años y Suhey quien vende cosméticos y perfumes desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Palestina loan group is comprised of 3 hardworking women, one of whom is María Luisa, who has a "fritanga", a popular type of restaurant that sells fried food (tacos, cheese tajadas, enchiladas, fried plantains, etc.) She will use the loan to buy oil, meat, tortilla, wood, etc.
She is married to Marlon, who is a driver, and they have 2 children.
The other members are Perla, who has had a grocery store for 8 years, and Suhey, who has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for 4 years.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, tortillas, wood, etc.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro  es un hombre que tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con tres hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Lázaro vive en  el caserío Manco Inca del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad  a la que se dedica Lázaro es la agricultura pues tiene 6.0 ha. De terreno agrícola, en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón y mango  que presenta buen desarrollo vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 15 años lo que le ha permitido tener  de experiencia; Así mismo su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, aves de corral), y le apoya en las actividades que realiza, es decir existe una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Lázaro se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechado ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 4000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, y compra de alimentos para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lazaro is a 59-year-old man whose status is married, with three dependent children, and who lives in his own home with his spouse. The quality of life in the community where he lives is subsistence. The majority of inhabitants are independent workers who devote themselves to commerce and small animal husbandry. Some of them also cultivate crops. Lazaro lives in the Manco Inca hamlet in the district of Tambogrande and department of Piura. He has only basic services including electricity, and obtains water by means of a traditional well. All the families who are based there likewise live under these same circumstances. 

Lazaro devotes himself to agriculture as he has 6.0 hectares of farmland where he has planted lime and mango crops which are showing good vegetative development. He harvests his crops weekly and then sells them in the area's local market. He has been developing his farming activities for 15 years which has granted him experience. Likewise his spouse devotes herself to raising small animals (sheep and poultry) and supports him in his farming activities. Thus there are good family relations. 

Currently Lazaro has determined to expand his inventory with respect to the sale of his harvested products, since it is a very profitable activity in the area. Therefore he is seeking a new loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 4,000 Peruvian soles which is to be used for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides and feed for his animals. In time this will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his crops and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guadalupana lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Silvia Patricia quien desde hace dos años inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de  comida para animales, medicamento y champú en Niquinomo. El crédito lo invertirá en purina, pro-plan, dhog chow, pet pride, can pro, medicamentos y champús, jabones…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Rosa Esperanza quien vende hojas negocio que realiza junto a sus siete hijos y esposo, Bertha es comerciante de ropa y zapatos y Rodolfo tiene un billar donde vende gaseosa.
texts.en:
The group "Guadalupana" consists of four hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Silvia Patricia, who started her small business two years ago. She sells pet food, medicines, and shampoos in Niquinomo. Her loan will be invested in brand name products such as Purina, Pro-Plan, Dog Chow, Pet Pride, Can Pro, as well as medicines, shampoos, soaps, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Rosa Esperanza sells leaves, a business that she manages with her husband and seven children. • Bertha is a merchant who sells clothing and shoes. • Rodolfo manages a billiard hall where he also sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy pet food, medicines, and shampoo.

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en: Hagie is 33 years old, married with three kids living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Hagie used her last loan to purchase fertilizer. She was able to develop her business well. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. She hopes to be able to nurture her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco, aged 77, is a widower with four children, residing in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Francisco used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is from Kinuman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Visitacion is widowed and has four children. Visitacion plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in her business for seven years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. In 2006, Visitacion joined GDMPC. Visitacion is requesting a loan of PHP 15,850, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop. She plans to use her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 58 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Touch is involved in a rice farming business to generate income. Also, she owns and operates a small store located in a local school, where her husband is a professional teacher. She sells snacks, sweets and beverages to students, earning a suitable income, which she spends on food and allowances for her children.

To improve her business, she is now asking for a loan to purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits and other merchandise to sell in her store. She hopes that the loan will enable her to make improvements to this business and make it aviable source of income. Touch would be glad if her requested loan amount was approved.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits and other merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 52-year-old businessman. He is married to Florence, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a hotel for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Titus will use the loan to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his business

loans.name: Nicolata

texts.en:
Nicolata is a 51-year-old business lady. She is married to Edward and they have three children. Nicolata has been selling secondhand clothes in wholesale for the past 10 years, with an approximate monthly income of KES 50,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Nicolata is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. The client will use the loan to buy more stock, like pullovers and trousers for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will add more stock and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own the biggest boutique in Embu Town and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pullovers and trousers for a new shop

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is married with 3 children. She is 33 years old and resides in Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Cherlita has been in business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC.

She request a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more rolls of string made from lagpakanay (a kind of plant). In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of string made from lagpakanay (a kind of plant)

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Adji Astou

texts.fr: Madame Adji  Astou est mariée et âgée  de 28 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle pratique  la vente  de produits cosmétiques et  d’habits dans  son quartier d’habitation. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par  nécessité, afin de subvenir a ses propres  besoins. Les aspects qui l’intéressent  le plus dans son activité sont les moments de rencontre et d’échange  avec ses clients  mais aussi  la  réalisation des bénéfices qu’elle lui procure. Elle est membre de L’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2011.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et d’habits qui seront destinés à la vente. Ce financement pourra l’aider à développer son activité, augmenter ses  bénéfices et participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Adji  Astou is married and 28 years old. She lives in Sénégal and is active in the commercial sector. She sells cosmetics and clothing in her residential district. This is a business she chose out of necessity to support herself.  What interests her the most in her business are the times she meets and interacts with her customers but also making a profit from it. 

Ms. Adji  Astou has been a member of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since December 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for buying cosmetics and clothing to be sold. This financing will help her to develop her business, increase her profits, and help improve her family's economic and social situation.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and clothing to resell

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Torre lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Ercilia de 46 años quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, vende hielo y leña.
