Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de sopa los lunes, sábados y domingo luego empezó a realizar tacos, tajadas, enchiladas…etc. Además tiene una barbería la cual administra su hijo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mejoras al negocio principalmente cambiar el techo del negocio, comprar un cocina y productos para la barbería. 
Martha tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres son menores de 19, 16 y 3 años los cuales estudian.
Los otros integrantes son María de 54 años quien tiene una dulcería donde produce los típicos postres nicaragüense las cajetas, pillo quinto, atol, buñuelos….etc. y Candido quien es buhonero de golosinas desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The Las Torres (The Towers) group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. 

One of them is Martha Ercilia, age 46.  She has a “fritanga”, a popular fried food restaurant.  She also sells ice and firewood.  She started  this business by selling soup on Mondays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  Then she started to make tacos, sliced plantains, and enchildadas, etc.  In addition to that she has a barber shop that her son runs.

She will use the loan to make improvements to her business.  She will mainly change the roof on her business, buy a stove, and buy products for the barber shop.

Martha has five children.  Three of them are minors, ages 19, 16, and 3, and they go to school.  

Her fellow group members are María, age 54,who sells typical Nicaraguan sweets and Cándido, who has been peddling sweets for 20 years.

loans.use: to change the roof on her business, buy a stove, and buy products for the barber shop.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia buys and sells fish for a living. She is married and has three children living with her in Cabd-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Ignacia is 51 years old. She's been in the fish selling business for 25 years and receives an income of PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair her fishing boat. Ignacia has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ignacia wants to build a house and put her children through school.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus, 66, resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Cristeta the mother to their four children – all of them have already had their own families. Jesus, manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jesus operates a room/apartment rental business. He is currently managing nine units that local students and employees rented on a monthly basis. He earns a minimum of 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 37,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of his rental units. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jesus hopes to be able to do his renovation soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his rental units

loans.name: Maria Nia

texts.en:
This is Maria Nia, 40, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Jessiemar, her business partner, and is mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Nia is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Nia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish needed in her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 52-year-old farmer with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Before venturing in to the agricultural sector, he used to sell secondhand shoes, where he accumulated his start-up capital for his current projects. He has a personal dream of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. His business is affected by seasonal changes and price fluctuations and his goal is to become one of the role model farmers. Patrick wants a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en: Concordia is married with 8 children. Concordia is 55 years of age and she lives in Pulang Yuta, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Concordia manages a retail store; she sells a variety of products and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Concordia has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, Concordia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en:
Wanjiru is a 55-year-old horticultural and livestock farmer. She is married to John, who is a carpenter, and they have three children aged 25, 15, and 13 years of age. She has been in operating the business for the past five years with an average income of KES 40,000 monthly, which she uses to support her family.

She intends to use the loan to add more cows for milk production and lease new land for horticulture. The anticipated profits from the expanded business will be used to educate her son in college and buy new land for farming. 

Her future dreams are to own a large track of land for farming and ensure that her child gets a high-quality education.

loans.use: to add more cows for milk production and lease new land for horticulture

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ya son mayores, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula Cortes.
Maribel hace 5 años tiene un negocio de venta de Ropa de segunda mano. Inicio este negocio con la necesidad de generar un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos diarios del hogar. Ella acondiciono un lugar en una parte de su casa en donde manifiesta le ha ido muy bien ofreciendo a sus clientes ropa de Damas, caballeros y niños, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos y esta muy contenta trabajando en el.
 Es su primer préstamo con ODEF de 10,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio. 
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, poder comprar un carro para también vender su mercadería de manera ambulante y poder aumentar más sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maribel is 46 years old, married, and has three grown children. She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula Cortes.

Maribel has been in the business of selling secondhand clothing for five years. She started this business out of necessity so that she could generate extra income to help her husband with the daily household expenses. Maribel remodeled a space in her house where she could set up her business. She has done very well since she offers her customers clothes for women, men, and children. This business generates a good income and she is very pleased to be working in it.

This is her first loan with ODEF. The amount of 10,000 HNL will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise to restock her business. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can buy a car. She also sells her merchandise as a traveling merchant so that she can increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana Erina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien vende truchas y granos básicos desde hace 12 años la cual inicio con muchas limitaciones y poco a poco fue amentándola con lo cual logro sacar adelante a su familia. Ella está casada y tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad.
Su sueño es poder trabajar sola sin más préstamos.
texts.en:
Emiliana Erina is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman that has sold trout and dry grains for 12 years.  Her business began with lots of challenges and little by little things improved, which helped her family get ahead.  She is married and has three adult children.

Her dream is to be able to work alone without asking for more loans.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains and trout

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, 56, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a driver, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amelita operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, process it then repacked them and sell them per piece to individual, general store owners and local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She also sells accessories for additional income. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Amelita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married with one child. She is 52 years of age and lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. Marilyn used her last loan to purchase goods to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 41 years old and married with four school-aged children. She resides with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Being a responsible mother, Sam tries hard and is patient in her business of planting crops. And she also devotes her time to manage household things and educate her children to follow a good path in life. Sam has been doing this type of business alongside her husband, a supportive man, for more than 20 years.

At this time, Sam would like to expand and make improvements to her business, so she is asking for a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to pay for the operating expenses of planting potatoes for future selling. This will be her second loan from HKL. She said that the previous loan helped her a lot in developing her business. She hopes to make a good income from this investment and save some more for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses of planting potatoes for future selling

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 37-year-old businessman. He is married to Caroline and they are blessed with two children. Bernard runs a stationery shop, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. He intends to start a retail shop as his secondary business.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. The client will use the loan to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar for his new identified business opportunity of a retail shop. 

With the anticipated profits from his two businesses he plans to plough back into his businesses and educate his children. His future dream is to operate a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Corazon runs a sari-sari (general) store business in her town. She sells canned goods, toiletries and other items. She also sells firewood and charcoal to her community. Corazon earns 3000 PHP per month with her business. She hopes to expand the variety of merchandise she sells. She plans to use her loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and firewood.

In the future, Corazon hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and firewood

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 58, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rebecca dreams to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou est commerçant depuis 12 ans maintenant. Un commerce qui consiste à vendre des batteries de véhicules .Il possède un atelier  ou il a investi les deux crédits pris à l’IMCEC. Actuellement, il désire un prêt de 450000FCFA pour acheter 20 batteries et  120 bouteilles d’acide ; parce que en dehors du commerce, il fait aussi de la prestation de services.
C’est avec les revenus de son activité qu’il réussi à gérer au quotidien la dépense de son foyer et à être  au petit soin de ses enfants.
Il a comme souhait d’avoir un fond de roulement consistant afin de proposer d’autres services à sa clientèle ; et cela il compte énormément sur l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou has been a merchant for twelve years now. It's a business that consists of selling vehicle batteries. He owns a store where he has invested the two loans gotten from the microfinance institution IMCEC. 

Currently, he would like a loan of 450,000 francs CFA to buy 20 batteries and 120 bottles of acid, since he also offers a range of services aside from his trade. 

With the revenues from his business, Mr. Abdou is successful in managing his day-to-day home expenses and in caring for his children attentively.

His wish is to have working capital substantial enough to offer more services to his customer base; and so he is counting on the support of his lenders enormously.

loans.use: to buy vehicle batteries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to make the food,and  to build an “ECOFUGON” ( improved wood-burning cook stove that is more efficient in producing plant carbon of better quality).

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres y hombres que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son los integrantes de la alcancía comunal Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara conformado por 10 socios, llevan la ardua tarea de trabajar en sus negocios para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Tal es así el caso de la señora Vilmar de 58 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad. La señora Vilmar cada día se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Todo comenzo ya que su hermana tiene el mismo negocio, le ayudo y enseñó, a como poner su propio negocio. Con los ingresos de su negocio a podido llevar adelante a su familia y pudo ayudar a su esposo en la construccion de su vivienda. Con el presente préstamo implementara  la mercadería para sus ventas de ropa. Como ella cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero, si en algo coinciden es en el entusiasmo y las ganas de salir adelante para el bien y mejoría económica de sus negocios y familias.
texts.en: This is a group of men and women who have a lot of enthusiasm, and they are dedicated to getting ahead each day.  The members of the communal bank "Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara" include 10 people who work arduously in their businesses so that they can improve the quality of life for their families.  Such is the case with Vilmar, 58, who is married and is the mother of 3 grown children.  Every day, Vilmar works selling clothing for men, women and children.  It all started because her sister has the same business, and she taught Vilmar and helped her to establish her own business.  She has been able to get ahead with her family with the income from her business, and has been able to help her husband in building their home.  With the current loan, she will stock up on more merchandise for her clothing business.  Like Vilmar, every member of this group has a particular story, but what they share in common is the enthusiasm and desire to get ahead so that they can improve their businesses and provide for the welfare of their families.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, process it then repacked them and sell them per piece to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzviminda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 40-year-old businessman. He is married to Benedetta and their marriage is blessed with children. He owns a metals workshop and supplies building metals to construction sites and schools. He earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. Abraham will use the loan to add more stock of metals. He will use the proceeds from the business to educate his children and improve his family's living standards. 

His future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business, a happy family, and be a big supplier of construction metals in his hometown.

loans.use: to add more stock of metals

loans.name: Zoriada

texts.en: Zoriada, 42, is a married woman with six children. She resides in Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Zoriada used her last loan to purchase additional fish to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. By now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to raise. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Yasmeen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen akhtar is 34 years old, a married woman, and by this relationship has four children: three sons and one daughter. Besides her youngest son, the others are getting their educations.
 
Yasmeen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and manage the household works. She has a set routine to wake up early in the morning and prepare her kids for school and prepare breakfast for the family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Yasmeen’s husband is a motor mechanic by profession and provides motorbikes repairing services to the customers. He is very efficient and experienced in his work and has been doing it for over many years.  

Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan by buying the latest repairing tools to provide better services to his customers and earn better profits. 

Yasmeen is very confident that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy the latest repairing tools

loans.name: El Hadji Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji Omar habite dans un petit village situé  à environ 22 km de la ville principale ou il a installé un atelier  de vente de produits agricoles. Une activité qui marche dans cette zone car étant  propice à l’agriculture, et surtout à la culture maraichère. Il a une expérience de plus de 12 ans dans le domaine.
Il est à son 6ème prêt et veut acheter 300 sacs d’engrais  et le stocker dans son atelier. Grace aux revenus de l’activité, il peut épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
El Hadji Omar est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Il souhaite augmenter son capital avec l’appui des financiers comme IMCEC afin de pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir achat.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Omar lives in a small village located about 22 km from the principal city where he set up a shop selling farm products. This is a business that works in this area, which is suitable for agriculture and especially market gardening. He has over twelve years of experience in this domain. 

Mr. El Hadji Omar is on his sixth loan and wants to buy 300 sacks of fertilizer and store it in his shop. Thanks to the revenues from his business, he can save money and improve his family's food situation.

Mr. El Hadji Omar is married and a father of a family. He takes care of the day-to-day expenses of his household. He would like to increase his capital with the support of financiers like IMCEC in order to be able to increase his buying power.

loans.use: to buy farm products for resale

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 50 years old and married to Nov, an operator of a horse-pulled trailer in a small village of Prey Chor district. The couple has six children, all of whom are able to earn income individually. Kang doesn’t want to ask for financial support from her children. She wants to earn income independently, because she still has the potential to operate her farming business, which is located in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Kang has been doing this business for more than 20 years. In the previous two months, Kang bought a house that fits to her family's size; however, she has not paid back for the house successfully due to the shortage of funds to afford it. 

In this regard, Kang is seeking a loan of KHR 3,500,000 to pay off her outstanding amount to the owner of the house. She is confident that she can pay her loan back to our lenders through her effort. She has been a client of HKL for many years, and this will be her sixth loan. Kang has already paid off her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: To pay off her outstanding amount to the owner of the house

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en: Pablina is a 61-year old resident of Silanga, Tangub City. She provides for her 2 children's needs from the small amount of PHP 4,000 she gains each month from her piggery business.  She has been in the business for 14 years, to supplement the income her husband earns. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and she has applied for a microfinance loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feeding supplies. Pablina wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a farmer in Olkalau for the last 12 years. She practices dairy farming, and also plants cash crops like maize, beans and cabbages.  Her farm has been very profitable. She is 44 years old and married to James, who is also a farmer.  The couple has four children.

This will be her first loan and she plans to buy fertilizer as well as maize, cabbage and bean seeds for planting during this planting season.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve her farming business and make more income, hence improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has taken his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase another quarry site.

He hopes to purchase a piece of land where he can build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is a diligent woman who has been operating a rice farming business for her income. She is 45 years old and is a single parent responsible for three children. Despite her hardship, Men aims to provide her children with comfortable living and good educations. She has been engaged in her business since she was a single woman living with her parents. 

Presently she lives with her three children in a small house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Men would like to build a stronger ladder for her house because her old ladder has become decayed and is not safe enough for the family. So now she is asking for a loan of KHR 800,000 to build her ladder. She is very happy and appreciates the support from our lenders.

loans.use: to build a ladder to get up to her house

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been engaged in the business for five years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in financial management. This has helped her to budget.

Gladys hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to expand her business premises.

loans.use: To expand her business premises

loans.name: Zergile

texts.en:
Zergile is a 54-year-old woman, married with two children. She is on pension and her primarily business is breeding livestock. She breeds sheep and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat to local butchers. Zergile has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her how best to look after cattle.

Zergile usually buys small cattle or lambs, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.   She sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk- and meat-selling brings 150 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income. Zergile applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase one milk cow, one additional cow and five sheep.  This will be her third loan from AqroInvest, and Zergile has a good client history. She wishes to save money and build her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow, one cow and five sheep

loans.name: Merziya

texts.en:
Merziya is a 46-year-old woman married with one son. She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Merziya has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best way to look after cattle and who currently helps her to run the business.

Merziya usually buys small cattle and sheep, raises, and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for more profitable prices in the local livestock bazaar. Meat-selling brings 200 AZN income per month. Beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Also, she sells sheep fur, which is useful for clothes and blankets.  
 
This is only one financial income. Merziya applied for 1,200 AZN to purchase two cows and two sheep. This will be her second loan from AqroInvest and Merziya has good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cows and two sheep

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 38 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he has a tailoring business. He has grown his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. He has also been trained in business management skills by Faulu Kenya. This has helped him to grow his business.
Silas desires to expand his business and employ people. He needs 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 43-year-old man living in his own semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in local brew and has been in business for over ten years.With the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children and provide for their other basic needs. He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and expanding his business to other areas. Robert needs a loan to buy local brew for selling.

loans.use: to buy local brew for selling

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cosmetics for four years.  She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Juliet needs the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en:
Nazkhanim is 59 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children.  She has been engaged in poultry breeding for the last 10 years. Nazkhanim and her husband are on pensions and her business is only source of income in her family. Her son helps Nazkhanim to look after poultry.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people and many national dishes are made of chicken and turkey. People use different kind of poultry in different seasons. In autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey, in spring and summer, they use chicken. Nazkhanim's income per month is 280 AZN.

Now she would like to increase the number of poultry and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. She is going to buy more chicken, sell them for a profitable price, and hence increase her profit. This will be her seventh loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: Roladis

texts.es: Roladis de 19 años de edad es una universitaria que se dedica a la actividad comercial, en su pequeño negocio donde  vende refrescos, mecatos y productos de dulcería en un punto comercial ubicado en su lugar de vivienda, en la ciudad de Cartagena;  con sus ingresos consigue responder a sus gastos personales y tiene metas de crecimiento personal y empresarial asociadas a su negocio. Su principal clientela está ubicada alrededor de su negocio y vende de contado a una frecuencia diaria y de contado. Sus aspiraciones de crecer y lograr aumentar sus ingresos, no se detienen y se convierten en su gran desafío, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará gaseosas, y productos de dulcería principalmente. Ella planea aplicará capital de crédito a su negocio paulatinamente para conseguir su crecimiento, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará   al por mayor y de contado artículos de dulcería y refrescos,  aprovechando que para el día de las madres el volumen de ventas de su negocio se incrementa.
texts.en:
Roladis is a 19-year-old university student who also manages a small business where she sells soft drinks, packaged lunches, and candies. Her business is located in a retail space in the area where she lives in the city of Cartagena. With her earnings, Roladis is able to cover her personal expenses. Her goals are to grow personally and as an entrepreneur as she operates her business. Her main customers are from the areas surrounding her business. Her sales are cash-based and are generated on a frequent basis each day. Roladis has aspirations of growing and increasing her earnings. Her greatest challenge is to keep her business in operation. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy mainly sodas and candy.

She plans to utilize the capital from her loan a little bit at a time so that her business will continue growing. This Kiva loan is her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it will enable her to buy candy and soft drinks in bulk and with cash. Rolandis plans to take advantage of Mother's Day, a time when the sales in her business increase.

loans.use: to buy candy and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows to fatten and re-sell later at a higher price.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira is a 51-year-old woman, married with three children. She is a professional baker who bakes bread and local pita with meat and greens. She has four years of experience and she does her work perfectly. She uses only organic products and bakes bread in a special oven that is fueled with natural wood. That’s why her bread is in high demand, and the scent of it carries far beyond her home when she bakes. 

The bakery is located inside the yard of her house, so she is able to work from home. Her son helps her to fire the furnace and prepare the dough.  These are hard processes that require a lot of strength. This is only one financial income in Khatira's family, because she is on a pension that is too low.

She has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase more products for her oven and for the dough. This will be her third loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more products for her oven and the dough

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for nine years and is passionate about his career.  His personal goal is to educate his children and to build a permanent house for residence.  Rauben wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 69 years old and a widow. She is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Julieta earns 5000 PHP per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Julieta hopes that through her loan, her harvest will improve. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Angel Roberto

texts.es:
Angel es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros, asimismo encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina” y también se encuentra en Templo del Señor de Luren cuya fiesta patronal es en el mes de Octubre. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería Mecánica.

Día a Día Angel sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con mucha dedicación todo el día y porque es amable con los clientes.

Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar los trámites para su licencia de conducir ya que está a punto de caducar; con esta mejora evitara tener algunas infracciones y para tener mayor seguridad cuando conduce, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando para así realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y un auto”.
texts.en:
Angel is a 21 year old young man. He lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by a warm climate all year long, and is also known for the development of agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, paprika and others. We also find the attractive tourist attraction, the Huacachina Lagoon and the Sanctuary of the Lord of Luren whose patron saint festival is in the month of October. Due to limited financial resources he only attended high school, but he would have liked to study Mechanical Engineering.

Every day Angel goes to work in his business as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works about ten hours a day and can serve up to thirty clients a day. He believes that his business it going well because he works with a lot of dedication every day and because he is friendly to his clients.

Angel is very happy with the Kiva loans and thanks to the help that they have provided he can complete the paperwork for his driver’s license which is on the point of expiring, and with this opportunity he will avoid some fines and will have greater peace of mind while driving, so he can continue working in order to achieve his greatest dream: “to have his own house and a car.”

loans.use: for official paperwork required for driver's license

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor José Alejandro es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien es contador público jubilado quien trabaja como asesor  desde hace 10 años. Él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos.
El crédito que solicita es crédito personal el cual lo invertirá en reparaciones de la vivienda y los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. José Alejandro is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman. He is a retired public accountant, but he has worked as a consultant for the past 10 years. José Alejandro is married and has four children.

He is requesting a personal loan that will be invested in home repairs and the education of his children.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs and his children's education.

loans.name: Safayat

texts.en:
Safayat is 57 years old, and she is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children.  She has been breeding poultry for the last 10 years. Her husband and she are on pensions, and her business is the only source of income in her family. Her husband helps Safayat to look after the poultry.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people, and many national dishes are made out of chicken and turkey. People use different kinds of poultry in different seasons. In the autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey, and in the spring and summer, people only use chicken. Safayat's income each month is 300 AZN.

She would like to increase her number of poultry to raise, and for this purpose, she applied for a 1500 AZN loan. She is going to buy more chicken and sell them at a profitable price, and hence, increase her profit. This will be her third loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to increase her income

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Vincent, who is a businessman. The couple has three children aged nine, five, and three years old.

Milka sells tomatoes, a business she has been doing for the last six years. She makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes. Her profits will be used to start another business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul is 58 years old and is married. She has been blessed with five children, three of whom are already married and living separately. With the help of her rice farming business, she can satisfy the family's daily necessities and sustenance. She has operated this business for more than 30 years. Despite this, she patiently works hard in her business, hoping that it will provide her with a better income.

With the eagerness to gain enough income, Hul is asking for a loan of USD 500 that will be used to rent a plot of farmland to increase her rice production in the coming harvesting season. She hopes that this will provide good results and let her earn a higher income.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland to increase her rice production

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. She also raises sheep for meat purposes. Zarovsha has more than twenty years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her the best way to look after cattle. Her husband works as builder and receives 80 AZN in salary, which is too low to support family.

Zarovsha usually buys small cattle, then raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  She sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings an income of 150 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and also are present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income in her family and not enough to cover the basic needs of her beloved children. Zarovsha applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase two calves and one dairy cow.  This will be her fifth loan and she has positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy two calves and one dairy cow.

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush and his wife have been engaged in pig breeding and gardening for about 17 years. They breed 3 pigs and 5 piglets and grow apples, pears, plums, etc., in Ijevan. Generally, Artush uses fruit for his family needs, but in productive years he sells fruit as well. Artush sells pork to butchers and also to his neighbors. Pig breeding allows Artush to provide the major part of his family’s needs.  
Artush has 3 children: 2 sons, who are pupils and a 20-year-old daughter, who is looking for a job now. Artush is 44 years old. Along with pig breeding and gardening he works as a taxi driver. Artush says that driving is not sufficiently profitable, so his agricultural business is the main source of income for his family. 
This is Artush’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a sow and a large lot of fodder for his pigs. Artush has never been late with his repayment.

loans.use: to buy a sow and a large lot of fodder for his pigs.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 29-year-old lady. She is married to Peter and they have three children aged ten, seven, and nine months. The family comes from Kisumu City, West of Kenya.

Millicent operates a timber business, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of timber for sale. 


Her profits will be used to grow the business. Her dream is to expand the timber business.

loans.use: to buy more timber for sale..

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He also has three siblings. Hasan is doing the best he can to support his family and offer them a fair way of living. Hasan works to provide some help to his father who’s the family's main income provider. He has been working as a car painter since 2010 and has his own garage. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his garage and buy a minivan for his business.  In that way, he will be able to transport his tools easily. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage where he can serve more clients.

loans.use: to enlarge his garage and buy a minivan for his business.

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha is a 60-year-old woman.  She is a widow and raises three children alone. She is an IDP and lives on a Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Zarovsha has been breeding cattle for more than 25 years. She receives 120 AZN in financial support from the government monthly, but this is too little to cover her family's needs.

Zarovsha usually buys calves, raises them, and fattens them for 5-6 months.  She then resells them for a more profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Her son helps her to look after the cattle and sell them at the bazaar.  Her monthly income is 100 AZN, and this business is the main source of income for her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1300 AZN loan to purchase three cattle. This will be her second loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: To buy three cattle

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha, age 27, is a garment worker. Her husband, Lat, is a construction worker. They just married in 2012 and have no children yet. 

Ratha lives with her uncle and grandmother in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She wants her own house, so she has decided to apply for her first Kiva loan in order to build her own place to stay.

loans.use: to build her own house.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy firewood to sell to schools and reaped a lot of profits. His personal goal is to educate his children, and his business goal is to expand his firewood business as it has proved to be very lucrative. His main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. Bonny needs a loan to buy trees for firewood.

loans.use: to buy trees for firewood.

loans.name: Kimsuo

texts.en: Kimsuo is 51 years old, a widow and the mother of one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and the other one works for a hotel in Phnom Penh. Her son is employed full time. Kimsuo lives with her parents in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She earns a living by growing small trees. She is applying for her first loan, for $700, so that she can add it to some savings she has set aside to buy a motorbike for her son to use to drive to work. Because her son does not now have his own transportation, he currently commutes to and from work with a neighbor.

loans.use: to help buy a motorbike for her son to use to drive to work.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish. She made good sales, hence more profits. 


She has requested another loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish and renovate her business premises. She hopes to become more financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish and renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Purza

texts.en:
Purza is 47 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She earns a living as a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has more than 10 years experience in this field, and very skilled at what she does. 

Purza usually sells her crops in the town's central bazaar. People in her area shop for fresh vegetables everyday because they believe they are crucial for staying healthy. They are also the basis of many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are also popular to have on the table and are used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 80 AZN, but raising crops takes a lot of strength and means lots of time spent working out of doors. That is why Purza relies on help from her son. She is requesting a loan for AZN 1,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve quality of the food she grows and increase her income. This will be her second loan, and she has good client history with our organization.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 30-year-old businessman who is married and lives with his two children in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he has earned a living for the last five years by running a retail shop. He opened this shop with money he saved while working as a motorcycle driver. The main challenge he faces is a shortage of funds to keep his store stocked with goods. His dreams are to build a permanent home for his family and to move his business to a more permanent location. He is requesting this loan to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en:
Ousama is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working. 

After finding it hard to cover his family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and combine forces with his brother. Ousama started his own work as a painter in 2010 on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well-organized work. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional painting supplies for his business. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to start his new project properly. 

In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting supplies for his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 29-year-old farmer and she also runs a salon. She is married to Antony, a school teacher, and they have one son, aged five years. She has been in this business for the past two years with an average income of KES 50,000 per month used to support her family.  

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. The purpose of the loan is to add stock of cosmetics (braids, hand and body lotion, weaves etc). 

The proceeds from the expanded business will be used to open another salon and educate her son. Her future dream is to own a wholesale cosmetic shop in town that is of its own kind.

loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics (braids, hand and body lotion, weaves, etc.)

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is taking out another loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to expand her existing business. With the loan she will be able to buy a new printer. 

She is now managing to pay for her children’s school fees and she dreams of buying a plot of land to build a rental house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new printer.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement, where she has earned a living for the last six years by breeding cattle. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployment and she is now the family's sole means of support.  

Zeynab usually buys young cows, raises and fattens them for five or six months, and then resells for a profit at the local livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is AZN 300. Demand for her products is strong because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, where it is used in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolma. Zeynab also keeps additional cows for milking. Some of this milk is used by her family and some is sold to neighbors.  

Zeynab wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan for AZN 1,000 to buy one baby calf and one milk cow. This will be her second loan. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy one baby calf and one milk cow.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng (in the photo) is 42 years old and his wife is 41 years old. They have been married since 1988 and they have two sons and one daughter. Both sons are policemen and the daughter is attending university. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Cheng is a policeman, while his wife is a public primary school teacher. Cheng is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for his wife to drive to her teaching job.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his wife to drive to her teaching job.

loans.name: Somoye

texts.en:
Somoye, now a widow with four children, used the Kshs.15,000 she asked for previously to buy wheat flour, and doubled her sales. She also used part of it to purchase palm leaves for sale. Her living standards improved with the profit she obtained.

She is now asking for Kshs. 20,000 to buy additional stock of wheat flour and beans to expand her business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes someday to open a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy additonal stock of wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a forty-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house and educate his children. 

He has been operating a pub for the last ten years and his major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. Godfrey needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Retamas De Mallcamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS DE MALLCAMAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Mercedes es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: crianza de animales y venta de los mismos, tejido de mantas a mano, venta de verduras, venta de leche, crianza de conejos.

La señora Mercedes, indica que  es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumentar su capital (compra de verduras)  mismo que comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Retamas de Mallcamaya" is starting its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Mercedes as its president. The members engage in various businesses such as raising and selling animals, producing handwoven blankets, selling vegetables, selling milk, and raising rabbits.

Sra. Mercedes says that this is the first time she joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter. She currently has a business selling vegetables that she has operated for many years. Mercedes learned this trade from her mother-in-law. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables. She buys her products at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her vending post. This business helps her to support her family. Mercedes is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: For the last seven years, Peter has earned a living by running a butcher shop in the town of Olkalau. He also works as a livestock trader, selling cows and goats to various farmers and other butchers in his area. He is 50 years old, married and the father of three children. He is requesting a loan for KES 15,000 to buy more meat to sell. In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business by selling more livestock to people in nearby towns. His goal is to increase his income so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Naranjos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras el coordinador es el señor  Nino quien se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, él está casado y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año respectivamente. El invertirá el crédito en pipián, quequisque, yuca…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Juana de 26 años quien vende productos Avon desde hace 1 año y Francisca de 63 años quien vende frutas principalmente naranjas y limones desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
The group "Los Naranjos" (the Orange Trees) is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people. Nino is the group coordinator. For the past eight years or so, he has made his living selling vegetables. He is married and has two children ages five and one. He will use the loan to purchase pipián (a type of squash), taro (a tropical root plant), yuca (cassava), etc.

The other group members are Juana, a twenty-six year old woman who has sold Avon products for the past year, and Francisca, a sixty-three year old woman who has sold fruits (mainly oranges and lemons) for the past twelve years.

loans.use: to purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora, pictured here, is 27 years old. His wife, Sreikun, is also 27 years old. The couple has one young daughter and they live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Bora is a farmer. He has his own motorized hand tiller and he also plows farmland for other farmers in his village and gets paid with fees. 

Bora is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a motorbike as there isn’t one for family use.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, in this photo, is 25 years old and is a widower with one son. She lives with her brother and parents in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yon is a garment worker. 

Yon is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use. She will also use it to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal, 45 years old and a married man, has five children. 

Jamal opened a store selling mobile phones and accessories. He also got an agreement with different phone companies to sell prepaid calling credit cards. 

Jamal has applied for this loan to add more phone accessories and more types of mobile phones to increase his sales.

loans.use: to add more phone accessories

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 25 years old and a single guy, lives with his four brothers, two sister and his parents.

Being part of a big family, Ahmad felt that he need to do something to support himself and help his family too, so he opened a mini book and stationery shop. Starting from scratch and reaching what he has now, has given Ahmad the courage to continue and want more.

He has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more products and add a new section for selling and wrapping gifts.

loans.use: to bring in more products and add a new section for selling and wrapping gifts

loans.name: Bahaa Aldeen

texts.en:
Bahaa Aldeen, 28 years old and a single guy, is the oldest among eight brothers and sisters.

Bahaa Aldeen started working on his own six years ago. At first he used to sell clothes in a stall in the street, but later he opened a small clothing shop in the market that is running smoothly. Now Bahaa Aldeen has started to distribute clothes to clothing stalls retailers to expand the business.

Bahaa Aldeen has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in a new summer collection of clothes to his store.

loans.use: to bring in a new summer collection of clothes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 47 years old and a married man, has five children.

Ahmad owns a shop that prepares and sells different kinds of nuts. He also sells snacks and candy on the side. Ahmad has applied for this loan in order to bring in more types of nuts to make with different seasonings to have variety in what he sells.

loans.use: to bring in more types of nuts

loans.name: Marìa Lucia

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con un  hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María  vive en  el caserío Rinconazo del distrito de Tùman y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza/venta de ganado porcinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también esta dedicado al transporte de pasajeros, es gasfitero  donde   le permite tener otro ingresos adicionales.
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados, y arreglos de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is thirty-two years old and married with two children in her care. She lives with her husband in a house that she owns. Quality of life in her community is at subsistence level. The majority of the town's inhabitants are independent workers who make their livings raising and selling smaller animals. Some also make their livings through agriculture. María lives in the small town of Rinconazo in the Túman district of the "departamento" of Lambayeque. They have only the basic service of electricity—they get their water from a handmade well. All the local families live under the same conditions.

María makes her living breeding and selling pigs and poultry. She raises these animals in the corrals outside her house. It should be noted that María has four years of experience in this business, which has enabled her to maintain the clientele that she has already established. She sells her animals to the major shopkeepers and traders in the area. Her husband makes his living transporting passengers. He is also a plumber, which gives them a little extra income.

At present, María has proposed to expand her inventory with regard to the raising and selling of animals, since it has proven to be a very profitable activity in the area. It is because of these circumstances that she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She will use this loan to buy balanced feed for the animals and make repairs to their corrals. This in time will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and repair her animals' corrals

loans.name: Faleeha

texts.en:
Faleeha is 39 years old and a married woman. Her husband works as a taxi driver since his retirement from the military. They have five children.

Faleeha started a small retail business at home selling children's clothes and blankets. She has applied for this loan in order to add more variety to the clothes she sells.

loans.use: to add more variety to the clothes she sells

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 50-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living on her own. She has her own life and she works really hard to live properly and as it should be. Souad opened her own clothing shop in 2001 after many years of experience selling clothes from her home. She always seeks to satisfy her customers and offer them good quality products. 

Souad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change her shop’s interior decoration. She notes that this will gives her a good mood and allow her attract added clients. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as she can.

loans.use: to change her shop’s interior decoration

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old and married to Priscila. The couple is blessed with three children. For the past year, Patrick has run a restaurant in Olkalau town. He was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients and this will be his first loan. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy more stock of maize, baking flour, and cooking oil. He will also expand his premises to be able to serve more customers. In the future, Patrick hopes to expand his business by opening a bigger restaurant to increase his income to be able to provide a good education for his children and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy maize, baking flour, cooking oil and to expand his premises

loans.name: Antonieta's Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Jesús Divino Amor” en la ciudad del Cusco, este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cueros, venta de golosinas, venta de golosinas y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo de mantenimiento de carros y transportes. 

La socia Antonieta nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis en el distrito de Sicuani pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Antonieta  se dedica a la preparación de pasteles, ella tiene un  pequeño horno donde prepara sus ricos potajes, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, manteca, leche, mantequilla y otras cosas más.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Jesús Divino Amor" (Jesus Divine Love) in the city of Cuzco. This communal bank is comprised of people who, in every moment, seek opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily efforts to achieve a better future for their children. The economic activities of the members include, for example: the sale of food, clothes, leather goods, and sweets. Others provide services such as the maintenance of cars and other vehicles of transport.

One member, Antonieta, was born in the Quispicanchis province of the Sicuani district, but now lives in the city of Cuzco. She is forty-five years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has two children. Antonieta makes her living preparing cakes. She has a small oven where she makes delicious stews. At this moment, she needs the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, milk, butter, and various other things.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and they promise to comply with the payment of their various debts within the established periods. (The members that appear in the lower part of the photograph arrived late to the meeting).

Cuzco is located in the district and province of Cuzco in the "departamento" of Cuzco in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It is characterized as a tourist attraction for its archeological centers, its historical district, its landscapes, its history, and for being an enchanting city of the southern region of the country. Cuzco is known for being a very commercial, tourist area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi, and for being the location of one of the seven wonders of the world, "Machupichu."

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, milk, butter, and other such things

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located at a busy local area and her primary customers are a cooperative tea firm. 

In addition, she runs a grocery store where she sells fruit. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes of climate greatly affecting tea. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to pay for hiring a farm for growing tea for selling. Her business goal is to buy land within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house and venture into another business of a boutique.

loans.use: to pay for hiring a farm for growing tea to sell.

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de sus derivados (cerdo frito, moronga, chicharrón, nacatamales…etc.) además comercializa cosméticos. El crédito que solicita es de mujer, tengo derecho el cual es para su uso personal. 
Ella lo utilizara en chequeo médico y medicinas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who butchers pigs and makes related products (fried pork, blood sausage, fried pork rinds, Nicaraguan tamales, and other foods). She also sells cosmetics.

Elsa is requesting a loan because, as a woman, she has a right to use it for personal reasons. The money will be used for a medical checkup and medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical checkup and medicines.

loans.name: Shahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Parveen is 39-year-old married woman, and by this relationship she has seven children: three boys and four daughters. Two of her daughters are involved in sewing and embroidery work and also contribute to the family financially, while others are free and don’t do anything. Shahida herself is also involved in sewing & embroidery work. Her work is home based. She gets orders from her neighboring customers and also from her relatives. Besides her sewing & embroidery work, she gives the required time to her household activities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband operates a mobile shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories to his customers and earns good profits. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing & embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will purchase a sewing machine for sewing dresses because her current machine is also used by her daughters which affects the deadlines. With the new sewing machine, she will be able to meet the orders on time and it will be a good addition to her business assets. She is confident about the positive financial results from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing & embroidery business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.  To earn a living, she sells shoes.  She has been in the business for ten years and has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has managed to access financial resources easily.  She has improved her living standards because her business has grown. She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 62 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Juliana who is also a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been in a farming business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of approximately KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Robert will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his last two children since the others are all adults. His hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm and also raise poultry.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Cristina De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Cristina tiene 37 años, nació en Guayaquil y viven con su familia. Está casada con Washington quien es sastre, tienen 3 hijas en etapa escolar que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Cristina nos cuenta que desde hace varios años es costurera, en la actualidad realiza chalecos que vende a las compañías. El trabajo no lo realiza sola ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien también sabe del negocio. No tiene horario establecido porque según el pedido aumento la producción o la disminuyen. También nos cuenta que el problema que tiene actualmente son las calles que por la época están deterioradas y esto dificulta la entrega de la mercadería. Cristina también vende químicos o productos de limpieza lo que le generan un ingreso extra en su economía. Con el préstamo va a comprar químicos, telas e hilos con esto desea aumentar su producción para comprar un vehículo.
texts.en: Cristina is 37 years old.  She was born in Guayaquil and lives with her family.  She is married to Washington, who is a tailor.  They have three school age daughters who attend public school.  Cristina tells us that she has been a seamstress for many years.  Currently, she makes vests which she sells to companies.  She doesn't do the work alone since she counts on the help of her husband who also knows the business.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she increases or decreases her production according the orders (she receives).  She also tells us that the problem she has right now is the roads which are in disrepair and that makes the delivery of merchandise difficult.  Cristina also sells chemical cleaning products which generates extra income.  With the loan, she is going to buy chemicals, fabric and thread with the hope of increasing her production in order to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and chemicals.

loans.name: Remond

texts.en:
Remond is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man. With the cooperation of his brother, he is able to satisfy his parent’s needs to live a proper life. Since 2010, Remond has operated his own solar energy system shop. He also works as a salesman at a local company. 

Remond is requesting a loan from the Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration. This sounds like a great idea to him as it will attract added customers and increase his sales. In the future, Remond plans to open other branches in surrounding areas.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration

loans.name: Esther Marcelina

texts.es:
