Esther tiene 65 años de edad pero es una joven de 20 años en espíritu, hace algunos años quedo viuda, lo cual fue una pena muy grande ya que su esposo era su mano derecha y sobre todo porque lo quería mucho; tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y esta casado pero siempre está al pendiente de ella y la quiere muchísimo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika entre otros, asimismo encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos el cual es “La laguna de Huacachina” y también se encuentra en Templo del Señor de Luren cuya fiesta patronal es en el mes de Octubre. A Esther le encanta mirar televisión cuando tiene un tiempito libre sobre todo sus novelas, ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado seguir una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Esther se dedica a su trabajo como costurera, ella realiza reparación de prendas, confecciona vestidos, pantalones, entre otros; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 5 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida, ya que lleva trabajando desde hace 20 años y su local se encuentra en una zona céntrica de la ciudad.

Esther está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar tela para elaborar buzos para los colegios de la ciudad, con esta mejora podrá confeccionar mayores prendas y mejorar sus ingresos y así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener una buena calidad de vida y apoyar a sus nietos”.
texts.en:
Esther is 65 years old, but she has the spirit of a 20 year old young person.  She was widowed some years ago.  This was a great sorrow because her husband was her right hand, and, above all, she loved him very much.  She has a son who is an adult and is married.  However, he is always looking out for her, and he loves her very much. 

Her house is in a city that is known for having a warm climate year round.  There is a lot of agriculture in this city, especially cotton, asparagus, and paprika, among others.  This is where we find one of the tourist attractions, “La Laguna de Huacachina” (Haucachina Lagoon).  You will also find the Templo del Señor Luren, whose patron saint festivities are in October.

Esther really likes to watch television, especially her novelas (soap operas), when she has some free time.  She could only attend school until the fifth year of high school, but she would have liked to have continued with a university education.

Esther devotes herself very enthusiastically to her work as a seamstress.  She mends garments and makes dresses and pants, among other garments.  She devotes around five hours a day to her business.  She is able to take care of up to ten customers a day.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is well-known.  This is because she has been working for 20 years, and her place is located in a central area of the city.

Esther is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she will be able to buy material to make sweatshirts for the city schools.  With the loan she will be able to make more garments and improve her income.  This way she will continue working and struggling each day to make her biggest dream come true:  To have a good quality of life and to support her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy material to make sweatshirts.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 43-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and three children. All of her children are studying. Her husband works as a car painter and has his own garage. Her husband is the one responsible for covering their needs, even though they’re united and cooperative. 

Zeinab started to work as a tailor from her home in 2006 after many years of experience in this domain. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from a kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase a new tailoring machine. This kiva loan will facilitate her work and allow her to attract additional customers. In the future, she plans to open her own evening dresses shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Juana Gricelda

texts.es: Juana tiene 51 años, vive en Guayaquil. Actualmente está separada y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Vive con sus hijos pero la casa es de ella. Nos cuenta que inicio el negocio de venta de abarrotes por iniciativa y apoyo de su hermana, no imagino que le gustara tanto sobre todo porque lo realiza en su casa lo cual le ha ayudado a permanecer junto a sus hijos. Su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, no tiene ayudante realiza la labor sola. Su mayor preocupación es las enfermedades. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres, abarrotes y productos de yambal. Juana nos cuenta que su meta futura es seguir activa con el negocio.
texts.en: Juana is 51 years old and lives in Guayaquil.  She is currently separated and her children are all adults.  She lives with her children, but the house belongs to her.  She has a grocery business, which she started on her own initiative with help from her sister.  She likes her business more than she ever imagined, mostly because it allows her to work from home and stay with her children.  Juana works from 7 in the morning until 9 in the evening; she works alone, without any help from assistants.  Her biggest concern is illness.  She will use the loan to purchase supplies, groceries, and Yanbal-brand cosmetics.  Juana’s goal for the future is to stay active in her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and supplies for her grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is married and the mother of three children, two attend school and one is still a toddler. Her husband is a businessman. They live in a rented property that has neither access to electricity nor piped water. Their largest monthly expenditure is food.

Millicent is a tailor and has been operating this business for two years now. Millicent's business is their major source of income. She works at home and her customers are the surrounding neighbors. She faces the challenge of seasonality. 

Her dream is to expand into a large business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their affordable rates. Millicent will use the loan to buy more materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et gère une salle de jeu depuis 8 mois. Il a choisi cette occupation  dans le but de gagner des revenus et de  subvenir a ses besoins sociaux mais  aussi aider ses parents. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 120 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de deux postes téléviseurs destinés a l’aménagement  de sa salle de jeu qui est localisé a proximité  du quartier de  sa zone d’habitation. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’attirer d’avantage la clientèle et d’accroitre ses revenus réguliers.
texts.en:
Omar lives in Senegal.  He is single and has been managing a game room for the past 8 months.  He has chosen this activity in order to have an income, to meet his social needs and also to help his parents.  

Omar has been a member of the UIMCEC since January 2008.  He is requesting a loan of 120,000 francs for the purchase of two television sets to be placed in his game room located in the neighborhood next to where he lives.   This loan will help him to attract a larger number of customers and to increase his regular income.

loans.use: to buy 2 television sets to be placed in his game room.

loans.name: Carola

texts.es: La Sra. Carola tiene 33 años y es madre soltera con un  hijo que tiene la edad de cinco años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida, ella vive en la zona Cañada el Carmen,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Carola utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de una heladera para mantener frescas su verduras y frutas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de una heladera para conservar sus productos,  la Sra. Carola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de utensilios falta de mesas y sillas y así  brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de utensilios para ir mejorando su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Carola is 33 years old and is a single mother with a five-year-old son.  She makes a living selling food.  She lives in the Cañada el Carmen neighborhood.  This is Carola’s first loan with the lending institution, and she will use it to purchase a refrigerator so she can keep her fruits and vegetables fresh.  She is asking for the loan because she currently doesn’t have a refrigerator for preserving perishables.  Carola’s other main challenge is a lack of utensils, tables, and chairs, all of which would make things more convenient for her customers.  Carola is therefore going to use her profits to purchase a variety of utensils, which will improve her business and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Félix Arnoldo

texts.es:
Félix tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él se ha dedico a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, tiene que adquirirlos en un lugar que esta a unos cinco kilómetros de su casa, este viaje le resulta bastante costoso, por que el transporte es caro.  

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, gastos para preparar la tierra y cultivar 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz; también comprara 100 pollos para engordarlos y venderlos cuando ya estén listos. Él desea realizar sus trabajos agrícolas aprovechando la época lluviosa. Manifiesta que al obtener buenos resultados con la cosecha asegurara el dinero para los próximos meses y maíz para su alimentación. Además, desearle brindarle a su hijo un futuro digno y construir o mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Félix is 23 years old. His is married and has a son. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. It was his parents who taught him.

To buy his agricultural materials, he has to acquire them in a place that is five kilometers from his house. This trip costs a lot because transportation is expensive.  

He is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay the costs of preparing the soil and plant 28,000 square meters of corn. He will also buy 100 chickens to raise and sell when they are ready. He wants to do his agricultural work to take advantage of the rainy season. He says that if he gets good results with the harvest he will have money for the coming months and corn for feed. In addition, he wants to offer his chlildren a good future and build a better house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for the costs of preparing the soil and planting 28,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Ubaldina Francisca

texts.es:
Ubaldina tiene 46 años, está separada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Vive en La Maná. Para que conozcan un poquito esta hermosa cuidad les comentamos que el vocablo La Maná, proviene de “LANG MANA ATTI”, que significa mina del Gran Rey, por existir en el subsuelo abundancia de oro y otros minerales, teoría que se fortalece con el hallazgo de objetos arqueológicos en especial en el sector de Estero Hondo. Según el vocablo colorado MANA significa “HERMOSO, GRANDE”, que se atribuye a la fertilidad y a la generosidad de su suelo, ya que es apto para todo tipo de cultivo. 
Retomando a nuestra entrevistada Ubaldina nos cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa en la cual al dejar de laborar le dieron liquidación. Con ese dinero inicio sus cabinas telefónicas ya que por su sector no había. Fue un gran acierto porque al ser lugar turístico le va muy bien, su horario inicia a las 7 de la mañana y cierra a las 9 de la noche. También vende tarjetas, recargas telefónicas, snack, ropa, tiene mucho surtido y eso hace que tenga mucha clientela. Con el crédito piensa comprar más inventario e incluir a su venta sabanas, toallas y edredones. En un futuro desea adquirir una vitrina y copiadora para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ubaldina is 46 years old, she is separated and has 3 adult children. She lives in La Maná. In order to know a little bit about this beautiful city, we will comment that the word La Maná comes from “LANG MANA ATTI,” which means Mine of the Great King, because there exists an underground abundance of gold and other minerals, a theory which is strengthened by the discovery of archaeological objects, especially in the area of Estero Hondo. Accordingly, the colorful term “MANA” means "beautiful, large" and refers to the generosity of the ground as it is suitable for all types of crops.

Going back to our interviewee, Ubaldina tells us that previously she worked at a company but stopped working there as it went into liquidation. With that money she began her telephone booths since there were none in the area. It was a big hit because it is a tourist area and it is going very well. She begins at 7:00 in the morning and closes at 9:00 in the evening. She also sells telephone cards, telephone card recharges, snacks, clothing, and many supplies, and that means she has many clients. With the money from the loan she will buy more inventory including sheets to sell, towels and comforters. In the future she hopes to buy a display case and a copier in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards, clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Reina María

texts.es:
La señora Reina tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Ella  se ha dedicado a elaborar tortillas, pues sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo.  

Para comprar el maíz, que es la materia prima principal, la compra a los agricultores de la zona o donde ella los pueda obtener más fácilmente.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para reparar el techo de su casa, porque se cayó y ya viene la temporada lluviosa y le urge repararlo. Reina se quiere proteger de la lluvia, tener un techo seguro para que no se le mojen sus camas, y descansar cómodamente y no estar con la incertidumbre que se le pueda caer el techo sobre sus hijos. 

Manifiesta que desea comprar una plancha para elaborar las tortillas ahí, por que le es difícil conseguir la leña y es muy cara.
texts.en:
Reina is 53 years old, is in a relationship, and has two children.  She makes tortillas for a living, which is a skill she learned from her parents.  She buys corn—her main ingredient—directly from farmers in her area, or wherever else she can get it most easily.

Reina is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo so she can repair the roof of her house.  Her roof has collapsed, and since the rainy season is approaching she urgently needs to fix it.  She wants to protect her home from the rain with a roof that is securely in place so she won’t have to worry about the beds getting wet or, even worse, the possibility that the roof might fall on her children.

Reina says that she hopes to purchase a griddle for making tortillas, since firewood is difficult to get and also very expensive.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 27-year-old business lady.  She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling cereals for the past four years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to cater to her child's basic needs. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Mercy will use the loan to purchase assorted dry grains to sell.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start pig rearing. 

Her hope is to buy a piece of land for farming and educate her child to university level.

loans.use: To purchase assorted dry grains to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, who are both studying. Mohammad is the one responsible for paying his family expenses and supporting them. As for his wife, she has been working as a tailor from her home. Mohammad has been selling clothes since 1998, and he’s well-known for his stylish designs. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop in order to increase his sales and therefore enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to open a new kid’s section.

loans.use: To renovate his shop

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou, 26, is a married woman who is responsible for two lovely young children. She has been engaged in agricultural business for nearly 10 years. She is proud that she is a farmer because through her farming business she is able to provide basic necessities for the family and ensure the sustainability of her living. She works in this business, along with her spouse, on their inherited farmland; they earn approximately $5 per day.

Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy lubricant oil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for farming purpose. She realizes that this loan will have a great impact on making improvements in her business, improving her financial stability and uplifting her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy lubricant oil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for farming purpose.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 62 years old and widowed with four children.  She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She started farming after getting her first loan from Faulu Kenya.  She has also improved her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Rachael hopes to grow her business.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Patria  Nueva Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Patria Nueva   esta integrado por siete mujeres trabajadoras y humildes e indígenas con deseos de mejorar sus negocios.
Son originarias de un pueblo llamado Patria Nueva  donde sus ciudadanos se dedican a la ganadería, agricultura y explotación minera,  sus bailes son las chilenas, celebran la  fiesta de San Martín  que se festeja el día  21 de enero.
Es una localidad rica en fauna y flora.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Josefa  de sesenta y un años de edad, se caracteriza por  su amabilidad.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Isaías un señor trabajador amable quien se dedica a la agricultura.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de  ropa desde hace cinco años, venta de pollos desde hace  tres años y venta de perfumes y cosméticos  desde hace cinco años.
Doña Josefa dice que se va a vender sus  perfumes a localidades vecinas como son nueva esperanza, el santo, el guayabo  el platanillo.
Ella decidió  tener sus  negocios  ya que le gusta mucho trabajar y ser una mujer independiente.
Uno de sus sueños es hacer crecer su negocio, desea vender perfumes por mayoreo para obtener más ganancias.
Una de las experiencias que por  ser una de las mejores vendedoras de perfume se gano una estufa de seis quemadores  y eso es lo que la motiva a seguir vendiendo ya que reconocen su trabajo.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más  perfumes  para la venta por menudeo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Hilda- se dedica a la venta de antojitos  mexicanos.
Lucrecia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Josefa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ignacia- se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Irma- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Lorenza- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.

Les dan las gracias por ayudarlas para que puedan mejorar sus negocios y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Patria Nueva and consists of seven hardworking, unassuming, indigenous women who want to improve their businesses. They are natives of a town called Patria Nueva where citizens are dedicated to cattle, agriculture and mining. Their dances are Chilean and they celebrate the festival of San Martín on the 21st of January. This is an area rich in fauna and flora.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Josefa, 71, who is known for her friendliness. She is happily married to Sr. Isaías, a kind, hardworking man, who is a farmer.

Doña Josefa has been selling clothing for five years, chickens for three years and perfumes and cosmetics for five years. She says she sells her perfumes in neighboring towns such as Nueva Esperanza, El Santo, El Guayabo and El Platanillo. She decided to start her businesses because she enjoys working and being an independent woman. One of her dreams is to grow her business. She wants to sell perfumes wholesale to make more profit.

For being one of the best sellers of perfume, she had the experience of winning a six burner stove. That has motivated her to continue selling since they have recognized her work. She requested this loan in order to purchase more perfumes to sell retail.

The other members of the group are: Hilda, who sells Mexican snacks, Lucrecia, who also sells Mexican snacks and Josefa, who sells Mexican snacks, as well; Ignacia, who sells tacos; Irma, who sells soft drinks and Lorenza, who also sells soft drinks. 

They thank you for helping them to improve their businesses and provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une jeune dame  de 27ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des bazins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, en ayant un salon de coiffure de grande surface. Elle voudrait plus tard avoir des enfants et assurer leurs éducations.
texts.en: Amélé is a young lady, 27 years old. She has been a hairdresser by trade and a retailer of cosmetic products since 2004. She gets her supplies from Lomé, and her problem is a drop in sales. She is on her fourth loan with WAGES and is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and some damask cloth. Amélé wants to reinvest in her business by having an expansive salon. She would like to have children later and to ensure their education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Mariée à un journaliste, Ami est mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier 05 ans. Pour aider son mari, Ami vend des boissons et des produits alimentaires dans une boutique. Elle exerce seule l’activité et achète à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut ouvrir d’autres boutiques dans d’autres quartiers et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Married to a journalist, Ami is a mother of three children, all in school. The first child is 12 years old, and the last is 5. To help her husband, Ami sells beverages and grocery items in a store. She operates this business by herself and makes her purchases in Lomé. 

Ami is requesting this initial loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise in order to respond better to customer needs. She wants to open more stores in other districts and to ensure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Perreta

texts.fr:
Perreta est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 6 ans.
Perreta travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits FAN MILK pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Perreta a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits FAN MILK. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Perreta voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et ouvrir une seconde boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Perreta is a 42-year-old woman who is married to an accountant. She has three children, who all go to school. The first child is 20, and the last is 6. Perreta has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells FAN MILK products to any customers in her shop. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is not being able to meet all the demand. 

Perreta has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy FAN MILK products. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Perreta would like to expand her business and to open a second shop. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to buy dairy products

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh habite au Sénégal. C’est un  célibataire de 29 ans qui s’active dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de légumes. Il  a pendant quelques temps travaillé pour le compte d’une tierce  personne et actuellement il veut voler de ses propres ailes. Il a une expérience de 8 ans dans cette activité qu’il a choisi dans le but de vouloir subvenir a ses besoins personnels et aider ses parents. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui lui permettra d’accroitre son fond de roulement,  de renforcer la cantine qu’il a acquise en produits. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  pourra l’aider à améliorer ses conditions de vie économique et sociale.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh lives in Senegal. He is a 29-year-old man who is unmarried and active in the commercial sector, especially in selling vegetables. For a while now, he has worked for a third party, and he currently wants to fend for himself. He has eight years of experience in this business, which he chose with the goal of supporting himself and helping his parents. 

Mr. Cheikh has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since January 2011. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs that will enable him to increase his working capital and to bolster with more goods his market stall, which he acquired. The growth of his profits will help him to improve his economic and social situation.

loans.use: to buy products to sell for business purposes

loans.name: El Hadji Aly Ndiaye

texts.fr:
El Hadji est un jeune menuisier qui exerce ce métier depuis près de huit ans.Il réinvestit ses bénéfices dans des activités génératrices de revenus et surtout dans l'embouche ovine.Ainsi, il a construit un enclos chez lui et achète fréquemment des moutons qu'il engraisse pendant des mois avant de les revendre.Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.En plus de sa petite famille, il a en charge ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs qui n'ont pas encore d'emplois stables.Afin d'augmenter ses bénéfices et faire ainsi face à ses lourdes charges, El Hadji sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter 5 moutons de race.
Son ambition est de faire plus tard l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
El Hadji is a young furniture maker who has been in this trade for nearly eight years. He reinvested his profits in revenue-generating businesses and especially in raising sheep. So he built a pen at his house and frequently purchases sheep, which he fattens for a few months and then resells. 

El Hadji is a married father with four children, of whom two are in primary school. In addition to his small family, he supports his two parents, as well as his brothers and sisters, who do not yet have steady jobs. 

To increase his profits and thus to cope with his heavy responsibilities, El Hadji is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy five head of purebred sheep. His ambition is to raise cows.

loans.use: to buy five head of purebred sheep

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and a married woman from San Jose, Talibon. She and her husband are both farmers. Lolita works hard to keep their farm productive because her family relies on it. She primarily grows rice crops to sell and earns about 5,000 PHP per month.

Lolita needs additional capital for her farm. She plans to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers. Lolita hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 54-year-old enterprising business lady. She is a widowed with two children.  She has been running a milk bar as a primary business and selling cereals as a secondary business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family members. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Juliet will use the loan to buy milk cans and a freezer. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy a dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and buy a freezer for storing her milk.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and a freezer

loans.name: Grupo La 20 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Grupo La 20 de  esta conformado por  cinco personas humildes e indígenas con deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Las integrantes de  este grupo son originarias de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca  donde  se elaboran los machetes grabados.
Una de sus artesanías  es la elaboración de la ropa típica de la región, es rica en fauna  donde se va lo que es  el higo, aguacatillo, palmaguapinol, caida y ámate.
La mayoría de los ciudadanos hablan  el idioma el idioma mixteco.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la  señora Ana Luisa de veinte dos años de edad, quien esta felizmente casada con el señor  Fredi con quien tiene dos hijas  Sonia y Analiz.
Doña Ana como mejor la conocen se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo desde hace cuatro años, también se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace un mes, nos cuenta que su tienda todavía no tiene mucha mercancía  ya que apenas empezó con eses negocio, la poca mercancía que tiene la compro de las ganancias de la venta de calzado.
Dice que los prestamos fue así como empezó el negocio de calzado primeramente compro los catálogos, después  fue a casa de sus vecinas a ofrecerle su mercancía  y finalmente  compro el calazo para entregar sus pedidos, se dio cuenta que le dejaba buenas ganancias y se vendía muy  así que decidió comprar calzado extra y venderlos en casa, pero a un sigue vendiendo  con sus vecinas y en  las colonias de su comunidad.
Esta muy contenta porque con sus ganancias  ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa  y a sus hijas  en los gastos de la escuela.
Dice que se compro un terreno en pagos   para poder ofrecerles un patrimonio a sus hijas  ya que con el dinero que gana su esposo están pagando el terreno y con sus ganancias ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: galletas,cereal,detergente,café,azucar,leche,verduras,refrecos,jugos,dulces,papel higienico,jabon,aceite,frijol y arroz.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Felipa Nery- se dedica a la venta de masa y molida de nixtamal.
Marbelia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juvenal Adauto- se dedica a la venta de artículos  domésticos.
Berenice Janeth- se dedica a la venta de venta de masa y molida de nixtamal.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos a  que  sus negocios mejoren.
texts.en:
This group is called Grupo La 20 and is composed of 5 unassuming, indigenous people who want to improve their life conditions. The members of this group are natives of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where machetes are made with etchings related to the culture of the region. Another of their handicrafts is the making of traditional clothing. The area is rich in fauna such as the prickly pear, “aguacatillo”, “palmaguapinol”, “caida” and “ámate”. Most of the citizens speak the Mixtec language.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Ana Luisa, 20, who is happily married to Sr. Fredi, with whom she has two daughters, Sonia and Analiz. Ana, as she is better known, has been selling footwear by catalog for four years. She has also been selling groceries for one month. She tells us that her store still does not have much merchandise because, as soon as she opened the business, the little merchandise she has she bought from the profits of her shoe sales. 

Ana says that loans were how she began her shoe selling business. First she bought the catalogs, then she went door to door among her neighbors to offer her merchandise and then she bought the footwear to fill their orders. She realized that she was making a good profit and was selling so many shoes that she decided to buy extra pairs and sell them from her home but she still continued selling to her neighbors and in districts in her community. She is very happy because her earnings help her husband with household expenses and her daughters with their school expenses.

Ana says they bought a plot of land in installments so that they could provide an inheritance for their daughters because, with her husband’s earnings they are paying off the land, and her earnings help with household expenses.

She requested a loan to purchase more grocery merchandise such as cookies, cereal, detergent, coffee, sugar, milk, vegetables, soft drinks, juices, candy, toilet paper, soap, cooking oil, beans and rice.

The other members of the group are Felipa Nery, who sells dough and ground corn, Marbelia, who sells Mexican snacks, Juvenal Adauto, who sells household articles and Berenice Janeth, who also sells dough and ground corn. They thank the Fundación for helping them improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 29-year-old single mother of four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.
She has been in healthcare services for twelve years working as a nurse. Her main goal is to build a permanent commercial house and educate her children at a higher educational institution.
Elizabeth wants a loan to roof her commercial house that she intends to rent.

loans.use: to roof her commercial house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a fifty-five-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and to educate his children. He has been a farmer for the last fifteen years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. 

However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and of hiring employees to help him expand his business. John needs a loan to buy fertilizers for his garden in order to boost production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On is 39 years old and married with eight school-age children. Two of her children quit studying and decided to work as garment laborers in Phnom Penh to help support their younger brothers and sisters, who are still attending school and need daily allowances. On aims to improve her family's status of living and provide her children with their basic needs, especially food and education. She engages in rice farming to generate income to satisfy her family's needs. She has been in this business for many years.
 
To improve the business, On is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase lubricant oil, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain healthier crops. She says that the loan will enable her to improve her business. She hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase lubricant oil, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain healthier crops.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married woman with one child who attends school. For the last 10 years, she has been operating a goat meat business. She sells her products at the market. Her primary customers are people from slaughterhouses. Mesalim owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes death of animals and theft to be a major challenge for her, and food to be her greatest monthly expense. She dreams of opening a butchery in the future.
She intends to use the loan of Ksh.10,000 to purchase goats for sale.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is progressing well and now requests a new loan to start a new business, selling cereals. Margaret has been running a fruit-juice business for the past six years, and now she wants to sell cereals alongside the fruit juice. She will continue to operate from home and sell to people in her local area. Her biggest challenge is the fluctuation of prices, and her goal for the future is to open a wholesale cereal shop.

Margaret will use the loan to purchase stock for her cereal business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her cereal business.

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de dulces. Tiene más de 41 años en este negocio, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, ya que le han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida, por su propio esfuerzo, ha sido admirable que ha mantenido este negocio a su edad, gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le brinda ha podido  mantener el negocio y el crecimiento de su clientela  solicita  un financiamiento para  poder comprar materia prima como:  azúcar, coco, bolsas, colorantes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Esperanza Estela has a business preparing and selling sweets. She has more than 41 years of experience in this business. This is not the first time she has received financing, and the loans have been a great help to her. Esperanza started her business by herself, so it is admirable that she has been able to maintain her business at her age. Thanks to the support the Fundación León 2000 has provided her, she has been able to maintain her business and increase her customer base. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase supplies such as sugar, cocoa, bags, and food coloring, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cocoa, bags, and food coloring, among other items.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina continues with her clothes trading business in Vanadzor city. Tehmina’s husband, who is a taxi driver, helps Tehmina with the business, particularly, he drives Tehmina to Yerevan in his car, where she buys merchandise for her business. Tehmina also brings clothes for her business from a neighboring country. 
Her business income allows Tehmina to provide for her family. She used her first Kiva loan to buy spring season clothes for her business. Now she is seeking a 900.000 AMD loan to buy tracksuits and summer season dresses, blouses, shirts, and chemises from a neighboring country to resell.

loans.use: to buy tracksuits and summer season dresses, blouses, shirts, and chemises from a neighboring country to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty-year-old single lady with four children. She sells new clothes and has been in the business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of twenty one thousand shillings. 


This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more new clothes for sale. In the future, she wants to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 35-year-old hardworking dress maker and a farmer. She is married to Benson, a causal laborer, and they have three children. She has been operating this business for the past 20 years with an income of KES. 10,000.00 per month used to support her family.  

The objective of this loan is to pay school fees for her three children that are in school. This will enable her to fully concentrate on the business while the children are in school. 

Her dream for the future is to own a large dressmaking shop for school uniforms and corporate wear for companies though currently she is challenged by the school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her three children that are in school.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene 32 años y es soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  5, 7, 12 y 17, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y también a la venta de cosméticos, ella vive por la zona de Guapuru, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maribel utilizara este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos para su segunda actividad y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y los precios altos, Maribel sueña  poder construir su casa, la Sra. Maribel es una persona muy trabajadora que sola saca adelante a sus hijos, con la esperanza que un día sean profesionales.
texts.en: Maribel is thirty-two years old and single. She has four children, aged five, seven, twelve, and seventeen. She sells food and cosmetics. She lives in the Guapuru neighborhood. This loan is her first with Emprender. Maribel will use this loan to purchase cosmetics, which is her second business, and in that way increase her working capital. The lack of working capital is the reason she is requesting this loan. Maribel faces challenges in her business such as competition and high prices. She dreams of building her own home. She is a very hardworking person who works to provide for her children by herself. She hopes that one day they will have professional careers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics for her second business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Sebastián tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al destazo de animales, fue su papá quien le enseño. Esa ha sido su profesión, además de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, cerdos y a la agricultura. 

Los animales como vacas, cerdos y bestias, los compra en los tiangues y también en los lugares cercanos.
 
Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar ganado, cerdos y todo lo referente al destazo. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias, tener una mejor calidad de vida, que le permita tener mayor capacidad de adquisición, para una mejor alimentación, un buen ahorro y mejorar hasta su vivienda. 

Sebastián desea instalar una crianza de cerdos para el destazo propio, por que es una actividad rentable según comenta.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 48 years old, he is married and he has two children. He has been making a living slaughtering animals for over 20 years. It was his dad who showed him. This is his profession, and he also makes a living buying and selling livestock, pigs, and in agriculture. 

The animals like the cows, pigs and beasts he purchases in the livestock markets and also in nearby places.

He is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy livestock, pigs and everything related to slaughtering. This investment will help him increase his business and improve his earnings which will allow him to have a better quality of life with a higher capacity for acquisition, for a better diet, good savings and to improve even his housing.  

Sebastian wishes to set up the raising of pigs for his own slaughtering, because according to him it is a profitable activity.

loans.use: to buy livestock, pigs and everything related to slaughtering.

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es: El señor Juan Amílcar tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos, ya son mayores de edad. El señor se dedica a la apicultura  El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, primeramente el trabaja con una empresa que realizaba este negocio y después, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo hacerse de su propia actividad que es el que actualmente posee. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar pinza, combustible, trajes entre otras cosas que son útiles para la producción de miel. El mayor desafió que siempre ha tenido él como empresario ha sido que algunas veces no ha tenido muchas ventas. De allí nace que su mayor sueño siempre ha sido establecer una empresa familiar y que sus hijos puedan trabajar con él.
texts.en: Juan Amílcar is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. He is a beekeeper. He started his business ten years ago. He started working with a honey production company, and later, with time, lots of effort, and savings, he was able to start his own business, which is the one he currently owns. He is requesting this loan because he would like to purchase a smoker, fuel, and bee suits, among other useful items for honey production. The biggest challenge he has always had as a businessman has been that sometimes he has not had many sales. As a result, his biggest dream has always been to establish a family business so that his children could work with him.

loans.use: to purchase a smoker, fuel, and bee suits, among other useful items for honey production.

loans.name: 06.02.06 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hằng is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make votive objects and sell. She has a business manufacturing votive objects .

Hằng is 47 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has 2 dependents.

This is Hằng's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Hằng has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 50-year-old businessman. He is married to Joyce, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been distributing cakes for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Julius will use the loan to buy a bicycle for transporting cakes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle for transporting cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses and labor cost of planting potatoes

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is 27 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph and they have two children who are both in school.

Mirriam is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She is optimistic that her farm will do better using the loan.

She hopes to grow good produce which will enable her to earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est un homme de 41 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis 9 ans dans le commerce de produits de quincaillerie. C’est une activité de commerce qu’il a choisi pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2003. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir des articles de quincaillerie qu’il commercialise et renforcer le stock de son local. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices il pourra ainsi espérer  a améliorer   ses conditions de vie sociale et économique  pour une meilleure prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Mbaye is a 41-year-old man who lives in Senegal. He has been the business of selling hardware products for 9 years. It’s a business he chose to be able to pay for his personal expenses. He has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch since August 2003. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs with the goal of acquiring hardware materials that he sells and to reinforce his local stock. With the increase of his profits, he hopes to be able to improve the social and economic conditions of his life to be better able to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 49 years old. He is married to Lydiah and together they have four children who are all in school. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, after he was introduced to the organisation by his friend, who is also a member. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Stefanos

texts.en:
Stefanos is 54 years old. He is married to Rosemary and together they have four school-going children. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 12 years, with a good income.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to the organisation by his fellow group members who are KADET LTD clients. He will use the loan to purchase potatoes, fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm.

He hopes to expand and improve his farming business in order to cater for his children's education expenses.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, fertilizer and pesticides for use on his farm.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha est est un homme marié. Il est père de trois enfants.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'aviculture qu'il pratique depuis 5 ans.Il gère ainsi un grand poulailler dans lequel il élève des poulets de chair et des poules pondeuses.Il vit seul en ville car sa famille est resté au village.Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour compléter son capital et acheter une camionnette de transport de ses produits.Il a déjà payé deux prets de 150000f et 200000 f à l'IMCEC. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité au point d'employer ses frères restés au village.
texts.en: Moustapha is a married man. He is the father of three children. He is in the business of livestock farming, notably poultry farming, which he has been doing for 5 years. He runs a large henhouse in which he raises broilers and laying hens. He lives alone in the city, as his family stayed in the village. In order to increase his revenues, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 f to complete his capital and buy a transport van for his products. He has already repaid two loans of 150,000 f and 200,000 f to IMCEC. His ambition is to grow his business to the point of employing his brothers who stayed in the village.

loans.use: to buy a transport van for his products

loans.name: 6.01.12 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Liên has a retail business selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase footwear to sell.

Liên is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 06.01.12 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She lives with her 2 dependents.

In 2010, Liên joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women in order to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in her business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Ndèye Souaré

texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme mariée depuis 27 ans mais qui n'a pas d'enfants. Elle vend des légumes, du poisson frais, du poisson séché et de l'huile de palm au grand marché de sa localité.Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi pour appuyer sa soeur dans la prise en charge des frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Afin d'augmenter son stock de produits, elle sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du poisson fumé, de l'huile de palm, du poison séché et des légumes.Son ambition est de construire une maison et de la mattre en location.
texts.en: Ndèye is a woman who has been married for 27 years but who doesn’t have children. She sells vegetables, fresh fish, dried fish, and palm oil at the big market in her area. She uses her profits to meet her needs but also to help her sister pay for her children’s education. In order to augment her product stock, she is seeking a loan of 300,000 f to buy smoked fish, palm oil, dried fish, and vegetables. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, palm oil, dried fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman who has six children. Three of her children are enrolled in school while the other three are still below school age. Nyamvula lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a meat goat business and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Nyamvula aspires to open a butchery in the future.
With the loan of 20000 KES, she will be able to buy more goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy more goats for her business.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 47 años, está casada con Glicer, con quien tiene 2 hijos; de 17 y 10 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Ella es una mujer creativa e ingeniosa. Se dedica a la confección y tejidos; chompas, gorras, chalinas, ponchos, etc. Todo lo que produce lo ofrece a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que llegan a su distrito, para ello cuenta con un puesto de ventas ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. 
Por su parte Glicer, su esposo, trabaja con telares artesanales confeccionando artículos más grandes; como tapices y mantas. Con este trabajo coordinado, Enma puede brindarles a sus hijos una educación decente y una calidad de vida mejor. “Me siento orgullosa porque todo lo que tengo lo obtuve a base de esfuerzo en casi 20 años”, menciona. 
Ahora viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos, al por mayor. Para esto tuvo que contactarse con personas quienes le hacen pedidos en cada campaña.
Una de sus metas es adquirir un local propio donde ofrezca su mercadería sin lidiar con la competencia.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y éste sería su crédito número 5 con MFP, dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en ocasiones anteriores. Por otro lado se siente cómoda trabajando con las socias de su banco comunal porque comparten los mismos intereses. 
Enma invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos; como lana sintética y lana de oveja y alpaca; además de otras artesanías para surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Enma is 47 years old and married to Glicer. They have two children, ages 17 and 10. She and her family live in a rented house in the District of San Pedro de Cajas -- Tarma.

Enma is a creative and clever woman. She sews and knits sweaters, caps, scarves, ponchos, and other items. Everything she produces is offered to domestic and international tourists who come to the district. For this reason, she has a vending post located in the central part of the city. Her husband, Glicer, produces much larger handwoven items, such as tapestries and blankets. They coordinate with one another in their work. Enma is able to provide her children with a decent education and a better quality of life. "I am proud because everything I have is the result of almost 20 years worth of effort," mentions Enma. She now travels constantly to the city of Lima where she can sell her products in bulk. In order to this, she had to contact people who were willing to place orders for each season. One of her goals is to rent a shop of her own where she can offer her merchandise without having to fight against the competition.

Enma is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Futuro" (Wome of the Future). This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She says that she will be punctual with her payments, just as she was on previous occasions. Enma feels comfortable working with the other members of her Communal Bank because they share the same interests. She will invest the money she requested in the purchase of materials for knitting, such as synthetic wool and sheep and alpaca wool. In addition, she will acquire additional handicrafts so that she can restock her vending post.

loans.use: to buy materials for knitting and to acquire additional handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, es dueña de una Bodega donde vende abarrotes. En este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable y puntual, agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en los momentos  que mas lo  necesitaba, así como también en la educación de sus hijos, las ganancias que obtiene lo invierte en la educación de su hijo, y también pudo comprar artefactos para su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, menestras por sacos, leche, fideos.
texts.en:
Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 28 years old and has two children. Violeta has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. During this time, she learned how to be responsible and punctual. She is grateful for all of the support that has been given to her in moments when she needed it the most. In addition, she has been able to provide for her children's education. The profit she earns will be invested in her son's studies and the purchase of furnishings for her home.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, sacks of dried vegetables, milk, and noodles.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, sacks of dried vegetables, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Justo Leonel

texts.es:
Justo tiene 32 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en un aldea rural de el municipio de las Vegas Santa Barbará.
Justo se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de café, banano y hortalizas. El desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra ya que este ha sido un  patrimonio familiar. El vende sus cultivos por temporada, el café lo vende a las exportadoras de la comunidad y el banano lo produce cada mes. El esta muy contento con las utilidades que le generan estos productos.
El esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF de 17,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y poder sacar una buena cosecha para la venta.
Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos para así obtener una mejor rentabilidad en sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Justo is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Las Vegas Santa Barbará.

Justo is a farmer who grow coffee, bananas, and vegetables. For the past 10 years, he has been cultivating the land that has been part of his family's assets. He sells his crops based on the season. The coffee is sold to exporters in the community and the bananas are produced monthly. Justo is very pleased with the profits that have generated from his products.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 17,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizers and compost to maintain his crops. This will help him achieve a good harvest that he can sell. His goal is to continue investing in the maintenance of his crops so that he will achieve greater profitability from his harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en: Oyundelger is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. His children study at the college. He runs a welding business and it has been 14 years since he started the business. He does welding of home stuffs and truck trailers. He has many regular clients not only from the local areas but neighbouring villages. He has his own workplace inside his fence. Oyundelger is a talented man in the field and says,  "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing some new and necessary materials for the business like saws, saw blades, cutter and irons". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy necessary materials such as a thick and thin irons, saws and sawtooth for the business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials such as thick and thin irons, saws and sawtooth for the business

loans.name: 06.02.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Loan has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Loan is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 06.02.05 Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is widowed with 12 children and only six of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a pub business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and iron sheets to build more rental rooms. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She works from home and sells to all categories of people but on retail and from her home. Florence works seven days a week and her monthly expenses include rainy season and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully stocked pub and educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they were giving out timely loans. She lives in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and iron sheets to build more rental rooms

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 1 year old. She describes herself to be social and jovial. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as plaiting, weaving, blow dry etc. and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located within a busy and viable town and her primary customers are women. In addition, she also runs a taxi. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to own many more salons within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the profits generated to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty cosmetics.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma  is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She has a business selling new clothes. She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of new clothes. She has been in this business for four years. Besides this clothing business she also operates a restaurant. Her major challenges include seasonality, defaulters and ever increasing prices of new clothes. Fatuma aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start importing clothes from China and build her own house. Fatuma decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills   and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new clothes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cebiche y raspadillas, ella está muy feliz porque las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a poder mejorar como persona, así como la manera correcta de cómo criar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de papa, camote y maíz que utiliza en la preparación de las comidas que vende en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank "Lucero" (Bright Star). She is 30 years old and has two children. Victoria sells "ceviche" (marinated seafood) and "raspadillas" (shaved ice). She is very happy because the training she received from her Communal Bank helped her to improve as a person. It also taught her the correct way to raise her children.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, and corn that will be used in the preparation of dishes that she will sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sweet potatoes, and corn for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Karla Samira

texts.es:
Karla tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años con los que vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Karla desde hace 7 meses ella inicio un negocio de Club de Nutrición. Esta actividad la desempeña vendiendo productos nutricionales para bajar de peso. Ella obtuvo este negocio afiliándose a la empresa distribuidora de los productos que ofrece, dice que le va muy bien y que tiene muchos clientes, además las ganancias que tiene son favorables que le han ayudado a tener mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
Solicito su primer préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras para compra productos de nutrición y otra parte para comprar mobiliario que necesita en el negocio. Para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su plan es prosperar en su negocio, mantenerlo estable  para darle a sus hijos la preparación adecuada y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Karla is 27 years old, married, and has three children (ages 4, 6, and 10). She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Seven months ago, Karla started a nutritional club. This business involves selling weight loss products. She obtained her business after she affiliated with a distribution company that offers these products. Karla says that she is doing very well and has many customers. In addition, the earnings have been quite favorable since they have helped her family to have a better lifestyle.

Karla is requesting her first loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that she can buy nutritional products. Part of the loan will be used to buy furnishings that she needs for her business so that she can provide better service to her customers. Her plan is to prosper her business and maintain stability for her children so that they will be adequately prepared and not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products and furnishings for her business.

loans.name: Toribia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia esta emprendedora tiene una actividad económica que es la venta de comida corriente de forma ambulante y por encargo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace doce años lo cual cuenta con mucha experiencia  a lo largo de los años ha adquirido muy buena clientela gracias a la buena calidad de su comida, en la actualidad ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos alimenticios para la elaboración de la diferentes platillos de comida que ofrece a su clientela como. Carnes de res y cerdo, pollo, arroz, frijoles, aceites, verduras, sal, en otro productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia is an entrepreneur whose business is selling food on a door-to-door, order basis.  She has been in this activity for 12 years, so she has plenty of experience.  Over the years she has built a good customer base thanks to the high quality of her meals.  Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients to make the different dishes she prepares.  These ingredients are beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, oils, vegetables, salt and other items.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, oils, vegetables, salt and other products.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es dueña de una bodega de abarrotes, le gusta ahorrar porque gracias a ello ha podido amoblar su casa y sigue ahorrando aún más para construir el segundo piso de su casa y así poder cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante de comida y pueda vivir mejor. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la bodega como leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, menestras.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 28 years old and has two children. Regina is the owner of a grocery store. She enjoys the savings because they helped to furnish her home. Regina continues to save even more because she wants to add a second floor to her house, fulfill her dream of opening a restaurant, and be able to live better.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her store such as milk, sugar, rice, noodles, flour, and dried vegetables.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, flour, and dried vegetables.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 69 years old. He is married to Veronicah, and they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past thirteen years.

This will be his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer, enabling him to expand his farming.

He hopes to purchase another plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is taking another loan of 50,000 KES to expand her existing business. With the loan, she will be able to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. 

The previous loan increased her monthly income, and since then, her standard of living has improved. Mazera is so grateful to Kiva and Yehu for giving her loans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es socia del Bancomunal Lucero, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre de un niño, tiene una bodega de abarrotes. Ella dice que en FINCA Perú  aprendió a ser puntual responsable y a ahorrar y lo seguirá haciendo para que en el futuro pueda abrir un minimarket. Está muy feliz de que sus ahorros están creciendo cada vez más, y así ella puede hacer planes para  usarlo de manera correcta. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, bebidas.
texts.en: Gabriela is a member of the communal bank "Lucero".  She is 24 years old, has a son, and runs a grocery store.  She says that it was in FINCA Perú where she learned to be responsible and how to save money, which is what she continues to do so she can open a minimarket in the future.  She is very happy about the fact that her savings are growing more and more, so she can make plans to use them correctly.  The loan she is requesting is to buy groceries for her store, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil and beverages.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es: Ruth empezó su negocio con un capital que le regalo su esposo, quien trabaja en como jefe de importaciones en almacenes Boyacá. Le ha ido tan bien que actualmente ya es mayorista. El negocio lo administra ella sola pero tiene vendedores que ganan un porcentaje de dinero de acuerdo a sus ventas. Sus productos como la ropa, bisutería son de fácil aceptación para los cliente por eso tiene acogida. Como su negocio es el comercio el cual tiene mucha demanda su dificultad es la competencia pero sigue adelante. Su inspiración también son sus hijos quienes estudian en la escuela. Con el préstamo va a adquirir más mercaderías con lo cual desea crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth began her business with money given to her as a gift by her husband who works as head of imports at the Boyacá stores.  Business has gone so well for her that now she is a wholesaler.  She manages the business by herself but has salespeople who earn a commission on sales.  The products she sells are clothing and costume jewelry, which are good selling products among her customers.  Since her trade has a high demand there is a lot of competition, but she continues to get ahead.  She also is inspired by her children who are school-aged.  With the loan she plans to buy merchandise to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is still running a women's and children's clothes trading business in Vanadzor. Thanks to her occupation Marine is able to support her family. Recently Marine’s rented stall condition has been improved and Marine says that this positively affects her business. Thanks to the changes, particularly separate entrances to stalls, customers feel more comfortable. 
Marine used her first Kiva loan to develop her clothes assortment. Now she is asking for an 800,000 Armenian drams loan to buy jeans, summer season blouses, skirts, trousers and children's clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy jeans, summer season blouses, skirts, trousers and children's clothes to resell

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is a 67-year-old farmer from Akhmeta District, East Georgia. She is a widow and lives with her 28-year-old son, Zurab. He is a dentist, but is currently unemployed. Elene is a pensioner. She also takes care of a dairy cow and produces dairy products. Half of the products are consumed by her family, and a small surplus is sold in the village. Her family's total average monthly income is 200 Laris. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Elene has requested credit for the setup of a dentist's office for her son. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiatives by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages a provision for business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor. Regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income, the country's rural poor lack access to credit products. 

With the credit, Elene will purchase all the needed equipment to start a dentist's office for her son. The office will serve the population of Akhmeta District. Since Zurab is a good professional, with relevant work experience, he will have many clients. For the first year, Zurab will use the entire profit to cover the loan as well as to reinvest in the business. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve, and the family will, in case of need, have enough income to be able to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the setup of a dentist's office.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 32 años, está casada con Edwin, con quien tiene 2 hijos (de 13 y 8 años). Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas- Tarma. 

Se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales. Lleva en esta actividad más de 14 años, exactamente cuando nació su primer hijo, ya que antes apoyaba a sus padres en actividades agrícolas. Ella tiene gran destreza en los tejidos, desde niña tejía la ropa de sus muñecas, ahora que tiene una responsabilidad familiar convirtió su pasatiempo como su principal medio para adquirir ingresos. En la actualidad cuenta con telares con los que elabora mantas y tapices de diversas lanas. “Es más rentable tejer con lana de alpaca, pero también es arriesgado porque se invierte mucho”, menciona.
A la vez, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en la producción de maca, cuyas ventas también le son favorables. Esta pareja se dividen los roles, mientras Silvia está en los tejidos, Edwin en los cultivos, así piensan lograr sus objetivos, uno de ellos es terminar de construir su casa. En el futuro quieren abrir una tienda de ventas en su casa propia, ya que no cuenta con un local propio.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste sería su crédito número 3 con MFP, como en anteriores ocasiones, menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte se siente contenta de compartir su trabajo con personas responsables y solidarias dentro de su banco comunal.
Silvia invertirá el crédito de la siguiente manera: la mitad para comprar materiales para la confección de tejidos (lanas, hilos de colores) y la otra mitad para adquirir semillas para iniciar una siembra de maca.
texts.en:
Silvia is 32 years old and married to Edwin. They have two children, ages 13 and 8. She and her family live in their own home in the District of San Pedro de Cajas -- Tarma.

Silvia produces handwoven crafts. She has been in this business for more than 14 years, which is almost the same age as her first child. Prior to this, Silvia helped her parents with the farm work. She possesses great skill for knitting. As a girl, Silvia made doll clothes. Now that she is responsible for her family, she converted her hobby into her primary source of income. Silvia now has looms that are used for making blankets and tapestries out of different types of wool. "It is more profitable to weave with alpaca wool, but it is also a risk because I have so much invested in it," she says. Right now, Silvia and her husband are busy farming, specifically the cultivation of maca root. Their sales have been favorable. This couple splits up the duties. Silvia spends her time weaving, while Edwin looks after the crops. They plan to accomplish their goals, one of which is to finish the construction of their house. In the future, they also want to open a shop in their home since they do not have a place of their own where they can sell.

Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Futuro" (Women of the Future). This will be her third loan with MFP. Just as she was on previous occasions, Silvia says that she will be punctual with her loan payments. She is pleased to be sharing in the work of her Communal Bank with other responsible and supportive people. Silvia will invest her loan in the following manner: half will be used to buy materials for weaving (wool, colored thread) and the other half will be used to buy seeds so that she can start another crop of maca root.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving and seeds for planting maca root.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace un año. Se dedica a la  crianza y venta de animales domésticos y se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con su ahorro, está agradecida porque las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseñan mucho a trabajar correctamente y  educar  a sus hijos. Su meta es comprar un mototaxi  para que sus hijos puedan trabajar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para los animales que cría.
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Communal Bank "Fuerza" (Strength). She is 40 years old and the mother of five children. Serafina has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year.
